KRLsoPvuwhLjrHglk9sUYA.text: Ordered the chicken enchiladas.   Over cooked chicken in a tortilla with gravy.  They added a side of something unidentifiable.  Yuck!!!

Y70sFUbBsmJ47Oj_sUDmWQ.text: "Oh, look," I say, "They have a 'to-go' counter."  But not an expedient one.  You order off of the menu and then they make your food, and if you're me, then they make the wrong thing and have to make it again.  So twenty minutes later, you can go catch up with your friends and actually board your plane.  They did give me the botch, though, which was a nice bonus.  Food was a little bland and not quite as delicious as I'd been hoping for.  I also found the breakfast sandwich a little difficult to eat while I was sitting on the plane, worrying that I wouldn't be able to bite into the giant bread without squirting over-easy egg onto everything surrounding me.    Sadly, it's about the only restaurant in this terminal, though it looks as though they might be building another one.

ZFuFRLj5ok-H1fhEKVsCoQ.text: Currently waiting in line, so I can't rate the food. And I don't really care about the price (it's an airport, that's expected). But a 25-minute wait (and still counting...) for a take-out order of tacos and a torta is completely unacceptable, especially in a virtually empty airport with the tables in the restaurant area only half full.  They're somewhat new. Hopefully the next time we're here, these serious problems will be resolved. And if it's not, hopefully they'll be replaced by the next time after that. They need to fail if they can't figure this out.  *Update*: After a 30-minute wait, I decided to run to the plane (which was otherwise boarded and ready to go). After I asked for my money back, the employee at the register did not respond to me at all, then went to the kitchen window gave me one of the two to-go boxes and said it would only be a little while longer. I couldn't wait, so I figured we'd just split the one meal. Of course, it wasn't even our order. So in addition to my awful experience, that means someone else who was waiting also did not get their order (because I got it). And the torta we did get was not very good.   Ultimately, I share some blame in this. I read these other one-star Yelp reviews and still went there anyway. That was a huge mistake. This place is a disaster.

DbWOq4qWJzYKSXxgBd4IQA.text: Ordered the fish tacos and they were good. As everyone has laminated very expensive. Great place to chill and relax while you are waiting to catch your flight. I'd go back if I was in the Phoenix airport.

3U4bXLDZrfYjMSPlRwbk8g.text: On our way to Cabo and had 2 hours in the Phoenix airport so based upon a previous amazing experience hiked the 2 miles from our gate area to gats A/B to hit Barrio Cafe. Again it was amazingly good and for an airport restaurant that is something. Prices are decent. Food is tasty and ample. Service was attentive. Dos Equis Amber on tap. What more could you ask?  We actually liked it much more than the original Barrio in downtown Phoenix. We think you will too so give it a try. Oh, the Mexican food we had was every bit the equal to what we had in Baja.

Hmy8fn4DMBvDuKsCP8-p1Q.text: Usually airport restaurants don't stand out, but Barrio Cafe in the D gate area definitely does. When I have a layover in Phoenix I go out of my way to eat there. Food is excellent and service always fast, friendly and efficient. I always make a point to order their French Press coffee. It is the best coffee I've ever had. Barrio is worth the long walk from the C gates.

4JDmejTzmAXts7Ty9M6CvA.text: Good drinks-not horribly overpriced.  GREAT drink specials - $11 for a 20oz GOOD beer and a shot of anything!  Can't beat that!!!  Friendly bartenders and decent food.    You know, what can you REALLY expect from an airport restaurant.  You don't go for the food.  If you're really hungry enough to eat at the airport, then don't expect 4 star restaurant quality.... and don't judge the airport restaurants as such.   This really is the only bar/restaurant option in the Southwest terminal.  I found a security guard and asked about some of the other restaurants in the airport and was told that unless you want to make the 20-30 minute hike around security to get around to some of the other gates, you should just stay put.  I'm actually glad he suggested this- even though I had a 3 hour layover.  The menu LOOKS impressive... but again, remember where you are.  I did happen to be starving and needed a little something to soak up the drinks I would be consuming during my loooong layover.  I ordered the poblano burritto.  For an airport burrito it wasn't bad- but it was slightly lacking in flavor.  I asked for something to add some spice and they provided me with three different kinds of salsa to try, which did make it a little better.    What most impressed me was the service.  The bartenders and servers were all upbeat and smiley- very friendly and definitely created a welcoming atmosphere.  The drinks were not HORRIBLY over- priced and now if you order a beer, you can add a shot of ANYTHING for $4!  I got a shot of Don Julio (which might normally be at least $10+) so ended up paying $11 for a 20oz Modelo Especial and excellent tequila.    And other reviewers were right.... this is definitely a great place for eye candy!  All the hotties seem to flock here...

3yCMuDu38geJyyRHjTTwsA.text: First of all we LOVE barrio cafe and barrio queen in Phoenix and Scottsdale. If we had to pick a last meal it would be their guacamole, pork tacos and posole. This is why we were soooooo excited to see barrio at the airport. Very sadly it did not measure up at all :( The posole soup did not have hominy and radishes like at the other restaurants, it seriously seemed like they just threw pork in some broth. We also ordered the pork tacos and all of the pork was very fatty, I couldn't even eat it. I know this is not like the other restaurants at all, something is very off here!

GpcMzi1NzHhsPvH5MuQajg.text: If you are in Phoenix for a layover on Southwest this is the spot. For airport dining this place is well above on food quality and quick attentive service. It's great for people watching and although much of the food is stylized versions of Mexican food, including a lot of quick prep, reheat and serve kind of food, it's actually pretty tasty. I've had the shrimp tacos and they are pretty tasty, a bit over battered but good just the same. The fish taco plate is actually pretty decent size portion (4 tacos) for the money. Considering you are trapped for food choices the prices aren't too out of whack. The only major downside, and it is out of their control, is the volume of a/c being pumped into the terminal creates cold/windy spots in the dining room.

zUtq1Jpy10d4bsF8erCksA.text: The 2 scariest food words for me? "Airport food". (actually "goat cheese" but play along). this palce is legit, though. and very reaonably priced for an airport place. try the chili verde burrito.

tNvpEZM-4sDjjnWZ0HtWtg.text: I travel about 80% for work. Anyone that says this is the best airport food ever clearly do not travel often. The food is gross and overpriced and the service is terrible. My trip and meals are company funded so cost is not the issue for me -- it's all about food and service quality.   Too bad Sky Harbor management isn't reading the reviews - maybe it would improve. Clearly Barrio's is ignoring them. I am so disappointed that they removed all of the other restaurants from D Gates.  If you have time I recommend you walk over to C Gates....There's a small Paradise Bakery, Cinnabon, and (if you must) a Burger King.

yVcMhzDfY3V_mjpH0akt6A.text: Horrible customer service. Our expectations at any airport are not high - many travelers are hurried, lost, rude, etc. understandably it's a tough job. If you are feeling up to being ignored from the moment you walk in to the moment you walk out, this is the place! The Barrio cafe in the Phoenix airport seems to have perfected "the annoying customer" role to a tee. Don't even try to be polite unless you have the overwhelming desire to pay a lot of money for what looked to be "ok" food and treated like a nuisance. Can't comment on the food as we walked out. I give them an A+ for perfecting horrible customer service, however they will not be getting my $$$.

i0_rayJ45Qd1oeOS4bW6GQ.text: Overpriced greasy food,  not to mention rude staff and waitress. When appetizer was presented she threw plate at our direction and walked off. The bloody Mary was good but I will not come back.

W8YQNiCX1lAB6xeXrJcxKw.text: Best chicken enchiladas I have ever have.  Service ranges from outstanding to horrible depending on your server. If the service was consistent I'd give the enchiladas 5 stars.

PziK-qiQjuHBtnAL9mI5Yg.text: Literally had to wait 17 minutes to have a draft sam Adams poured.by the time it got to me I had to chug it so I wouldn't miss my flight. Server apologized after the fact saying they had to change the keg. I would have like to have had the option at first to switch my choice so that I could have enjoyed my beverage.

RSknX5WZp8J24elKNXQNjg.text: Love original Barrio Cafe and Barrio Queen in Scottsdale so thought airport Barrio was a blessing.  Had a bowl of posole and SMALL glass of wine for 26 (before tax and tip). Flight delayed so order the  "large" 8 oz wine. Get the ck-$22.74. For ONE average size/quality glass of wine.  OUTRAGEOUS. The staff shares that owners been spotted once in whole time since place is open. Way to rip off your loyal local customers.

_IBqIsZRSeELFZiySfPspQ.text: Ridiculous excuse of a restaurant and being from AZ...it's embarrassing. Taking gouging to a new level. We asked our server for chips & salsa while we waited, she said "sure, but I have to tell you it's a little bag with just a few chips and a small cup of salsa for $9.00. Really? The service was average, food - exceptionally average and the prices...? Def not going back.

-b4EwW9_U6UclUFmcmfBHQ.text: Arizona burro was really great. ... strange it comes with fries or salad, should come with chops and hot sauce but fries were good too. Chipolte ketchup nice and spicy if you like chipolte.

vEg_fjqd5sTdhIoWzPPCzw.text: I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by the chilaquiles! I order my food to go because of the limited time before my connecting flight. When at the counter the cashier asked how I wanted my eggs...I was slightly confused because I thought they were always mixed in. Needless to say I just said scrambled. The taste was amazing! The cheese was phenomenal and taste was incredible! The chilaquiles were prepared perfectly, they reminded me of the ones i enjoyed while living in TJ. I would definitely go back.  Try it.

diXaf7gzY3tiQRWV6JAadw.text: Our flight to Minnesota was delayed due to bad weather, so we decided to have lunch in the Phoenix airport.  We noticed Barrio Cafe and decided Mexican food in Phoenix should be pretty good.  The food was excellent and the portion sizes generous.  We did not try any alcoholic beverages, but the margaritas looked good.  I know the restaurant is in an airport, but the meal was a little expensive.  If the food wasn't so good, I'd be more upset at the prices.

yq-a4Ka15vcNF3mRcCpNBg.text: I got their tacos. All seem extremely far from what you desire. The nachos come with half an avocado. A couple left before ordering next to me and another group only ordered drinks. Only come for the drinks.

snxlyC_137DgE5RZtc5Riw.text: Today I decided that I'm going to eat at a place I've never been. I'm at the D terminal so checked this place out. Was greeted and seated right away. I just ordered water for my drink and that came pretty fast too.   Ordered their "famous" pork tacos with seasoned fries. The food came in literally minutes so that's great. Looked good and it smelled good. The fries came with spicy ketchup which was good but the fries were not crunchy on the outside. Seems like they have been waiting for me in the kitchen under the hot light. Seasoned? Deff not! I had to add salt. The "famous" pork? Not sure how bec there's no flavor on it. I had to add salt and I don't normally add salt to my food. It's just that there's no seasoning. I couldn't taste the flavors described on their menu. The corn tortillas tasted like they just took them out of the package. They didn't taste like they were even heated. The salsa was bland and by the way for a Mexican restaurant, they don't have rice and beans.   For $15, deff not coming back. The service is good and fast, hence the two stars but I'm not spending $15 on tacos that don't have flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They looked good but there&#39;s no flavor what so ever.

8Ji_JegfmYR2s44H2RIanw.text: Burrito was microwaved: the very middle inside meat super hot & steaming enough to burn your tongue, outter meat & sauce barely luke warm. Fries had clearly been out all day as they were stale and room temperature. Flavor was good- meat was tender and sauce flavor on point, but I wouldn't come back for the food unless I had a 4+ hour flight ahead of me and I hadn't eaten. Could have been great, but just had me wondering how long ago it was made.

l-9k9xMOgkHC3FiMEq3eDw.text: While I do love Barrio Cafe, the airport location has fairly poor service. It took forever to get a waitress to my table, and then I had to ask three times and several people for water with my meal. I will say I ordered the Mexican prepared soup and it was fabulous. I believe the food is at least four stars, but the pricing is quite high and service inconsistent at best. They need to get this right as the regular restaurant locations, at least the food, is five stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This soup is a complete meal and delicious!

pplQRt2YaQKY69luBjSlvQ.text: I am only giving this place 2 stars because the food wasn't that bad. I got nachos and chicken quesadilla. Chicken was dry but nachos were tasty. Thing is, I got food poisoning. I didn't mind the prices, but perhaps this is an alert to management, besides food poisoning, this can be a 3-4 star place.

lCWX2Zyp8c7-bjkyddbvlA.text: The food was great, but my $15 margarita seemed to be missing a shot.  It's a large drink and I initially thought maybe I couldn't taste any Patron because of the amount of juice in the drink, but I after drinking it all, I never tasted or felt any patron in the drink.  I mentioned this to two different people who never responded. I think for $15, my drink should have come with the alcohol in it.

GXpMiz6qrPRDcmV8L4hruA.text: I couldn't believe how good this place is and it's inside an airport! I searched out their place in Phoenix, off the hook too!

jQZS_vyld8M59dwIIziHFA.text: Drinks are no bueno- chips are extra extra hard- even cut through my gum! Water came with no ice, asked for it twice. Mimosas had the nastiest orange juice ever and the Bloody Mary tasted disgusting. $13 guacomole has about 15 limes in it or tasted as it did.

71HK9nDIetEP_Gsuq5kGbA.text: On a layover between flights, we decided to have Breakfast at this location basically because it was next to the gate. I ordered the Arizona burrito ($13) and it was delicious . Also enjoyed some delicious Fresh orange juice.  Service was fast and the restaurant clean. Btw the restrooms are just outside the restaurant entrance. If you have time between flights, this is a good place to grab a meal. Only complaint...not exclusive to this restaurant....why do you seat customers on top of each other when the restaurant is about 20% full? When we were initially being seated, the hostess proceeded to take us to a table right next to another couple, a two top right next to them.  We asked if we could have a another table so that we would give them and us  privacy considering the restaurant was not full.   Then the hostess proceeded to seat a gentleman right next to us, literally an arms length away...when there was clearly 10 to 20 tables she could've been seated him at... So, we got to listen to him talk on the cell phone while we ate breakfast and he got to listen to us talk...Just asking for some commonsense and thoughtfulness please.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 7am mimosas

ME4qJc0D_0tr8U2pzL4REg.text: If I could rate Zero stars I would. Horrible salad - not worth 17 dollars.  I requested the Roquefort in the side - came with the crumbles all over the salad - I explained to the waitress I had requested the cheese on the side, she reluctantly took my salad back returned with the same salad still with the cheese - no explaining. The salad was awful as was the "balsamic" vinaigrette. I suggest go next door!

QBHVVTE3jXkMWpzTZMqIkg.text: Service issues ! Usually come here when I travel to AZ because the Mexican food is different and well prepared. This guy Pedro is so annoying and lazy. The place got pretty busy right after we arrived for breakfast . The young lady was seating people, taking orders, cleaning tables. She called out for help in both English and Spanish. He kept putting her off and never really made himself useful. Irritating! Addendum: food quality deteriorated. Not coming back

qgMvkRD6Wa_pdRB4s49TTA.text: The Chiles en Nogada was phenomenal! I've never reviewed an airport restaurant before because I never thought they were anything special. Barrio Cafe is worth it.  I got the Chiles en Nogada, which is a "roasted poblano pepper filled with chicken, dried fruits, apples and pears all in a delicate almond cream reduction." I was floored with how good it was. Pricey at $26, but wow. Amazing taste, texture, and presentation.  My girlfriend got the Tacos de Pollo Poblano, which include "grilled spiced chicken breast, roasted poblano peppers, caramelized garlic and onion, tomatillo cream reduction, goat cheese, pine nuts, and crema Mexicana." Delicious and filling at $14.  To top it off, our server Carma was attentive to us and every table around us. She made the hectic dinner rush look like no big deal. A True professional. We will definitely be back for more.

SN71wYAjXAecXPx307_E3g.text: Surprisingly delicious! We had a goody-packed chicken salad, burrito, & tacos. Everything was of quality, flavorful, & delicious. Service was crazy fast & attentive. Prices were great. Portions nice.

XDIfPcZuCrdn6n7SV-HI5Q.text: Coffee was practically water, "fresh squeezed" grapefruit juice was worst juice I may have ever had, eggs were cooked fine, small portion... fruit plate was pathetic and cost $9... please don't eat breakfast here!

PzbvblC6hCeah-QdcLA5Tw.text: Very disappointed in this place.  I have Mexican food all the time but we had a layover and wanted to try it.  Food is pricey but what can you expect at the airport, service was slow and portions were small.  I ordered the shrimp tacos for 14.00 and literally received on shrimp per taco.  Crazy we have had better for the price.

abHWduyNwonwNgz_757rOA.text: I frequent the airport for business & look forward to eating here as I have not had one bad experience!  There chiliquile's is amazing as well as pork burrito with eggs.  I highly recommend this place to all my family and friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BzBGOQ5Z2kqp1evtvn8UOw.text: The service and food are great. Pollo poblano! So delicious along with the organic margarita. Our server was very knowledgeable of the recipes. Very good!

moI3gEBCdcSvtakcwT1MXw.text: Tries too hard. Bad service especially when even slightly crowded. Plating of food is like throwing random stuff on plates. Rude servers. Food not great.

hpHHaAuXbuSL7vvtRYFVXg.text: If you've ever dined at one of Chef Silvana's creations and are expecting the same experience here, keep walking. To be fair, I do not believe Chef is associated with this place other than the naming royalties.  The service is hurried and the efficient wait staff are obviously anxious to flip tables. "No, I'm not finished with my guacamole" as we stare at a half dozen chips and a fair amount of guac. It is an airport eatery after all. The food is better than most Mexican themed airport restaurants but as stated before, it ain't THE Barrio Cafe.

BmD8sAfQUVU5dPHbhYo54w.text: Prompt service but poor food quality. Carne Asada was served cold.  Steak was ordered medium rare and served sliced, well done, dry and not fresh. Tasted like it was precooked and sat under heat lamp for an hour. French fries were stale and cold. I realize this is an airport eatery but if you're going to charge $23 for an entree, it needs to be better quality. Service was not an issue.

F2sboe92QqW1AnIpnFmwkQ.text: I understand we are at the airport but this place is awful. Yuck. Although the one in gilbert is okay.

p34MnJggz8q4krSTcZ-RRw.text: Sat at the bar while waiting during my layover between flights.  It was cool to see the bartenders have some rapport with some of the passing customers.  It gave it a "divey/neighbourhood" feel.    I had the fish tacos which were OK.  The fries that came with it kinda sucked.  They were pretty stale.  The ketchup was pretty good, it had spicy kick to it.  At $15 for three tacos however it's a bit over priced even for airport food.  Sitting at the bar you're able to witness some stuff.  I should've followed my instincts and just pushed my tacos away.  Hygiene wasn't great with the staff.  One bartender got choked up and started coughing...immediately proceeded to make drinks with out washing his hands.  Another came by to pick up some cut limes clearing her throat over them, they were unwrapped. This is after I received my meal and got given silverware that looked a little dingy.  To make matters worst...a 1/4 way through my flight my stomach did not feel so good.  Luckily my flight was short and my place is near the airport, otherwise I would had blown up the bathroom (no pun intended)  Overall...stay away from here if you plan on grabbing a quick bite between flights.  It's overpriced and mediocre at best...and food poisoning on a flight is no fun. The star is more for the atmosphere of the bar area.  Bartenders should clean up a bit more though

zqysSprjsl2E2cGzWSezIg.text: First time trying Barrio Cafe and so glad we did thanks to a long layover at Phoenix airport. The Paso Poblano tacos & burrito were both the best we've ever had!!! Moist and nicely seasoned chicken and sauce with goat cheese (no rice/beans) :). Far from the usual gut bomb at other Mexican restaurants. Of course it's on the pricey side but well worth it. Serves fresh coffee made in a French press. The caramel filled Churros made the perfect finishing touch! Great service too! Highly recommended. We'll definitely dine there again on our next trip... time permitting.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GEYVr78LV5HmEMUKVnnWiA.text: How can HMS take a first class operation and make such a mess of it.  Will never spend money in this location again.

XzQxe64YJv-J0kn3xgh2qg.text: Cochinito pibil is phenomenal. Melt in your mouth pork. Very, very flavorful. It also comes with a marinated onions, salsa, and savory (smashed) potatoes. I was skeptical at first, but it blew my nomnomnom mind at first bite. Wow... Some of the best Mexican food I've had.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nRCrk_WO81krsiZxeXvghw.text: Airport food has a much earned reputation.  I have to say, I was very pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food, drink and service here.   Yes, sticker shock at looking at the menu (and the resulting tab). I had a margarita and it was served in a tall glass. I have to admit I was expecting more juice than Tequila - what a surprise!  I could taste the tequila in a well balanced margarita. They did well by my husbands gin martini too.   I ordered the pork tacos and my husband had the chicken tacos. Yes. They were spicy. If you like heat - they were delicious!  The pork was their special slow roasted pork and very tasty. The chicken tacos had a delicious cream sauce. We chose the house salad.  The salad was made from salad greens and topped with onions, tomatoes and crumble cheese. The salad was lightly dressed with balsamic vinaigrette. Presentation was excellent.   All in all, almost worth the price - 4 stars for great food - minus one star for pricing.

Cx4VCg7mcXKg98usc-yJXQ.text: Dammit I was in the mood for their "famous carne asada fries" first of all, dogs eat better. The meat tasted rubbery and chewy. The fries were soggy. Very pricey but it is in the Airport. However how can you label something the special when it taste like yesterday's garbage. I had to get tums to relive the pain of gas and upset stomach. Will not be going back.

fh39-nZD00gCcEsmyD2COQ.text: If you're looking for the slowest service imaginable, why don't you stop on by. I would have ordered food but didn't care to wait. The service staff is rude and I couldn't believe the amount of BS it takes to order a beer. Bad form Barrio, get your act together.

B__abEPJVEh7EhUoszgVaw.text: Airport chow , ordered fish tacos with fries also came with a small salad plus 3 caronas. About 35 bucks. Tasty, great grilled  fish tacos with cabbage and avocado..would have been better but the tortillas just were not as warm as they should have been ..it was slightly above average for airport chow...i would still  recommend trying this dish

HaKK8HDQRouKeaLE9SAFyQ.text: Plenty of outlets for travelers that are in need of some power- both at the bar and in the booths. Extremely fast service and food delivery (a plus for quick layovers) - but they're not quick to make you leave if you've got time to kill, either. I ordered the chicken tacos (tacos come in corn tortilla- burritos are larger in a flour tortilla) - seriously delicious. Keep in mind I'm a goat cheese fanatic - so that played into this crazy happy review.  I will definitely make this a regular stop for upcoming PHX layovers!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Goat Cheese Tacos w/ Side Salad &amp; Chardonnay

3t8QAY0MskROkns8HvLC9g.text: Rating was due to service experience with wait staff.  Host staff were on point, give those girls kudos!  Coffee - fabulous

IIBQ5N_vqitiMKwylnfL-A.text: They would have gotten at least 4 stars, but when I asked for a tea to go the great server told me she couldn't do that. However, she was happy to up sell me a bottle of water.   Service was also at first to be seated and then to have an actual server stop by the table. It was a busy time as loads of flights had been delayed and they were working to close up shop around 9pm.   Once I got a server...everything was great. Table side guacamole was good as were the pork tacos.   I would stop by again if I was on a delayed flight in terminal 4.

Pc6342jRfOW9gGjstfHnNQ.text: So. You are trapped inside security and need a meal. I give this place three stars for trying. Their prices are high, even for airport food ($26 for enchiladas with sides?). I have dined here only twice, but would recommend sticking to the smaller and less expensive menu items. My enchiladas seemed to have had the cheese slide out if them, and the number of shrimp was shrimpy. I had tried the pork tacos before, and they were very good. The spicy mashed potatoes were also tasty. They do have outlets at their bench seating so you can charge your devices.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Camaron enchiladas with mashed potatoes

_JBLIwSZKM_ZrtzrXw5nNQ.text: Avoid this place. The wait was looonnngggg just to get out drink orders. The chips & salsa were stale & the salsa was bad. I brought this to the attention of the waitress & she told me the chips were not stale, they were just made from homemade corn tortillas. I get how chips work. They were stale.

3w7Yw20ljw2fFJuudUsq7w.text: Kevin, the bartender should probably find work that does not involve contact with other humans. What a joke...seriously can not understand how he would be hired...I blame Managment for that one. Food was pretty good. The Suizas was delicious and my waitress was very attentive for how packed it was for the 4th travel Rush. Sit away from the bar and you should be fine. Would have been 4 stars if he wasn't involved. Best bet may be for you to pack a lunch.

LwsuYP0_uMHEFXjE5cCezg.text: Been twice, good service.  Food is ok, not great not bad.  Has four peaks peach on tap so I'll be back.  Standard airport pricing.

ugAKbFgRv4FF4ohWluqjdQ.text: After being asked by a fellow yelper to elaborate, here it goes.   We approached the hostess and asked for a table for 3 plus a high chair. When she jokingly said "no" I laughed and proceeded to ask for a menu to which she again replied "no"! I guess this was her attempt at humor, however after the first time, it seemed to have lost something. By the way, she never really indicated that she was joking.  So, $50, 1 ceasar salad, 1 spinach chicken whatever salad,  a kids chicken tender meal w/ browning apples, and a failed attempt at a pollo poblano burrito later we were on our way to catch our flight.   Oh, in between sitting down and paying the check, the service was sub-par to say the least and worse than the cold, soggy burrito and rubberized tenders. The waitress never picked up our menus and never once smiled.   While I understand we ate at an airport, this is unacceptable. Next time I'll be sure to read up on more yelp reviews before I waste a meal here.   They'll be hearing from me soon.

9grhZi4nD5pb_fvfEXxheA.text: Hubby and I had dinner here during unexpected flight delay and was seated immediately. Started with house margaritas on the rocks - arrive in small glass but was decent. Hubby got the Arizona burrito and I the shrimp tacos both with side salads. Fresh avocado slices topped the tacos even though not mentioned on menu - which made them perfect. Only complaint was each taco only came with 1 shrimp and chips/salsa were not included on table with our meal as we would see at other similar restaurants (maybe not custom @ airport setting?). Hubby described pork as a stewed pork with good flavor in large flour tortilla. Service was super quick, friendly and food surprisingly yummy. Would eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House Margarita.

GEWjRfz4JuJRu1grUnZ57Q.text: I arrived super early for a flight and was looking for a place to enjoy some breakfast and a beer (way early in the morning). I happened upon Barrio cafe, which was right next to my gate. I sat at the bar, ordered a beer, and took a look at their menu. They don't have a very big selection, especially for breakfast. I can't fault them for that - they're a restaurant in an airport. They're also expensive - again, I don't fault them too much for that. The food came out quickly, the bartender was nice and helpful. It helped me accept that my vacation in Arizona was over.

n_JyZ3KpaXLBM2ZDd0IPqg.text: Too many drain flies for me. Food was cold. Bloody Mary was oh so nasty. Move onto another terminal or go to La Grande Orange.

hOmIW2ug55Igl28SZQbBMg.text: I know this place already, cause there's only one other option in this terminal and they close earlier. I'm too lazy to walk 1/4 mile to the next terminal.  I figured "I'll pay $15 for 3 "ok" tacos" and went to stand in line. Nobody ahead of time.   Restaurant was not busy. Big bold letters on the sign that say "please wait to be seated." After 5 mins i sat myself and the mysterious hostess arrives out of nowhere and says "you need to wait to be seated."  I just stared at her and didn't respond at all.  She handed me a menu.   I took this is validation it was OK to be seated here.  I wait 10-15 mins without anyone asking me if I wanted a water, etc.  I got up and left.  Never again will I come here.  P.s. I fly in and out of Phoenix about 6 times a month.  I would have eat here every time.  Average bill of $20 x 6 times a month x 12 months = $1,440 in lost sales.

-ob62l5o_eQ8tWO1eSnwpQ.text: The food and service are quite good. I didn't have a cocktail, so I can't comment on that. I had the Shrimp quesadilla appetizer, the presentation and taste were really good...but, I have never understood why they give you a dish with shrimp in it with the tails on! I don't want to have to dig in my food with my fingers to remove shrimp tails. It would be so easy for them to remove the tails in the kitchen before they cook it.  So many restaurants do this, I just don't get it.

6blxf6DV6fI50JgzEcRLmw.text: I wish I could give a review of the suit here but unfortunately no one seemed interested in serving me any... Came in about 7:30 on a Monday night while waiting for a delayed plane. Had to wait about 10 minutes to get seated even though several people glanced at me with disinterest. Once I got seated, I waited another 10 minutes to see if I was going to get any attention from a waiter. Nope. Finally stood up and walked out, past the other 10 customers and 8 or 9 staff...

F3iposIs7jge_Rn-3g3WDA.text: Came here to grab a quick bite for breakfast, the eggs and sausage is pretty good. The yogurt parfait doesnt come with fresh fruit and lacks portion for the price. This place is pricey and the waiter didnt check on us after we were served, we had to flag her down in order to get the bill.

Fra4oiyIuhSqW22cJrWY5w.text: Great food, excellent service. Refreshingly flavorful. The pork was slow cooked, just perfectly flavored. Enough spice to make your eye water a bit but not burn your mouth. Really perfectly prepared. The spring salad was just right with Oaxaca cheese crumbles. Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BYfCyx4hjfjHdcwZ4oQuGg.text: Fast service and good food.  I enjoyed coffee and a bfast sandwich.  It came with REAL chorizo.  Probably not the wisest thing to eat before a flight but it was tasty.  A bit messy though.  The atmosphere was as nice as a general airport restaurant can be.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

C6-kzcVyLtCSIbM8F3NMMw.text: Good food, nice selection of tequila, horrible airport prices. It is what it is. If this was a local joint instead of the airport I would go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2Iwc9QjPkF6kesSWvi9m3w.text: Hmmm. Mexican food here is truly authentic and yummy. Had their guacamole and it was $12.00 but so we worth it. Their burritos are so delish and so are the tacos!  They're well known for their roasted pork and it is one of the tastiest I've ever had, so tender too. Service is quick so they're sensitive to the travelers needs. A must try!!!!

G0AnwEkZVBJ8W5oYU8I3wQ.text: On a short stopover we were HUNGRY and had two choices in our terminal.  Barrio Cafe looked like they had seating available and hey, Mexican food!  We were seated and greeted and provided water right away.  Our server was friendly and attentive throughout our whole meal.   When I looked over the menu, I discovered it wasn't really your standard Mexican food and the husband was disappointed not to find beans and rice on any of the dishes.  We both ended up going with tacos,  I got the fish tacos and I think he got the chicken tacos.  All I know is they were FANTASTIC. Both came with a small green salad with a spicy vinagerette that was tangy and zesty.  The husband never gets vinegarette and he loved it. My tacos came with good sized slices of Avocado and were super tasty.  It was the perfect amount of food and my fish was battered and crunchy on the outside and flaky on the inside.  We were skeptical when we ordered, but both agree we were very happy with the choice. If you're in Sky Harbor awaiting a flight, I totally recommend Barrio Cafe.  Its not your regular Mexican Restaurant, but the tacos are delish.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barrio Cafe Fish Tacos.   YUM

po9qgRCo4J3VsUCIaMQ2jg.text: I walked in as a skeptic with an attitude, and bartender Kenneth totally crushed it with kindness, and food of course!  I wanted to stick to protein as much as able. No need for papas and pan. Kenneth took care of my hangry-ness with three eggs over medium and chorizo. Fantastic.  I ponder why no egg chorizo and queso creation on the breakfast menu, other than a green chili item. Just sayin'.

8azWnZddY2QIttQLB8VVxQ.text: Nice place to grab a drink and some  Mexican food while waiting for a flight. The server was busy so the service was kind of slow but we were not in a hurry so all is good. The beers  were cold and the Guac was delish!

ubJPeWX9iurY610sHx1_BA.text: Food was fine, and the dog is cute, but my waitress was more interested in petting the dog than waiting on her tables. Not sure if she washed her hands after, either.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6Vy7Zpfo_MQXt5o3depmCQ.text: D GATE ---$14.50 for tacos but $8 for a 20 oz beer...evens out for an airport. This place has some good food!! The skirt steak tacos were delicious with house made balsamic vinaigrette salad(a bit spicy)...also delicious. The service was a bit slow..8ish on a Friday. But worth it...still made the flight. Would return again.

9jqv_b-ggdJ9ChUsKal2ww.text: Since I'm going to New Orleans and probably won't eat any Mexican food, figured I need to have something before I take off.   This place is Term D and well decorated. I rally like the theme and paintings.   Service-very slow moving, everyone around me had to ask several times to drinks, check, or other. Maybe more staff.....  Food-opted for Posole Verde because I was looking for something not so heavy and warm. This hit hit the spot, prefer when you get to add the sides, but this place served them already mixed in.   Couple notes on prices:  Chips & Salsa-$9 Chips & Guac-$16( if not more)   Over priced in my opinion, but I'm sure airport space isn't cheap.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pozole Verde-savory and warm.
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool decor-menu

pg_nLDOQ0VIIC9rN--Ozjw.text: I though this airport restaurant was pretty good. My grilled mahi  mahi tacos were very tasty and they let me substitute the cheese with goat cheese.  Everything was fresh and nicely prepared. I would have given five stars if there was a larger portion of fish. The iced tea was excellent.  Service was very good too.

odC4_8wuPGGZAJuBrcZN2Q.text: Rude. Rude. Rude.  After a HUGELY overpriced and underwhelming experience, Kim who was working front of the house refused us a to-go cup of ice claiming it was company policy and telling us to go elsewhere. She wouldn't even let my husband ask the bartender for it.  We literally walked 50 feet to a Peet's Coffee where we hadn't bought anything. They graciously furnished us with all the ice we wanted and didn't treat us like peasants.  Even if their food had been good (it hadn't) or their service attentive (it wasn't), the way that woman treated us at the end was not excusable.

7VP7gn5KhogvVt3N0SseTg.text: Killing time at airport , might be fine for a beer but the food was awful , the tacos tasted like microwave chicken , with slimy cheese no flavor , tortillas were very gummy I ordered chips and they were 10 bucks ! Barely edible chip a tooth every time u bite them ! I wish I would of eaten a sandwich prob the worst Mexican I have ever had in my life worse than Taco Bell ! And that's not Mexican

IkArBBhh4Iv4kwF-WyqQ6Q.text: Disappointing!  Nothing better than getting to the airport and having a drink and decent meal before start if vacation.  We walked around all of terminal 4 and decided on this restaurant.  We had tacos and nachos.  We asked for the nachos first but got the tacos.  Tacos weren't even completed garnished.  Homemade ketchup for the fries was not good.  Nachos were gross!  The cheese tasted like melted butter.  The lady at the table next to us was literally mopping her food with her napkin.  Plenty of other places in terminal 4 to choose from.

iJBcfCip9cLFkzijY2CrjA.text: If you're in the airport, definitely go here! I love this place for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The service is extremely fast and the food is actually really good for airport food. I always get a traditional two egg breakfast which comes with meat, potatoes and toast. Can't go wrong there. The steak tacos: AMAZING! What a hidden gem. The only negative is that I think the fries are way too over seasoned. Someone in the back has a heavy hand! Of course it is pricey, but it's the airport so that is to be expected. This is my go to spot when I fly out of Phoenix, and I travel a lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

huVJRonELGALyYLHmsG4Bw.text: Never ever eat here!  They ignore you completely!  I was seated by the hostess and waited 21 minutes.  When I left after being ignored, the hostess and server laughed because I was unhappy!

tEECrSyhMcWFG86uR_RFhA.text: Food is good!  I got the nachos which were great and a Bloody Mary which was made with tequila (and was great!)  A little pricey but large portion so not dinging their score.   If you have time to kill at the airport visit this place

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum!!  Nachos!

clu8k3UrxeNnXZ7mCV7XhA.text: I decided to try Barrio out while waiting for a Sunday evening Southwest flight back to California. It was a great place to relax and enjoy a drink and salad for 45 minutes while waiting on a flight. Cocktails were expensive but that's to be expected in the airport restaurant/bar.

ULBHS4r2SwhTONhHuMXR9w.text: Pros: Not jam packed, service was quick and professional.  Cons: came here specifically for a bloody "Maria". Ordered a double (wife did too). Tasted good, but I'm pretty sure they gypped us on the alcohol as neither of us felt one bit different when we finished them. Thus the disappointing rating.

YQZFrsLMF55Rk40yguU6SA.text: Disappointing, even by airport standards. I ordered the breakfast sandwich to go. Although it's advertised as being served with chorizo, I barely found more than a few chunks... 1-2 ounces at most. The cheese was a poor attempt at being "melted." The bread was extremely chewy, like I had to use some strength to pull it apart with my teeth. The scrambled eggs and pico were the only redeeming components, but at $13.00 they were hardly worth it. Obviously the high standards that are applied at her other restaurants are not even a consideration at the airport location. Such a shame.

Tt-4YNyBocG8_RetY0iQGA.text: I recently tried out Barrio Cafe while on a layover in Phoenix, Arizona and I have to say... as expected, the food and drinks were far too overpriced for what they were. I ordered just a traditional margarita on the rocks with salt and in my mind, I imagined it to arrive in a big wide rimmed margarita glass but instead it came to me in a tiny quarter size larger than a shot glass! World's smallest margarita, mostly made up of ice. I then decided to try a chicken quesadilla and found it to be the exact opposite of what a traditional quesadilla is.... it was an open faced corn tortilla more like a tostada but limp... okay I guess it was a taco?? So strange. After tasting it I then realized they made the dish with cream cheese. So strange. Needless to say, I will not be back.

U4Xhh7nu76vm8abxlj2jYw.text: Eh what can I say, its airport food. This place is not the worst Mexican food I've had at an airport but it definitely wouldn't do very well as a regular restaurant. I had the carne asada tacos and thought they were quite bland. The cheese they added to them was more sad than anything and it was dry and crumbly. My boyfriend had the AZ burrito and it was again, just ok. What I found to be really weird was that they had no chips on the menu( or at least from what I saw ). My boyfriend got French fries instead of chips since that's what they offered. I thought this was a bit odd as the flavors clashed a bit. I'd probably try the place next door the next time I went to PHX.

pNMg5U0VKLj2QbxmEsWC3g.text: Pricey and the food taste old. Had the fish tacos at 11am they were fries in oil that should have been replaced fries were also so sad the place is cute service ok but the food can use both flavor and freshening up. I would not visit again.

E9GaPfU5XtN6ywceHG0BUQ.text: Solid airport option - lunch on a Friday in terminal 4, by D gates. Went for the house pork tacos w fries- filling food! Good stuff, esp for an airport. Service was a bit slow but very friendly staff and great music- soak it up for a while!

u4NNF75uGDcAjlZyL2TRiw.text: I love Barrio Cafe in the Barrio on 16th St, but the airport location is leaving. I was seated for 7 minutes, completely ignored by the wait staff and I got up to leave. A manager in a dress shirt had told someone would be by but he didn't seem bothered when he saw me leaving later. Oh well. I get seated much better at the real Barrio (16th St and Thomas). One would think they would be faster at the airport. I wouldn't go to the airport location unless you have a couple hours until your flight.  I love Chef Silvana, but this location is a dud.

oOuR5MSWFISuM0ePUWdwOg.text: So overpriced its unreal. My boyfriend and I wanted a snack before our flight so we asked for chips and salsa, the waiter said "its $10 for a tiny bowl of them" .. no thank you. So we split an order of steak tacos - which were 3 for $14.. no rice or beans or anything, just 3 street tacos. That's almost $5 a taco, insane. So for 2 bud lights, a 9oz glass of wine ($18) and one order of tacos (3) our bill was $45. Crazy!

ky6JOC3ujFTpnnZJXoFhVw.text: I am such a picky eater, not one thing I want to eat.  Hope the soup is ok.  Soup was ok, but small.  I have to go find something else to eat.  Didn't get the $9 chips and salsa.  Great service by Bacardi.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

29Pwu2lpNVYGsLYqFEnXTw.text: I have visited Barrio Cafe yet again as I had time while flying from D gates at terminal 4. The service was much better this visit. Although Ramiro didn't tell me his name, it's on my receipt. He was knowledgeable regarding gluten limitations and made safe suggestions. The food came out quickly. It was okay, the marinated pork was good. Unfortunately the tortillas were soaking in the juice which made for a nasty soggy mess. Ramiro brought a fresh side of tortillas at no additional charge. That was the saving grace.

jDJJNemQULiwKpoD0q3TMA.text: At first look this place looks bomb.  I ordered a Cadillac Margarita fir $14.25 and it came out in a glass the size of a shot glass.  Then it tasted like a horrible house Margarita.  Jack and coke was good though.  Then we got chips and salsa for $9.00. Chips had no taste and neither did the salsa.  I wouldn't bring my dog to eat here. Service was nice though.

PXC-GCct6sBk13Sc0MyAeA.text: I am going to try and have all of my connections through sky harbor so I can enjoy Barrio cafe. The French toast is to die for!

ew3nrtqP6babcbKQB5wbkg.text: Lol @ the previous reviewer's comment, "Walk to Terminal C instead". Bahaha!  That's pretty funny although I can't state that I had the same experience. Departed a Corporate event this past Friday and in between flights we all developed the "munchies". We decided to split an order of nachos which was surprisingly enough for 4.  Perhaps I've grown a bit too used to the "fake" Mexican food in California however this place didn't come up short. I'll digress again and state that perhaps my expectations weren't all that heightened in lieu of this being "airport food".  I was quite taken aback. Haha... Maybe I'll fly back in for another meal.   Maybe....  Did I mention that my colleagues all became so inebriated on the booze served here that we all missed our flights??? Nothing better than being buzzed in an airport and having to wait standby for the next flight.  -___-

yUXsW3fwjjpL7efT91suGQ.text: Once I clicked on this restaurant, I was hoping, from seeing the low reviews, I clicked the wrong location.  No, this is the correct spot, the one in the airport, and I actually had decent service and good food.  (I ate here around January 2013).    What I had: *cochinita pibil-  meat was flavorful and tender, and large portions.  The sides it came with complimented the meat. *guac- what a nice, surprising twist adding pomegranate seeds to guac.  Nice how you can add items to the guac (like onions, cilantro, tomatoes, etc) and it is made fresh to order at the table.  I thought this place is the best airport food I have had.  No complaints yet!  I hope to return during my next trip to AZ.

yqDy3xl8MgWT_WOnVOUZ2w.text: Five stars for food quality, variety, and atmosphere despite being in an airport. I am docking two stars for speed of service, price, and the general feeling that a portion of the wait staff were actually being held against their will. I felt genuinely forgot about in the latter part of our visit. This was, of course made up for, by the large quantity of butter packets that were thrust at me after requesting one. Otherwise, tasty stuff!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Americano - simple but spicy

5rHoqnu6OMyGcMRocaXN4A.text: Worst. I just spent $15 on shrimp tacos. You know, three shrimp tacos... that only had one shrimp on each taco. So, basically, I spent $15 for 3 pint sized, tiny, deep fried shrimp and the smallest excuse for a side salad I've ever seen. I've heard so many good things about Barrio and I am so disappointed. What a waste of money. No thanks. I want my money back so I can actually eat since I'm still hungry after that joke. Do not waste your money here.

d3BXvPYeogU676OyO4T5wQ.text: Inside the airport at the 'D' Gates, you will find two restaurants with sit down options. Barrio Cafe is one of them, but they lure you in because in addition to standard tables and chairs, they also have couches and lounge chairs.  Sign at the entrance says wait to be seated, but with only two wait staff running around a considerable area, I wasn't optimistic one of them would greet and seat me. Eventually, after a minute wait, a waiter with a smile on his face, yelled across the room as he was delivering someone's order, "Seat yourself, anywhere is fine."  I found a nice two-seated, black leather couch in the corner. I occupied one of the seats, and my bags the other. A friendly waitress made her way to my area after about five minutes and delivered a menu and took my drink order. I wasn't that hungry, but I felt I might be on the verge of a migraine, so getting water to take my meds was paramount to me. I also ordered a Coca Cola to help give me a jolt of energy. I think I waited another 5 minutes for the drinks to arrive.  When you are in pain and wanting to take your meds, the wait for water is exceptionally noticeable.  The menu didn't really have anything appealing, so I ordered $10 guacamole from the appetizer menu. I was intrigued that mashed avocados could be listed at that price. Apparently you pay for the entertainment value. The waitress wheeled a cart that looked more like the bus boy cart in front of my coffee table and asked me if I wanted all of the ingredients. I said yes even though I had no idea what special ingredients might be included in this masterpiece. The waitress sprinkled, scooped and mixed about seven different items together, many of which I had no idea what they were. She then presented me with a small, red, mixing bowl with some mashed and some chunked avocado with bright red pomegranate seeds on top. This was highly unusual to me. I tried it, but the pomegranate seeds added to the mix didn't really do anything to enhance the flavor. I ate a few more bites to see if it would grow on me, but alas, I left the majority of the creation sitting in the bowl and promptly fell asleep on the couch using my bags as my pillow.  My waitress was kind enough not to disturb me, but she promptly attended to me when I awoke 30 minutes later asking if I wanted anything else. I told her that I wouldn't be getting anything else, but that I would be here for another 30 minutes since my flight was delayed. We settled the tab and I tipped her handsomely to compensate her for the loss of new customers that might have sat in her section on the couch.  The service was okay, the food selection and guacamole was...meh, especially considering the prices, the comfortable lounge seating was a nice perk, and with limited choices in this section of the airport, I might be forced to return, but hopefully not.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guacamole with pomegrants

XA0CfXfYuYre31DYr2lL3Q.text: If you have time in Phoenix airport, come to The Barrio Cafe! I love this place. This is the most inspired menu I've ever seen in my domestic travels, and the artwork is awesome. Is that a Chihuly light? The food is great, and there is an interesting cocktail menu. This is not just an over-priced beer and burger place. I love flying through Phoenix with a layover so I can come here. My favorites are the nachos (unexpected sweet and savory flavor), fish tacos, and seafood enchiladas. Oh and the Cadillacs. :) mucho gusto!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yes! Convertible artwork at the Barrio Cafe.
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Artwork at the Barrio Cafe.
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Artwork at the Barrio Cafe.

9Gg05FUwZ788uMds-y8pYg.text: This restaurant replaced the Wendy's that was once here, and is currently the only option for food in the D-terminal. I ordered take out once, service was terrible, and I'm never coming back.  I give it a try, so I order the Torta del Barrio to go, with fries. It's a vegetarian option for $13, including cheese stuffed peppers among other vegetables. One gentleman was in front of me, so I wait after my order.  Three people order after me within 15 minutes, each ordering items on the menu of similar preparation (one even got the same dish). They were ALL SERVED BEFORE ME! I ended up waiting for 35 minutes for a meal that wasn't even that good. The fries were soggy and bland, and the bread for the torta tasted stale. No way that cost $13, I could've made that for under $5.  The restaurant didn't look that much better. The place was packed, and they pumped out a couple dishes every 10 minutes. The majority of tables were not served the entire time I was there, and they definitely ordered before I arrived.  When you're trying to fly out, you want a quick bite to eat. The 35 minutes wait was inexcusable, especially since all those customers were served until I was dead last. The most I got out of the cashier was "Sorry, I tried." If you're going to serve food at the airport, that kind of service won't cut it.  I've never said this before, but I'd have preferred fast food at the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Torta del Barrio - the vegetarian option. Not too sure how this took 40 minutes to make as the first takeout customer...

wV5PNe86ghggqlYt68W7mw.text: I'm giving this a 3 star only because of the price and quality of the food. To their credit, the place is clean, appears to run pretty efficiently, and the staff is polite and prompt. But $13 for that little margarita? I dunno. I ordered the Nachos as an "appetizer but could I have it as a meal, please? yes, with chicken" but I had to dig around for the little pieces of chicken it came with. Fortunately, I'm not much of a meat eater so it made little difference to me. But, for $17, when I want chicken, I want more that 2 oz. scattered in little pieces throughout.   The sidebar guac looked entertaining although we did not partake. There's also televisions so you can watch the latest game before catching your flight. However, the way overpriced food and lack of substance is what brought this review down.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nacho Appetizer w chicken. $13
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cadillac Margarita $13.
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Bar.

D6tKiROJ-Wi_RGXBP0UgFg.text: I'm an avid Yelp user, but I am not one to leave a review. This restaurant however, I felt truly deserved one. This was much more than a meal, it was an experience. From the genuine service, hundreds of different kinds of tequila, decor, feel, unique ingredients in their entrees, to their flavorful robust coffee! Every plate was served in an artistic manner with vibrant colors and different textures that had me excited to eat. We had the quesadilla de camaron borracho, chiles en nogada , and the filet mignon de mi tita and all 3 dishes were AMAZING!! You can't go wrong with any of the 3.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4OiAqmZljs8oCABkv2z99g.text: We had just an hour-ish for a layover, so we stopped here for a quick dinner. Definitely very happy with our decision! Our waitress was pretty awesome. She was older and when she approached our table, she mentioned that they have $4 tequila shots. She didn't really offer the shots, as much as she told us about the shots in a way that we felt like it was a demand. Being challenged, and essentially called a wimp, we ordered the shots. My husband and I NEVER order shots when it is just us.. but hey, way to take our vacation to the next level, lady! We also ordered a couple beers (heck yes to Golden Road brews!) and the Barrio Nachos. These nachos were really really good. Beef with sauteed mushrooms, garlic, onions, jalapenos, spinach, cream, chorizo and bleu cheese and "fresh Mexican farm cheese". They also came slightly "deconstructed" so it wasn't just a messy mash of flavors. The rest of the menu looked pretty interesting as well.. not your typical Mexican food and certainly not your typical airport food. The nachos were $15, but large and enough for 2 to have as a meal. Would definitely stop here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love Golden Road
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Appetizer Menu
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barrio Nachos. Awesome.

XnDe9dA2n4haI_RbDQlxIA.text: It beats the average Airport food option but Sky Harbor is not average, not any more. There are so many great local food options here and I wouldn't say that Barrio is the best of them by far. They had some beer of draft so that was cool, just mexican beer though which isn't very exciting.   I ordered the Pork something Burrito which said it was Enchilada Style, with a side of Barrio Fries (only because my husband wanted fries). It's kind of weird to serve Seasoned Fries with a Burrito but whatever. The Burrito was just Pork, nothing else, and it hadn't even been filled all the way so there were gaps where filling should be and it was very thin for a Burrito. The Pork was fine, didn't see or taste the Green Chilies mentioned in the description and the Enchilada Style consisted of a teaspoon of grated Cheese pathetically sprinkled on top. The Tortilla was so soggy and not in a saucy Enchilada sort of way, in a watery wet nasty kind of way.   I ordered it to go so I couldn't really say anything but next time I'm going somewhere else. There are tons of other really great options in this airport!

BZlJ1hluACBFdBmLir_aRA.text: I was served water with a bug in it, and after bringing it to the attention of the manager, they still did not offer to comp my breakfast. I will not be back.

cMtxU7W8ne_aq_sGQSnvTQ.text: Stopped here with time to kill before my flight. Wasn't really that hungry but my sister and I decided to split the nachos. We got half beef and half chicken.   The food arrived in a surprisingly quick fashion and once I took my first bite I was in heaven.   My only issue was we asked the waiter for no mushrooms and it came with mushrooms. When we mentioned it he made a comment only four chips or so had the mushrooms. Are you serious? I would leave only 4 stars because of him as he was not friendly and was extremely slow on drink service. Waters and diet cokes...but the food redeemed him.  Back to the nachos. The chips were thick and delicious. The odd combination of spinach and bleu cheese added made an incredible addition to the nachos. Underneath the chips was a hidden liquidy sweet cheese we couldn't figure out what it was but didn't care it was SO good.   As mentioned before, I wasn't that hungry to begin with but once my sister stopped eating, I finished the whole plate. I would love to try and recreate these nachos but that seems near impossible.

R9WjwWWESdDk8foGnRwr4w.text: Definitely airport food! Don't ever order to share cuz they will charge a dollar fifty for a second sleep whether you use it or not. The Bloody Mary was really spicy and thick the food was okay but then again airport food. And $30 for one drink and one meal to share course!

urqi7Qg-TdV4PBvOJyxeJQ.text: The story is as good as the food itself.   I'm going out on a limb here and saying this place deserves 5 stars just on the nachos alone. I know the signature dish is the puerco pibil, this will have to wait till my next visit. I was pleasantly surprised to have fresh spinach and blue cheese on my nachos platter. The cheese tasted like it was gourmet home made cheese. I like the story how authentic Mexican dishes with French influence plays a roll in the dishes served. Keep in mind this was what they served at the Phoenix Airport location. I really need to stop by the downtown location. My only complaint if I had one was the price being a little on the high side. $40 for two beers and a nachos plate. Honestly, you get what you pay for here though. I would totally do it again!  Great job Barrio Cafe!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Never had nachos with blue cheese, spinach and mushrooms but it worked! Not often do I finish a whole plate of nachos but this one I did!

xlstRSaW3LZ8JlI29Lr32w.text: Three stars is about right.  This location was not too far from our gate in Terminal 4.  We had a bite to eat here yesterday before our flight home.  Alan had the tacos de camarones w/ water to drink.  I had iced tea and a fruit plate because I wasn't that hungry.  The iced tea was fresh brewed and good.  The fruit plate was OK.  The strawberries were fairly good, the pineapple was very good and the honeydew was hard and tasteless.  The apple slices were too sweet for me, but fine for Alan and the cantaloupe went to him too.  He reported the tacos were fine.  Prices were high, as you would expect in an airport.  Service was very nice.

eYHCwZJVdpZyfNvo3sTdRw.text: This place is amazing...and it's in the airport! I stopped to wait for a delayed flight...thought is have some chips and salsa with a beer. First of all, they have an incredible selection of margaritas on the menu so I ordered one. Fantastic choice. The I caved in and ordered Cochinita Pibil. It's a pork roast that is seasoned, paired with chiles and sour oranges and then wrapped in banana leaves and roasted slow overnight. You cannot imagine.   It was plated with squash, some mashed potato and several corn tortillas. Boom. You're done. An amazing dish, full of flavor and so tender. Delicious. With the margarita it was perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. An outstanding house margarita!

FJw7LzF2INFEQQdLQqjFHw.text: i ended up at the bar in the barrio cafe in the phoenix airport on january 3, 2014 during the Polar Vortex.  the bar was crowded with fellow stranded travelers.  i sat at of those tall bar tables with 5  guys who were all waiting for their flights to depart or arrive. the service at the bar was extremely efficient in spite of the overwhelming number of customers. no one waited any length of time for a drink to be delivered. one of our fellow lost sheep ordered the Nachos Barrio. everyone stared at it as it looked like an incredible mess, and yes, it was a mess. there was blue cheese, some kind of meat that should not be on a nachos, for $17.00. do not order the Nachos Barrio.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nachos barrio.  Do not be fooled at $17.00.  Do not order this. No.

IcB-u5g2ablWW5-OX0BJZA.text: Save your time and frustration! 35 minutes to get a cup of coffee and French toast. Aloof attitudes, slow service, cold food... Yikes!!! What a bad experience... again.. I won't make this mistake a third time and I fly 40x/yr.

p3g2X3zdpH2Q2XwSGBgNlQ.text: This used to be my favorite breakfast spot in the swa gate area. I used to travel a lot, and would arrive early to grab breakfast. Barrio was always my go to spot. I think that will be changing. I ordered an omelette and it was quite small. The potatoes were luke warm, and the toast was hard as a rock! And the waitress didn't do a good job of filling my drink.

-H0eKFt3jUMIE3MLc2RmKg.text: Americanized Mexican.   No beans, no rice, and apparently no fresh guacamole. The menu claims that the guacamole is prepared "table side". Instead I received what I would classify as a cereal-bowl-sized serving. This cereal bowl came out appearing to be thrown together at some point during the day (hopefully) and then tossed into the fridge until some ill informed customer orders this $12.50 "fresh" not fresh dish.  How can an airport in such a Mexican affluent area serve "Mexican" dishes over...fries...?

RV-nlWysLjkvh-NUhJUCBw.text: Worst bloody marys in the airport. Pass on by.

0s19zjD5-5mHoAcYJGkSAQ.text: Service issues ! Usually come here when I travel to AZ because the Mexican food is different and well prepared. This guy Pedro is so annoying and lazy. The place got pretty busy right after we arrived for breakfast . The young lady was seating people, taking orders, cleaning tables. She called out for help in both English and Spanish. He kept putting her off and never really made himself useful. Irritating!

YbIrdTDTJ8luPh4nAlRj5g.text: Horrible food, terrible service. Although acclaimed to be some of the best mexican food in the region I was fully disappointed with my experience at Barrio Cafe. I ordered the table side guacamole appetizer which was brought out following the the main dish only after I mentioned not receiving it. It also wasn't prepared table-side like the menu describes & the ingredients weren't even mixed together but instead thrown in unstirred. The "iconic" Cochinita Pibil tacos turned out to be so greasy & gross I couldn't stomach more than a bite. The ONLY thing I enjoyed about this experience was the artwork by Calle 16: Mural Project. Definitely don't recommend Barrio Cafe & won't be back.

ITM_xc7jzmMJ2JRkUWXmNA.text: Except for getting my food order wrong and my drink order wrong, the food was good. I had the pork torta and it was well balanced with a decent roll.  But, can't give more stars with the inattentive server.

WNBHdg1mSdD5iNZOjhb7Ww.text: Service is sooooo slooooww. Waited 10 minutes to have someone ask if I wanted to order. Had 1 beer and nobody came back to check on me. Need my check & it's time to board the plane and nobody is here. It's an airport restaurant, people are usually in a hurry or need  to get on a flight at a specific time. Would be nice if the staff were more attentive.

AhmUwsALkg4AZHeLYkYgZQ.text: Pretty good Mexican food in the Phoenix airport.  Hubby ordered a green chile burrito.  It had great flavor and full of pork.  The fries that came with it were a little soggy.  I had the steak tacos.  Very good!  The salad that came with it was fresh and the tacos themselves had great flavor.  I didn't care too much for the salsa, but I usually don't but salsa on my steak tacos anyway, so no loss there.  I ordered a classic margarita.  I wasn't a fan, but hubby liked it.  I REALLY liked the chips and quac.  I couldn't stop eating them, in fact I took my remaining chips to go to eat them as a snack later.  We don't get to Phoenix very often, but if we do, we would definitely come back.  Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak Tacos
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips &amp; Guac
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green Chile Burrito

zdIgOofwMnUHKnUkIlnnGQ.text: You would think that one of the cornerstones of an airport restaurant would be speed of service, not here.  It took five minutes to be greeted, then there was a discussion about whose table we were.  This allowed ample time to study the menu, and we decided on an appetizer, should be quick.  We were told no, that would take 15 minutes.  Tacos are fast, and they were.  Beef is good, but if you like spicy, go for the pork. Pork it is.  Sadly, I am not sure how they managed to combine all those ingredients, and make it devoid of any flavor.  The salad that came with was the high point of the meal.  Good news, I will make my flight, bad news, I will not eat here again.

PiwLtAO-wyHeAQX1bObW7w.text: The food at this at best subpar, portions are very small and tasteless. On top of that it's expensive for even a basic snack. Save your $20.00 and eat out of one of the vending machines instead.  I can't think of a nicer way to put that...

Y7D0Fux4L0380AeWPn15Xg.text: Horrible service.  Every server in this "joint" looks like they hate their job. Frowns and scowls everywhere.  It took about 10 min for anyone to take our order after finally flagging someone down. I will never eat here again. Done.

ZbAabudpu7MsGSmPEC1XTQ.text: It's ok. Nothing special. Slow, spotty service. The food is 3-Star. The service, 2-Star. The price 1-Star. The price alone will haunt you.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Omelette

kx1lhMT55wrmoSQvQ4hqag.text: We were at the airport and hungry!!! We were in Terminal D so stopped in here to watch the Astros play the Yankees.  We were seated promptly. The tables are pretty small which makes sense as you want more people in an area, but with everyone hauling their carry on luggage it can get fun trying to walk in the aisles. Be careful folks.  Each table had a device where you can press one of three buttons to get your waiter's attention, get the check and there was another button I can't remember what it was for. The server wore a wristband that would notify them of the table calling for service. Pretty cool since this place gets busy being at the airport.  We ordered the guacamole Barrio ($12.35). The menu states it is prepared table side. Our guacamole came out in a bowl already prepared. The server had cilantro all over the plates she handed us. The guacamole was good, but needed some salt. Definitely had a spicy kick to it that I appreciated. The salsa that was brought out was very tasty too! The tortilla chips were thick so it was easy to scoop up the guacamole.  The Michelada with Dos XX (asked for it extra spicy) was not bad at all. The server recommended that over the Bloody Maria. Good choice.  Overall, the place is good and of course any time you buy ANYTHING at an airport it will be at a higher price than other places outside the airport. The food wasn't bad at all.  Good place to hang out at and watch the game. Must check out the murals in here. Pretty cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu-10.18.17
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu-10.18.17
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu-10.18.17

_Fw3Xmlt6FdPizluY0kp6A.text: We were seated, then completely ignored for 15+ minutes.  Other wait staff walked past, looking at us.  Walked out.  Looked overpriced, can't comment on quality for obvious reasons.

s0dmw5K3-d9uf2gP8QfBqA.text: The Michelada was pretty tasty. The torts we Rude red to share was good but not the one we ordered.  Our waitress offered to have it remade but we had to catch a flight and service was slow.  It's expensive but what do you expect from a restaurant at the airport.  .

e59IEmodvxdGBEbFuUzj4Q.text: This place sucks, from the service to the food, nachos were nasty from 1 to 10 it's a minus 0...waitress is super old I think her name is nancy December 26, 2018 7ish pm... her service was terrible, NACHOS were worst,  I never tasted crap til I took 2bites of this,  DONT EAT HERE!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. NO CHEESE

wL975eQ1NAUbvKXrfXYLYg.text: Honestly I'm so disappointed in this place. I go to the one off 16th street so when I travel I always get excited to know there is one inside the airport. Well I decided today to finally go and eat there since I love the actual restaurant on 16th street.  This place was a joke, I was so upset in the food because it was nothing, not even a little bit on how it is at their main location.  The enchilada suizas say they come with chorizo and they didn't, the sauce and cheese is not the one on the menu nor the one that should be used. The sides were also disgusting, I couldn't even eat them. My waitress was very nice and attentive but the food was just gross. Never will I ever eat at this one. My meal was 40 bucks for some nasty enchiladas and guacamole. It was ridiculous. It makes me more mad because I have gone to the original one and the food is phenomenal, so I was expecting the same thing.  Don't waste your time or money

LYwXCSEk7b5nN2lK1ttxQg.text: As a chef with 10+ years of experience with Hispanic cuisine, I was attracted by reviews of their non-airport location.   Absolutely don't bother.  Pork is poorly seasoned, tacos/tortillas are served waterlogged and dripping, fries were cold, and I've thrown out better batches of escabeche de cebollas (pickled red onions) than the ones served here.  Beer is also $2-$3 cheaper elsewhere in the concourse.

BbJskeFd7JP3ULKFgnaLQA.text: Was really looking forward to breakfast here, but after we waited outside the host stand with our luggage for 10 minutes with no one even looking at us - we decided we were better off going next door.

A9mo8nJiAZTNKnficBUEYA.text: Extremely overpriced for poor quality menu items. The drinks are okay, considering airport prices but we got the "table side guacamole" and the menu said it was as prepared table side with fresh chips, however the chips were wet with grease and literally cold. The guacamole came out in a bowl, not prepared table side. $13 for guac I could make at home 10x better. Sigh.

vvzS6LQajQH-XS56RH5NKw.text: I was so excited to come here again because last time I was waiting for a flight the food and service was awesome.   Not this time.   First off, the hostess said pick a seat and stops me as I find a table and shoves the menus In my hand. I sat down for 15 minutes and no one came to serve us. The restaurant wasn't busy at all otherwise I would've understood a little bit. There was a lot of servers walking around and chatting. Two were arguing about who swept the restaurant last... um you're not going to have any floors to sweep if no customers come because the lack of service. A table gets sat after us and they got greeted within minutes.   We got up and left. No one said anything. We clearly were ready to spend money on food and alcohol but nothing.   This will be the last time I come to this place. I made my way over to Zinc and was greeted and served within a minute. Glad I found a place who will take my money.

k2pO2MVXzdzk2Omi8dXPow.text: Don't go here!  $21 glass of wine! Asked for a few more chips for our nachos and they wanted to charge us.  Overpriced and underserved! Check out my bill!  Terrible customer service!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1q7fsjVJE6dBHnjn3IWtFQ.text: It's pretty hard to think of an airport restaurant as five stars, however this place may be the exception, and here's why:  the Arizona burrito is amazing! It's almost good enough to want to schedule a lay-over in Phoenix just to get this burrito.  Filled with Oaxaca cheese, pork and green chiles this is a delicious piece of work.  I thought that the salsa was also excellent - nice flavors and spices without it trying to kill you in the process.    The service however, while good, wasn't great.  I had to ask for the salsa again after my food was served, and that took awhile.  Getting a beer was harder than it should have been, too.  The staff was super friendly and accommodating though, and that counts for something in my book.     The Barrio Cafe is hands-down the best place to get a meal in Sky Harbor - so if you are in terminal D, this place is worth your time!

bOwEKbfMLwybBPAcBlz1lQ.text: We were delayed for an hour so we thought we would grab some food and a drink. Unfortunately we were told that we were not allowed to bring our stroller in due to space. Our stroller is a small Graco, nothing crazy. Despite the fact that there were many travelers with with bags that took up just as much or more space, we were told that we could not enter with it. We spoke to the manager Kimberly who was very rude and unable to help us. It felt very discriminatory.

o0mboUmVnHZRSaArh3O0nw.text: Food never disappoints here. Awesome vibes and great service   The go to plates are: cochinita pibil, pork chop, enchiladas Suizas , and Guacamole.   You also can't leave without getting the churros for dessert. Barrio Cafe is one of Arizona's gems for sure and we're lucky to have this restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cochinita Pibil and queso fundido

oCesZ1NQH77VDULY0XKj2g.text: Had a great visit here during a quick layover. Tight timelines always make airport meals a challenge, but my server was always there when needed.  The pozole verde was expertly executed. Just wish it were served in a slightly larger portion.  The tequila menu was impressive, but I stuck to a local brew...San Tan Devil's Ale.  Overall, a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pozole Verde

BJJ7qFzLoKU2OuzKqIRZzQ.text: Way overpriced and below average. Margarita $14-18 with chips and salsa $10( which is traditionally complementary) So your looking at around $30 with tip for one drink with chips and salsa. Wow!! Stay away!!!!!

lBn7EGRXQCWP1Cw6YA1jWA.text: Man, Barrio Cafe has a very hard time trying to replicate it's original location. I had some extra time at the airport due to a weather issue and decided to charge my iphone for the tenth time at Barrio Cafe. I have given Barrio Queen a chance even though the reviews were iffy at best and found out that Barrio Cafe at the airport could be even further from the original.   Staff sucked: now this may be because it's tough to get people to work at the airport so I will let that slide.   Food: Honest to God, I wouldn't serve this to my dog. I ordered the Tacos De Arrachera (Skirt Steak) and I am not kidding when I say this cow must have either been 70 yrs old or the chef has never grilled a skirt steak in his/her life. Unchewable and absolutely flavorless!   My girlfriend and I are always debating over the Original Barrio Cafe as to whether or not it really is that good. I think one thing they are good at is ambiance. Cool Urban Mexican Art can't make up for a shit show in this kitchen.

U4O7F4QjtsQUZpdRf0z-ww.text: Grabbed an glass of wine. The bar stools are comfortable the liquor selection looks ok. The bar is located in the southwest terminal.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 6oz glass of Gascon Malbec $12
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Full Bar
