aqGng15sBsvi7Y9RHbf6Iw.text: Phoenix Sky Harbor has it all over other airports- delicious food!  Was served a tasty salad of fresh ingredients- spinach, roasted tomatoes, crumbly blue cheese, apples, nuts and spiced chicken breast in a lovely vinaigrette.  The draft Negro Modelo was cold and perfect with the salad.  Marina's service was delightful!   This experience was the exact opposite of the crap we were served in Orlando yesterday.

YkDgovENy6lMKBp0ua6Wlg.text: Maybe it was just me being sick, but other said the same. Their signature dish wasn't all that fantastic. Pricey, but hey, what do you expect at the airport. The Jack Daniels Sangria was tasty.

Dr5XkRBKG2VD3pb3ZH2XSw.text: Hopefully their food is better than their attitude. Don't worry your faces won't break if you smile. The real Barrio Cafe 16th and Thomas might want to give a pep talk to the hostess. Ana was sweet

LV4rxQcpAX7nia24tZ90ug.text: Don't do it!!! The worst food ever. I ordered the breakfast burrito and it made me sick. I wish I wouldn't have eaten any of it - esp before flying! Lesson learned.

NjAd1ltNAY358VRbYjjTPQ.text: That was the best Mexican food I've ever had, and that includes travel to Mexico.  We were in a hurry; our fight was boarding in 15 minutes. Rox got us our food within five minutes, and steak tacos coupled with a Goose Island IPA are a great way to start my trip.  Sure, it was pricier than I expected, but it was double the food at 120% the price.   Worth it.   I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wguD9RSDFuhW4lcSl3oDqQ.text: Big fan of Bario in town.  Ordered a margarita and the glass it came was no bigger than a shot glass.   $10.00 later.... a shame for so little.  The original restaurant on 16th street is fantastic so just a little disappointed to experience this at the airport.

MmpTt8kxAqTcNk0LmOyIbg.text: I sat at the bar and ordered the Barrio salad and house red. The salad was extremely fresh and with every bite you get an assortment of flavor. Honestly one of the best salads I've ever had, let alone in an airport. I travel once, sometimes twice, a week and I know airport food... This place raises the bar. When I'm back in Phoenix, I will definitely eat here again!

AvPeW29r_Ff0uHsbV_Mq7Q.text: If only the service was as good as the food then this place could be 5 stars! The Mexican French toast paired with a spicy Bloody Mary hit the spot. Now if only we were able to get our water or drinks refilled. Didn't have the best service last time we are here either. Too bad!

XOP-_6jr4iuiXCxAVHjIBw.text: Three of us ate dinner here on Monday, March 10th at 7:30pm. I ordered the shrimp enchiladas, and my mother ordered the chicken burrito. WARNING: I popped a shrimp in my mouth and it was raw! They removed my entree from the bill. My mother got FOOD POISONING from her burrito!! (Which kicked in on our connecting flight!) my mother sent them a message on their website and they NEVER responded!!! With all my friends going to Arizona for spring training, I'm letting them all know to avoid this place like the plague!  PS: the food isn't cheap either!

oR7zhZmEnkg41MB-ndocRA.text: This restaurant is a bit overpriced even for being an airport restaurant. Their guacamole is huge which is good if you are sharing with others however I was alone and requested a half size but my request could not be met. It is made table side which I think is unnecessary and they didn't even wear gloves which was kind of a let down.

iErGBfjtmk6pvrvIkvBw2A.text: One seat open at the bar but my wife and I couldn't use it because "I have to have each person at the bar have their own seat". When asked why the answer was "because this is a dining area". What a fucking joke.

SDt-yu7MVw-YI7QGO3ejfA.text: For airport food, this is pretty good. The prices are typical of airport prices but not crazy. I had a glass of wine and the steak tacos (3 tacos and french fries) and I paid about $23.00.  The service: I sat at the bar. The bar tenders were friendly, One Hispanic guy and a lady who had a lot of tattoos ( I don't remember their names lol). The guy was great. he was super friendly and helpful and just fun. The lady was a little more reserved; she seemed annoyed with one of the patrons but she wasn't serving me so whatevs. The guy who was serving me was helpful with suggestions and was quick with service.  The food: Eh. The tacos were alright; nothing to rave about by any means. They had steak, a cabbage slaw and pico on top. It came with a side of mild salsa. The fries were the best part. They are seasoned and steak cut. The menu is a good size but not a lot of variety.  The wine: great! hard to mess up Chardonnay.   Overall: If I was every in the airport again and wanted some mexican food I might stop here again. I don't think I'd spend that kind of money again on tacos though.  *shrug* I guess I won't be back.

r-s2puxrCI2Z_2b9t3Uttg.text: Food was just not good! To be fair, it was fresh, but it was a poor combination of flavors. I ordered the grilled chicken tacos. They came drowned, and I mean totally smothered, in goat cheese and some type of cream sauce. It was literally dripping when I tried to eat it. The salad had a very light dressing, but was unremarkable. The service was bad. I felt ignored because I was seated way in the back away from everyone when there were tables available elsewhere. Took my server 10 minutes to greet me, and he seemed shocked when I told Jim I was ready to order. Once my food came he never checked on me again. I placed my credit card on he table when I was finished to give them a hint I was ready to go. This just reinforced my belief that you can't get decent Mexican food outside of California. Sorry PHX! Still love ya tho...

APF39LQx_0DtgKXcdWbdxQ.text: Pros:  They have TVs. Cons:  All they're good for is the TVs. Seriously, if a kool-aid stand set up next to them and had TVs, I'd prefer to go there (especially if they sold vodka).  I ordered the fish tacos.  I think (and I'm not exaggerating) there was 1 oz. of fish in THREE tacos.  One was just batter.  And waaaaay over seasoned...think seasoned salt and Old Bay together.  Service?  Praytell, what's that?  I had to wave down my server after she was texting and later chatting with other servers.  Bottom line:  If you have time go to C gate (short walk) and you'll find TVs and better service.

iQ_q1-Qw2W0rP2U7sErWMA.text: Extremely slow service. We waited nearly ten minutes before I had to ask for a manager because  no one came to our table.  They were busy, but someone should have at least acknowledge us.  I will likely not come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nachos

CW-DyN5WThvs5mPLpI80Dw.text: Let me first say that I visited the the one in Phoenix. Amazing food, decor, and service. I had the filet mignon, the infamous guacamole, and flan. Wow, and it's rare that I end with desert. Get there before 5pm, place fills up quickly. I love the murals on the parking lot walls. It reminds me of home (Philly). I will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Preparing fresh guacamole dip
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sangria with mango juice at the bottom
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flan

Q2kcUDAkISTW2VZ1glKPvQ.text: We just ate at Barrio at the Phoenix airport and went with the waitress recommendations. My husband had the french toast topped with spiced apples and ginger/ orange syrup and applewood bacon. I had a roasted poblano pepper filled with chicken and a fruit reduction drizzled with a cream sauce. Sides were zucchini and mashed potatoes with a flair. It was the beat food we have had in an airport and much better than many restaurants in Dallas where we live!  What an unexpected surprise!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A shot from the Barrio Cafe Tequila lounge. We didn&#39;t try the tequila but enjoyed the British Open while eating there.

UsdabOg4Lt6bsEGkw_1vuA.text: Guacamole was interesting with the dried cranberries, it was chunky and tasty but needed salt. The chips were horrible! Whoever provides their chips should be fired, those are not chips.  They were too thick and stale. Gross. I tried to enjoy the guacamole, but the chips absolutely ruined it.  Service was pretty good until it got busy. I would stop for a drink, but not being able to enjoy guacamole and chips at a mexican food restaurant is tragic.

in1eRAzKwERVWdkfbKYBsQ.text: I have nothing to say good about this place. Awful service. Made me wait 20 minutes for my check. Beer taps were empty. Pork tacos were inedible, cold and zero flavor.  Was this even pork?!?Avoid at ALL costs.

9Wi5nD62piWrl7eeYn1o7w.text: There is a Mexican restaurant in the C terminal that I like better, but I figured I'd try this one since I had a layover/connection in the D terminal. The food was good.  Here are a few things to note.: 1. if you care about the planet, request to get no straw with your drink. I hate restaurants that bring straws in the waters and other drinks that don't need one. Come on restaurant people, don't you know plastic waste is clogging our oceans? And you'll save money by only giving straws to those who requested one 2. Ask for your salad dressing on the side. I had tacos with a side salad, and there was so much dressing on it, it was in edible

6WLPKoH62P6ir6VnuhH7gQ.text: I don't think meals here are prepared to standards the owner normally has, or maybe she just sold them her name. While breakfast came out quickly, the eggs don't taste like eggs. The toast was cool and dry. Butter hard. Potatoes mushy. Ugh. Pretty disappointing for $13. I'd pass next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scrambled &#34;eggs&#34;

bMiBHC-Y-sBvYw-Z-MBqpQ.text: Second time eating here.  Food is very low quality for price.  Manager was extremely condescending when a question was asked.  I have truly never dealt with someone who had such a large chip on their shoulder.   I originally asked the question of the server and told her I did not want to speak to the manager.  She sent him anyway.    I would suggest that she not have her manager intervene for her as he was not a good advocate but quite rude and condescending.   I would not suggest eating here.  LaGrange next door is much better in terms of quality and taste.   I understand it's quite difficult to find quality employees.  It's too bad this establishment has had to settle for someone who is not an advocate for customer service.  Approach makes all the difference.  Acting like a jerk and making statements that are condescending does not make a difference.

1-tW34KxdUQ6ym6TSiuI8w.text: Not bad food for an airport location...expensive just left left everything else at an airport!!  The cafe was packed at 0930 hours so I stood in the burrito to go line. Choice of bacon or charizo. For nearly $10 you get ample portions of egg, potato and bacon wrapped tight in a fresh tortilla. It was pretty tasty and the side of pico made it nice and spicy but not overheated.

hGe0HivUZtFRSBmlKEnV0w.text: Last day of our business trip and one of the guys just wanted to get to the airport and drink as you can loose your job if you get a DUI while on business. So straight to the airport it was and since it was on the companies dime, we're going to pay the outrageous airport meal fees.  The margaritas must have been good or the guys were thirsty because they tanked the first one and took it easy on the second.  Good customer service. We weren't rushed as all the business travelers were starting to pour in.   I thought my fried shrimp and fish dish was really good and it appeared my co-workers enjoyed their meals as well.  As we were leaving, as crowded as it seemed, we could still get through without tripping over the other customers with our hand carry in tow.  One thing I was mostly impressed with, the murals on the wall. Even my tatted co-worker thought it was tastefully done and fun.  I would definitely have a meal here again if I ever have to go through this Southwest terminal again.

SloIgY2glpI66EFTTkkigQ.text: Ordered the quesadilla that described shrimp cheese etc. Came presented as a flat open faced taco- picked it up to take a bite and it was all crunchy! The shrimp was cooked with a full shell burried in the quesadilla - OMG had to pick out each shrimp to eat separate from the "quesadilla". Just an awful experience. The flavor was good and good had been a good dish - epic fail on execution. PS- Waitress came by to ask how everything was - I shared and was told " I don't know - I just work here" "That's just how they make it"....F for customer service too

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ub3fUYSjcHdLXExRf5vKfg.text: This is a nice option with tasty alternatives to your traditional airport food but it is overpriced and service was slow. $16.50 got me half of an avocado on a small bed of greens with 4 small shrimp. Plus the menu said it was $15. It was tasty and a nice light meal for traveling. Service was slow which normally isn't a good thing for travel but we had 4 hours to kill. I had to ask for dressing twice, my husband got the wrong side, and we asked for something we never ended up receiving. If you have a few extra bucks in your travel budget and time for a sit down meal, this is a good option.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $16.50

qBIn-cYpu0olucL-CR6Qjw.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food. Nothing boxed or packaged, I know because I inquired, I'm a health food junkie.  (This seemed to be the healthiest spot in my terminal). I got the fish tacos with a salad. The salad was super good quality and the balsamic dressing was GOOOOD! My reason for only 4 stars is the fish portions were VERY small. But I know it's a business and they need to profit. But a tad bigger pieces would have been better. Also, the staff was professional and friendly.

D4DpU2sUe-tJmSTnZ3DZSQ.text: Great service today and good food for airport.  The chicken tacos were filling and well prepared.   I opted for the salad with my tacos which looking around at the fries was a good choice as far as good for you.

ZMf8QvX9gxzYuivj88romA.text: Ummmm.... I almost do not want to review this place, but must give you the warning to avoid it IF you can.   So hopefully you will read this before stopping by. Worst breakfast I have had. Airport food has improved significantly in the past 10-20 years. Not this one.    Wait for lunch which starts at 10:00, they say it's much better.  Service was nice though. So the staff deserves a 3 star.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ummm... like if you need your server pronto! Or ready to ! Cool stuff.

hjIC_x4T7yQvrG_gHQ-f-A.text: Very good fish tacos, and the salad was tiny but delicious. My daughter had a quesadilla with barrio fries. With limited options in the airport - this place was pretty good!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish tacos :)
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesadilla with barrio fries. Yes the fries look like they tasted- dry and cold lol

j3m2N_cjIm98GPKAfX7AMg.text: Used the To go menu; chose a really fresh tasty salad. Quick and delicious. So much better than a greasy burger at the airport.

C_WMW3CQzjeH2IbBD2DQDg.text: Gave me a soggy torta that was falling apart for $15 what a rip off. Can't believe this place is open still? I'm only here for a layover and didn't have time to get it fixed

Iikm9XjFo2slPy5Vd98Dog.text: If you want gourmet fancy pants Mexican inspired food, this is the place for you! I had nachos with blue cheese, spinach, tons of Avocado,  and some delicate, creamy slightly sweet cheese sauce. I literally never had such delicious nachos. And they came out fast!!! Take me back to Phoenix!

ara_brA6ajaZrbEx2e-rIw.text: I've been flying since the days that airport restaurants were generally considered a joke and you had pay for practically everything inside the terminal with cash.   Today, things have changed and it is more uncommon to get a bad meal in an airport than not.   Barrio Cafe in the B terminal at Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport is certainly better than your average airport fare (pun intended).   We had the guacamole and chips, as well as Burrito Pollo Poblano (chicken), and it was great. Service was prompt and attentive as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CvyyEvVxBIIMrfFefUDUjQ.text: The only reason they get 2 stars is because the bar tender was ok. Spent $80 on 4 shots of tequila and the host that thought he was too beautiful for the world had to make us feel like we needed to leave for the old couple to sit at the bar even tho there was plenty of room. Also, the entire rest of the restaurant was empty. Way to customer service!!!

qaXjokuszAGsTywZ4k2dgw.text: This is one of the worst meals I've ever eaten. Tortillas tasted like paper, chips were stale and burritos were over salted. The manager was extremely rude and un-accommodating (if that's even a word) and would not even look at us when we were waiting to be seated. I don't think I've ever had worse service or Mexican food.

kWM_7_e47F3IvgbyDQ2kFg.text: If you have time, this the place to eat & drink in the airport.  Great margaritas, the cochinita (pork) was pretty tasty, the pork fat sauce was awesome.  I saw others eating shrimp and stuffed jalapenos also look great!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KGz-rHXwpQ9zGnWyAYEESg.text: I should have known better, but just avoid. Expensive for very below average, tasteless and sloppy food and somehow horrible margaritas.

ozSs5-OG4U-u59zc5oNSOA.text: Mashed potatoes with "Mexican" food? No beans or rice? Horchata that tasted flavorless. The guacamole had cranberries on it. Wtf?

RIQnLEhZ3bG-s3nCN55sAA.text: No bueno for the Barrio Cafe.  The table side guac would have been good had the cold, dripping with oil chips, not also been stale and thick enough to crack a tooth.   Decided to abandon the guac and try more punishment and give their street tacos a try-meh.   Service-The server was indifferent.

mvZE-igZ2xE0z8FTFR_dmw.text: This was one of the best breakfasts I've had. I was here a couple years ago when seeing the Grand Canyon. Had a Pink Cadillac with a SouthWestern breakfast of home fried potatoes mixed with peppers and onions, bacon, scrambled eggs. Yeah, I know...What's the big deal right? It's all in the flavor! Amazing flavor and our waitress was the nicest and funniest person. I like when wait staff and servers have a sense of humor. She was what we needed. So was the Pink Cadillac! BTW, Tons of Tequilla in that baby!

NaiwBP7yJ0PoBZRNBPCnjw.text: Great experience until Terry came over yelling at me and my party, accusing us of smuggling wine out, but we were still at the table. I was like we don't have to sneak wine. We can buy more in the plane. Lol.

zWhABvjf9nPS0SaqrcEJ3Q.text: Ok we all know airport food is overpriced.   Got it. We aren't judging based on that since your totally at the mercy of whatever they are charging unless you would rather starve waiting for your insanely delayed flight. After waking around for 45 minutes and realizing this was the only open restaurant we thought we were settling. Boy were we wrong! The only thing better than the food was the service. So friendly and welcoming. Great margaritas and incredible Mexican food. This place was a much needed oasis in a desert of airport hell.

uMmYuhA8f3EVK-kBF60dTg.text: I arrived very early to pick up my daughters, so I went in for a beer.  I had a Negra Modelo, and after a bit, felt hungry.  Their prices are a bit extreme for just a snack, but the fresh-made guacamole sounded delicious, and was reasonably priced.  They prepare it table-side, and the anticipation of watching it being prepared makes it taste better. (True story)  It had large chunks of avocado, jalapenos, onions, tomatoes, cilantro, lemon juice, and is topped with pomegranate seeds.  One of the most amazing guacamoles I've ever had, and I have had, and made dozens of recipes.  I may have to head to the location outside the airport, and try one of their entrees.  If I spend any significant amount of time in the airport again, I'll certainly hit this spot again!

FFSL7Uf4A-VfWMJIXJc4vg.text: I know Barrio is all the Food Network rage, so I can only speak on the airport location. In a nutshell, the breakfast food was disappointing. The menu itself is condensed which I understand, but this leaves little to no room for variation and flavor. I ordered the Chilaquiles Verde and when it arrived to the table: a few soggy, stale chips, with a few pieces of pork, and two bland eggs. Seriously, there was no flavor and barely any pork. The two stars accounts for the server who was nice and prompt, the coffee (pressed), and the decor. We killed some time but really should have grabbed a bagel and coffee, and saved the dollars.

stGW399h3seeO6_4SZigzw.text: I got food poisoning on Monday 2/8/16-ate the chorizo for breakfast at the airport Barrio in D section Got on flight from PHX to Ft Lauderdale. Within an hour an half had severe stomach pain and diarrhea. Arrived 4 hours later-got rental car and was gut wrenching vomiting out the car window. Food couldn't go thru intestines Recovered by Weds but food poisoning is terrible --a double wammy   I had loved Barrio for close to 20 years at all locations but will now stay away

5M8bD0nvG26mfz87yjUkmQ.text: Heck ya... one of my all time favs comes to Sky Harbor!!!

qwrhPHnbnQy5VfuLtD7RnQ.text: High prices, slow service.  15 bucks for a pollo poblano burrito with fries. Choice of salad or fries. After 15 min of waiting, I received my burrito with a salad. So I asked for my fries. They simply scraped the salad off the plate and plunked fries on top of the balsamic mess. My burrito was soggy, mediocre amount of chicken, and the vinegar taste was strong. Another thing I didn't like was that if you order takeout you cannot sit in the seating area. Dine in only. It's an airport. I don't have time to wait for someone to bring me a check when I'm trying to catch a plane. I'm not stopping here again. Pizza Hut probably would've been worth the walk...another note, the drinks in the cold case were warm so they had a bucket on the counter with ice. This ensured colder drinks but it was crowded and I almost pulled a muscle trying to lean over to get the drippy water on the other end of the counter.  I don't understand why the cashier couldn't have just handed me one as she saw me struggle. Just a negative experience all around. :( See pix.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $15 chicken poblano burrito with barrio fries
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Red lettuce and balsamic pool left behind, see review for details
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salad dressing left on plate

xSK2T5TwxF32B0-xoOxNNg.text: Review is based purely on service.  The food is good, not great - some items better than others.  Guacamole is the best thing on their menu in my opinion.  I often eat a late lunch here before I fly out, but each time I'm there the service is a bit slower, the hostess a bit more snippy.  Today was the last time I go here.  Many tables open, but hostess insisted on putting me in back of restaurant next to another table against wall.  When I asked if I could sit elsewhere so I didn't have people up on me, she said they need all the other tables for other people.  Maybe 10 tables open, and you need them all?  I said never mind, I'll eat elsewhere.  I don't do rude well, and rude and ignorant is really not good.  FYI - if you do want to try, the airport location is actually better than the one in the city!

1n7l_R8W5yTG8oBE6-Ve8A.text: The burrito is full of chicken but that is where it ends. there is minimal flavor and the food is overpriced, what do you expect in an airport. On a positive note the service was decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poblano burrito

SljF-jBNme7KSh6C6SWQJQ.text: Five stars for fresh, authentic Mexican street food, in a damn airport for crying out loud! My husband's pork burrito was tender, fresh and bursting with flavor. I ordered a shrimp quesadilla, and out came four small flat tortillas each topped with a single juicy jumbo shrimp, then covered in melted cheeses and super fresh pico de gallo. Everything was on point - the texture and home-made quality of the tortillas and chips; the slow roasted and marinated pork; the freshness of all ingredients, run out of the kitchen as soon as they were prepared. This place is better than any of the 5 mexican places in my small SoCal town. And it's in an airport. In Arizona. HUH? A bit pricey for what it is, and the wine by the glass is $10 a pop, but again, you're in an airport. If you want to eat well, it's going to cost you.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Requested VERY spicy guac, and our waitress put Pom seeds in there too. What a tasty idea!
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arizona burrito, with really nice tender pork.
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp quesadillas - very good!

jQV56rCxIlCLWvR9hxKNRg.text: This was my most disappointing airport food experience ever.  Thinking, "hey, we went to barrio cafe and it was a great meal, we can have a good meal at the airport.  great!" I went in with expectations.  And those expectations were so not met.  First off, no frozen margaritas.  They're on the menu, but they were out?  How does one run out of traditional frozen margarita?  Pretty sure you take all the usual ingredients with ice and stick it in a blender.  So 2 members of our party left.  Then we get food.  Disaster.  I order the cochinita pibil (which I had the last time I was at Barrio Cafe).  Definitely not as good.  Didn't finish it.  Hardly ate it. Husband was served overcooked, dry, microwaved chicken.  We had margaritas on the rocks.  They tasted like salt.  Just salt.  They comped the chicken (after my husband complained), but we're not going back.  There are better restaurants for us to spend our money at.

dIhT_Pv6vAjSpiZU4trIXg.text: I have flown numerous times and never, once at an airport have I been kicked out of a place because I wasn't eating their food. I've been at the airport for almost 9 hours due to airplane problems. Ate at this place this morning. There are no community tables or an area to really eat except in the benches by the terminals. The lady was rude. Kicked out flight attendants on a lay over as well. Just rude. Ps the food wasn't all that great. Ended up throwing out half of my burrito that was 9$  waste of money

8I5QHTklSchVCtZz0lPjaw.text: Good airport food...actually, just good food.  Had pollo poblano tacos with chorizo. Very good.  A bit pricey for a quick meal before a flight but beats the other options.

hkI84Xv7FneHarF7fYgzqQ.text: This is an airport bar with all the airport bar amenities. That means $10 draft beers and the oh-so-airport add of a mid-shelf shot for "only" $5. What. A. Deal. On the plus, the bartender was pleasant in the way bartenders are pleasant when they know beyond the shadow of a doubt there is a 0% chance you're a regular. Also, it's there. And it's the only place in that gate where you can get a drink. Beggars can't be choosers. Tip well and enjoy your nap on the plane.

t90JUrlFfml-1z8O82Xrhg.text: I was craving burritos so I figured I would stop here to eat since it was near my gate.  FOOD: okay The GUACAMOLE was probably the best thing we had.  They make it fresh for you at table-side so you can request what you want or don't want in it.  The CHIPS are kind of hard though, so after awhile, my jaw started to hurt. haha!   SERVICE: so-so At first, the waiter was on top of everything -- friendly, patient, attended to our table quickly.  But after we got our food, the service was horrible.  Our water glasses remained empty, it took forever to get our check, and forever to get our card back.  The waiter seemed to be too busy flirting with the hostess or something.  I guess he didn't come here to work....  PRICE: typical for the airport

TjWr83NaaPUcvJO99qft9g.text: Carne Asada was terrible small portion lots of fries. No flavor. I have eaten here twice both meals terrible.

iCrSoBcU9UYz2FjMKvH2Ig.text: Not bad at all, especially for overpriced airport food!  Margaritas are good and strong, perfect for a delayed flight. Barrio is a very pleasant surprise for the airport where I am used to eating crappy $10 sandwiches. Coffee is french pressed and very tasty, even for coffee snobs.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French pressed coffee at the airport, who woulda thunk?!
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice margarita

KnT9d1Chc-kmPFIjJSTN0Q.text: Service is slow, and the Bloody Mary that I love to have before a flight was way disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary??

r97LiqxYW-Yr_MqcPnhXrQ.text: The chips and salsa were simply bad at any price but at $9.00 it was insulting. Plus the $18 glass of wine - what a rip-off. As a Phoencian, I'm ashamed that this is what's offered to visitors.

rfGOW9b5fXC1CAToFdTGsQ.text: Sat at the bar - good service. Had the steak tacos - pretty good. Draft beer - 20 oz. Total = $20. I left full and not broke in the airport. I'd go back.

NTrprMwcZkQvNc7OtcJ-vQ.text: Not bad for an airport restaurant. A little loud whether from the airport ambience or the music played. The food is pretty good and much better than the typical airport fast food. I like the tacos.

7m_KnK23Hhjoa7FnHJlDOg.text: Not bad for airport food.  Really enjoyed my torta.  Beer taps weren't working when I was there, so that was a bummer.

-k0Td7rOo6Q-hFnQcC7-ig.text: Way overpriced. $19 for a salad, its highway robbery! I do not recommend this based on pricing. NO Airport employee discount either.   There are other vendors with more reasonable pricing within walking distance in the terminal.

TDzt-c9Ug2hlHpVxPcu9cg.text: Really flavorful light Mexican food. The pork tacos and pork burrito were great! A little odd to get steak fries with tacos at a Mexican place. The peach margarita was pretty good. It had a nice peach flavor with just a hint of the tequila in it. Defiantly not your traditional Mexican food but I loved that it was so light tasting before flying. Service was a little slow, but she was nice. Would try again when flying from Phoenix.

kTjRV4-fnFXS9as61pbaFQ.text: If you are starving between flights and only have time to grab from their to-go cooler, don't bother stopping.  No one working the stand and the bartender refused to ring me up.  To the male bartender who was unnecessarily rude--acting like something is not part of your job is never the right response to a customer.  If you don't like being a restaurant employee, that's on you and it's no one else's problem.  Please don't take it out on the people who want to spend money at your establishment.

evoPMq24w_gKDQKsQ0lz8A.text: Reena-an was so friendly she even plugged in my cell phone for me crawling on the floor to plug it in.  The food was very good to.  It made my 2 hour delay much easier

o-NuT4FhmquZGAtLOlaDHA.text: Wow... To have the same name of a great restaurant and deliver an experience that is subpar to say the least is an incredible let down. Expensive, cold and just disappointing.

K31BN9C5pZhTkK7NWQ7khg.text: Best Airport food I have ever tasted.  Table side guacamole a must have!

-n4tj7y1e2lBubgR98dweA.text: Crap wine selection served in dirty glasses. The food was good, but the dirty glass makes me wonder if the plate was even clean. Great fast service so I have to give them some credit.

uvYZItMam2KshOuELagPTA.text: Why do I always eat here? Food is just okay. Expensive and very slow service

ZCeDGwosIZ5E4zt2iO3t4A.text: Well I guess they must have read some of the reviews as I got a great lunch - fresh guacamole (one of best I've had) and great beer-battered shrimp tacos. None of the complaints about poor service apply - can't complain. Was in and out in about 30 mins at around 1pm on a weekday.

SqUNTpKiDSPz4hmzusXRPw.text: I was at the airport and wanted to eat a little something before my flight.  I decided on the guacamole.  It was fantastic!  There is even a little surprise of pomegranate seeds in it.  They prepare it table side and you can tell them how much or how little of each ingredient you want.  The chips were also good as was the ice tea.  The next time I am in town I will definitely go to the regular Barrio Cafe in Scottsdale.

MMOcm6VsbmNJ_Y4epPdcfg.text: I love, love, the margaritas and food. I purposely show up at the airport 2 hrs early since usually depart out of Gate C. Seriously the best airport restaurant for food and drink. Best of all I, the food and beverages are the same price as the other airport restaurants.

yBcIS4UI8_LfNFZjBcjBRQ.text: As far as airport food goes this was pretty good. I had the pork tacos with the side salad instead of the fries. First of all for $12 it was a ton of food. (Fyi my meal was cheap but everything else besides the tacos and burritos were spendy) The tacos were street taco sized but there were 4 of them and the salad serving was pretty generous. The salad was delish and I suspect a lot of it had to do with the cheese. It was unlike anything I've ever had. It's like a cross between a mild goat cheese and cottage cheese. The dressing was really light on the greens too which was great after a weekend of horrible eating. The tacos were really tasty too. On the salty side but the marinade was good and the pork was really tender. Topped with a pico de gallo and more of the cheese. I actually really enjoyed it. Though I ended up scarfing it down like a starving coyote since my first flight got in a little late and it took me a while to order. There is nothing else really for food in this terminal but regardless I would probably stop here again. I would just make sure I had more time to enjoy.  I should note I sat at the bar. This is not for the to-go window.

RojOkNLq0cFrjxb8GFUXiQ.text: Surprisingly good for airport food - not only was the food good, the beer was tall for the price and the service was fast and very friendly.  Finally an airport restaurant where you leave feeling full and not ripped off!

3o2jlig7J89TQGJ9I8yBtQ.text: This is a great airport eatery and bar. I came here once before and had an awesome Bloody Mary. This morning my husband and I had breakfast burrito and breakfast sandwich.  Both were substantial (particularly the burrito which was bursting with chile verde) and delicious! Servers were very nice too.

NS3U2E6z0JV2WIHWKdlo5g.text: Best airport food I've ever had hands down... uhhh hello!?! You're in an airport and buying alcohol did you expect it being cheap?!?! For an airport place it has great food, I had the chicken poblano burrito wife had pork tacos... they we're both outstanding! Yes a bit expensive but again you're in an airport! As far as it replacing Wendy's???? Are ya kidding me?!?! Hell yes! Go to sleep!!!

0kMFVPuyLniuLg-uYaCdPw.text: We've tried Barrio Cafe several times while flying out of terminal 4 & always leave dissatisfied with the service. Friday we had an hour to kill so we thought we'd have a few drinks & the guacamole. Guacamole was supposed to be made at our table. It was not & many ingredients we left out. Chips were definitely over cooked & when we asked for another bowl we were given more of the same. Couldn't have a second drink as our server played the old disappearing act! Never Again, Barrio Cafe, Never Again!!

N7fvjhYeThAyNOxFsWi82Q.text: Surprised to find Barrio Cafe here in the D.  Great breakfast, could not pass it up.  Bustling eatery serving creative Mexican fare & over 200 tequilas in cozy digs filled with folk art. Offerings Alcohol Beer Cocktails Coffee Comfort food Happy hour drinks Happy hour food Hard liquor Small plates Vegetarian options Wine  Best damn Taco's!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vx5j1dMImCnLQL1oAIvgIw.text: So for the 3rd time in the past few months while traveling through the Phoenix Airport,  we tried to patronize this restaurant.  This time we walked away after not being seated in 5 minutes of waiting in front of the "Wait to be seated" sign. The restaurant wasn't busy and a large number of employees socializing and ignoring us caused us to leave.  The last visit, we were seated and left at a table without being approached for almost 10 minutes. This seems unacceptable to me and we will probably not be back and we travel to Phoenix often.

slvqTBQG6Y8PiJ3NONocwA.text: Close to the gates, with plenty of seating and outlets for laptops. We wanted a drink while waiting to board. The waitress was clueless as to the pricing and offerings. It's a tequila bar and I had to ask for the tequila menu. Then when I order a flight, she asked if I wanted it doubled - I asked how much to double the flight - she didn't know. Came back and said $15 to double and I ask, each shot or for the flight?  She was confused. Then realized I ordered a flight and acted like I was the person in the wrong. Weird.   $27 for a flight of good tequila in an airport. Not bad. We had a quiet corner, Mexican coke, and pressed coffee too.   Can't comment on the food but be patient and CLEAR with the waitstaff. You might get the same one.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican coke w gold tequila flight

OQpWghpnOs46tJPlLIfkWQ.text: Guy Host that worked this morning at 6:30am was super polite and a very genuine guy ! He made my experience here very good ! He went out of the way and went above and beyond ! Promote !

LfW50p3lura9XSuTkxBiiA.text: This is the first time I've ever ordered Mexican food that was completely inedible. The only good thing about the dish was that it included chipotle mashed potatoes. For $26 I would completely steer away from this. I had the Camarones enchiladas. My stomach is still turned just thinking about it. Nothing but cheese and partially cooked tortillas, I ate the shrimp but they tasted very fishy.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Camarones enchiladas

sJccbLvVHDKGOe6ObI3-9A.text: I really wanted a restaurant feel when I landed in the airport. I had a two hour layover so I wanted to make sure I got a good meal. Barrio Cafe fit what I was craving so I decided to go.  Our waitress was incredibly nice. The food was a bit slow getting out. I got the burrito (I forget what this one was called) and while it was good, I wanted something more from it. It didn't have anything exciting or different for me to mention. And I know it's airport food, but I was excited to eat in Arizona because I've heard so much about the food. I chose barrio fries on the side. There really isn't anything special about them. They are fries with spicy seasoning on top. For airport food, this is a great place. A little pricey but still decent.

1z2PtT04mZ9aK9x8INW0yg.text: Typical poor quality, way overpriced airport food. 25 dollars for enchiladas that I couldn't cut though even with a knife. But at least they were served with a side of.... mashed potatoes and zucchini!?!?  But you have limited options so you might be stuck here. Good luck.

rb9wlDeoRn39kaF8si5uQA.text: Not bad can't really expect much from an airport good except it's always expensive and expensive!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barrio nacho it&#39;s pretty good

gLoXnWr9B0wTWy2JdeHy6g.text: My experience here wasn't good. The wait staff was  fine but the food wasn't good at all. It was way overpriced for what you get. I had cochinita pibil which I have had several places over the years. This was the driest, most unflavorful, and to boot the most expensive I have ever had. This wasn't a $22 dish and they plated it over stale old mashed potatoes. I was hungry and it was almost inedible. I would highly recommend you find another place in the airport to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_ZSP1THULdpaOcegfqfZrg.text: The best part is the ketchup- it's a little spicy, has smoked flavor to it, overall very satisfying. However, guacamole, enchiladas and fish tacos were all lacking some binding component to taste good. Guacamole was freshly made basically in front of us. That's nice. But I'd add more cilantro and onion to it.  Enchiladas had too much butter. Really, butter was all I could taste pretty much. Scampi shrimp on top of them was very good but I wish the dish had more shrimp and less butter. Fish tacos were rather bland, unfortunately.  The murals are pretty cool and the service is quick. Summary on the food - good house made ketchup and scampi shrimp, good guacamole, but everything else is on the blandish side.

LxHSZRmtB28NKs9LDtlU2g.text: The food was good however, the manager who sat us asked us to keep our child's stroller on the outside of the restaurant. We told her we'd prefer to keep it with us and she said it was a fire hazard. She did let us sit at the end of the bar with the stroller after my husband asked. Then, while sitting there we saw a family leave with a stroller and one more family come in with a stroller. Ironically we're at an airport where you hear every 3 minutes not to leave your items unattended. Waiters was great! Manager needs to find some where else to work with her bad attitude!

JQeJiFT1PCfBWetd1E5CXA.text: I would give no stars.   No customer service skills.  Out breakfast came out 100% cold.  Cold eggs, cold potatoes, even cold bacon.  Worse place ever.  Do not go to this place   Horrible experience

gGRW4ab9yM8BQ9ZZcTKsDw.text: Great service, amazing lunch! I had a long layover here and took one look at the menu before deciding this was my kind of Mexican food! The server sat me with all my luggage towards the back left side of the restaurant where it was nice and quiet. I ordered the shrimp and avocado salad and enjoyed every bite. I can easily say avocados are my favorite lunch fruit/veg and they are not commonly served in airports!  When I got done with my lunch I was able to plug in my laptop and get some work done - what a pleasant surprise Phoenix airport had to offer me this trip! Thanks to Barrio Cafe for easing the burden of traveling just a little bit. My server was super nice and left me alone when she saw that I was working. When I needed to checkout she was quick to run my card and get me out to my flight.

aUlETJfGVsG2lFZ9oL-h2A.text: This place really should be ashamed to serve what they call Mexican food...   ordered a burrito and enchiladas.   Taco Bell has better food than here.  The only thing decent was the Mango Margarita..   that was 4 stars

zKfTYjOP5Ddo6qeWzQJi1w.text: The service here is HORRIBLE! They are RUINING their brand with this location. The chips were stale. The food was cold. The wait staff (plural) were painful to sit through. Waiting 6-7 minutes for a tea while watching our server stand around and chat with the bartender. This place is supposed to be one of the best in the county?!?!  The food was mediocre at best and the care from the personnel is insulting.

OAoi1FG-k572WZLJhB5O6Q.text: The best restaurant in the airport by far. Even though I typically fly American I'd still go through the Southwest airline gate to get to this restaurant and then walk around to my gate. Once you're through security the airport gates are laid out in a big U so you can walk around if you have time too.

MYgv-iO4EhV2jgVIIUveYg.text: Sat down for 40min, ordered a drink, never received drink. Went on flight sober af.  .

tRn1yOcI0bDHaMjWFoxsWQ.text: They say hunger makes the best sauce, well, you need to be starving to enjoy this food.  I got the chilequiles verdes. Finished about half of it, kept hoping for a sliver of jalepeno to give it some flavor to go with the abundant red onion. No luck. The tortilla chips were hard as rocks or soggy in the bland water-verde sauce. The scrambled egg was ok at least and the side of unripe fruit was mostly thawed...  Plenty of other choices with better reviews. At least the server was friendly hence the two stars. I guess the tips on the over priced food would keep everyone smiling.

YKXoIeKcjnUKmt5K6hZ0ig.text: Terrible, everything ! Save your money, crappy expensive food , margaritas tasted just sour! What Mexican restaurants serves fries or salad side? No chips and salsa , No beans and rice in this place at all, ordered the Arizona Burrito, it was a slimy mess , Save your money and eat anywhere else

xCT4nZev1v3ZsoGDCUb-uQ.text: The airport can be such a drag. All the hot bodies, angry travelers and yelling children can be quite a buzz kill. We needed a pick me up before heading home. Popped into Barrio for drinks. We were seated in the middle at a small barish table. It was so hot and loud. We saw the exterior bar open up and asked to move. No problem. Ahhhh we were already feeling better.  We had a great waitress who took cars of us the whole time. We started with a bloody Maria for me and a margarita for Derek. Followed with a 16 oz beer and what do you know, you can add a shot of Jameson on for $4. Yes please. Great break in between flights.

kT_EWNUQCwsGmbDBxIZyzA.text: We had a long layover today and had eaten here before. We walked all around Terminal 4 to explore the food choices, but ended up back here close to our gate. We kept thinking that we weren't that impressed with the food and prices last time; we should have listened to our gut. We ordered the guacamole and the cochinita pibil tacos (which they are known for). They first brought out the tacos piled high with fries, but we ordered a side salad. When they brought it back out, the side salad was so small. We were both shocked at how small it was. $14 for a taco platter and a tiny, tiny side salad is steep! The guacamole was not cheap either at about $12-13, and it had cranberries in it. Server was not very friendly. I recommend you go to one of the burrito/torta places in another gate area. It will be almost half the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tiny side salad!

a8FICuRvdFlS1ZqZjdeqCw.text: The kitchen took shortcuts with our $13 Arizona burritos. They left out the crema mexicana and the Oaxaca cheese. Our 2 burritos only had the pork green chile in a tortilla. Shame on the kitchen for taking advantage of airport customers. If the Barrio cafe had a little more pride, this place could be delicious.   The server did bring us some crema Mexicana & Oaxaca cheese when we complained, but naturally the cheese wasn't melted. We tossed the cold cheese into our burritos.   My fries were decent for airport fries, and came with a spicy ketchup which I enjoyed. Our server was cheerful.   The cafe is in the D terminal and is convenient when flying Southwest. Ask for a table with outlets and you can charge your smart phone for more yelping! Or just eat somewhere better. )-; 0-;

Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My Arizona burrito for $13.  They left out the crema Mexicana and the Oaxaca cheese.

EJ2v8xXgiq_uM7R49TEvpA.text: Of course I was looking at distance from my gate, and chose Barrio Cafe. I love Mexican food and was hoping this would be a good choice in D gates.  The host is very friendly and cordial.  I ordered Tacos de Pollo Poblano with a side salad.  The tacos looked like vomit topped with goat cheese. Less than pleasing. And, if I had known the 'soft' corn tortillas would come basically raw and plenty hard, I would have had airplane peanuts for lunch.  The saving grace was the side salad. Great flavors.  Was it worth the $15 price tag? No. Next time, I'll walk down to A gates and eat at Blanco's Tacos & Tequila.

I_-Xys5n86NiIi0vtkoQlQ.text: I begrudgingly hate going to the airport, but be-still my heart... There's a Barrio Cafe here! I was so excited about my find, I spent my time enjoying a delicious plate of Chiliquiles Verdes while waiting for my flight to depart.  The Chiliquiles Verdes cheered me up right away. The tortillas had a crispy texture that was just the right amount of thickness. The baked seasoned tortillas supported the weight of the rich ranchero sauce that embraced them.  With all this carb loading, the French Pressed coffee prevented me from falling into a deep food coma so I didn't miss my flight!  Barrio Cafe definitely helped kick off my morning to a great start!

NT2NwcVZ4Ju9hqIorjSyzg.text: The people behind the bar were polite. The hostess was rude. Lady I don't want a burrito with cheese I'm allergic. It's 6AM and there is 6 customers here. How hard is it to make a burrito without cheese lol. The people behind the bar had great service and realized how easy it is to make a burrito without cheese lol. The hostess maybe "Andrea" couldn't grasp the concept.

l-zmyfyQpMmFp6sOfXUV5A.text: Three stars is probably spot-on for an aggregate score of this place.  They are in the airport but they are an extension of one of the popular local Mexican places.   That said,  I probably would have been far happier had time allowed me to go to one of their other locations.  I could sense a much higher level of cuisine when reading their menu than what arrived at my table.   I secured a table after a wait of less than 2 minutes.  Securing a server took quite a bit longer. There was a waitress who showed up after I had been sitting there for about 5 minutes but she walked right past me and proceeded to lean against a fixture behind me.  I turned around and asked her if she was my server.   She wasn't.  She didn't approach my table, didn't ask if she could be of assistance and didn't offer to find my server.  She just leaned.  I asked her to assist me with finding my server and she offered me a seat in her section instead.  I was settled,  my bags were settled... I just wanted to be introduced to my server.  With much reluctance, she finally pointed her out.  Thanks.   When my server was table-side,  I told her I can't eat jalapenos.  No problem - we can prepare almost anything you want without them.  I selected an enchiladas dish and asked if it could be prepared without jalapenos - she said the dish doesn't have jalapenos.  It arrived with something on  the side that looked a whole lot like it contained jalapenos.  Her answer: it's on the side,  you should be fine.  Should, huh?   I had the enchiladas with shrimp.  There were six small cheese enchiladas with a beautiful sauce and four decent size shrimp perched on top.  The dish was beautiful.  Sadly,  it arrived barely luke warm and the waitress vanished.     I could tell that this would have been a killer dish in one of their real restaurants  but it was flat here.  The sauce was creamy, cheesy and just slightly salty with that great mouth-filling taste that you get when you bring goat cheese to the party.  I wished I had a few tortilla chips to scrape up the remainder after I finished the enchiladas but chips don't come with the meal at this location.  The shrimp were cooked just about perfectly but lacked a scampi flavor as the menu had promised.  The tortillas were slightly hard around the edges... not sure if they were stale but it seemed likely.  I really, really wish that I had the opportunity to try their food in one of their real restaurants.  I don't know that I will be back in Phoenix anytime soon but getting to one of their real locations will be my first dining priority and I will do so with an open mind.  Unfortunately, and the other Yelp reviews bear this out, the only thing this location is doing is besmirching their good name among travelers.

h4NMleQzlMU_83lt8tOcXQ.text: Best nachos I've ever had. Hands down. If you are fortunate enough to be in this terminal of PHX...do it.

IsY84Lj_Vh-nvRm1Bm46wg.text: Beyond exceptional for airport food. We ordered two salads and they were fresh and the chicken was great. I would also like to thank our server, Marina for making sure I got my purse back to me that I left at the table. We were about to leave for Portland and I heard my name come on over the intercom. She didn't have to react as quickly as she did, but she did. I appreciate it. We also had quite a bit of cash we were carrying. Thank goodness for Marina! Give that girl a raise:-) We need more honest people like that in the world.

pkS00IugH9Z8IELEXyeJ4A.text: I don't expect a whole lot from airport food, but this place is downright terrible. Especially when you consider the cost of the food!  We were sat promptly, but the hostess didn't bring menus (she seemed SUPER uninterested in her job), so when the waitress showed up a minute later, we were already frazzled trying to order drinks, but we made it. She took our drink order and thankfully gives us time to look things over for our food order.  When our waitress came back with our drinks, she joked that she didn't take a sip...ok...haha...but maybe she should have. My $10 original margarita was nothing more than water and lime. There wasn't even a hint of a taste of tequila in it. My husband's $14 margarita wasn't any better. For the cost, I shouldn't have to guess if the bartender remembered to put tequila in our drinks!  We attempted to find out waitress so we could ask for our drinks to be remade. She was no where in sight. In fact, we couldn't get anyone's attention.  Not willing to find out if our $17 tacos would be equally as bad, we left.  If you want weird and not great service, and terrible and terribly overpriced drinks--this place is for you! Not sure how the food is...so eat at your own risk.

Tp9sbfJBuzZMYwiRwroqMA.text: Not a fan. I had the Arizona Burrito, which was actually pretty bland. It came with some spicy fries and spicy ketchup, which was actually the best part of the meal.  Service was a bit slow. Took about 15 minutes to actually receive my beer and wasn't offered a second one til I was about done with my meal.

DPRWtp3t-aZXXyqz1yXf6A.text: Hire friendlier people for the front of the house.  Hosts were rude, and didn't even know what was on your own menu.

E8TV6s0sF0R17zPI0HKM0w.text: Coming back from San Diego I was hungry not starved. Since the Barrio Cafe was near my gate I stopped in looking for something cold to drink and nothing too heavy to eat. The menu was chock full of belly stuffers and just before giving up I spied the Posole Verde Soup. It was deliciously described as: Pork, hominy. Roasted tomatillo and poblano soup topped with shredded cabbage, sliced radish, and diced onion. What a fabulous choice. The large chunks of oh so tender pork, the spices, and the wonderful broth was off the charts. I added some hot sauce and bingo it went from a solid 8 to a 10.  This was one of my best airport restaurant experiences to date. I just wish I had a thick slide of coarse bread to sop up the remaining broth!!!! Service was great at the bar. The bar stools are kind of funky as the cushions are too thick and soft you feel like one False move and you will flip off.

T4wvsfsqqQrpfTJ6rmIPmg.text: As far as barrio cafes go I hope this isn't your first experience because the original is amazing but we are in an airport and when you live in airports like I do it's refreshing to see local restaurants representing inside the terminals.  I say restaurants because Le grand orange is right next door where..... PS. you can get a glass of wine for half of what I'm paying here in the barrio.   The food at barrio is always spectacular if your looking for a 16 dollar shrimp quesadilla but if your looking for complimentary chips and salsa and a glass of wine.... pass. Because the 9 dollar chips and salsa  they serve is... sorry to be rude not worth it and in my Phoenician opinion are not what should be served in any PHX Mexican restaurant ever! and the message the chef is sending comes through loud and clear. Don't come here unless you wanna spend money and trust my recipes. But I will because then again I am stuck inside terminal four and spent 30 bucks on wine and pizza last time so at lease its something different and the service is always phenomenal.

uFBLwe5wdhVZyGrLxU1ssA.text: What can you say other than it's an airport restaurant? Everything is overpriced & not too high on quality but the drinks are good & it gives you something to do while you wait for boarding. At least the server was decent.

eIc5kXEA_ksD4HAZZrJNRg.text: Quite possibly one of the worst meals I've ever had at an airport. Overpriced menu, stale chips, nearly inedible corn tortillas. The only saving grace of the Barrio Cafe is that it serves alcohol so you can forget how bad your meal tasted.

mMfaPR0rZk19vl_VLRi5Zg.text: High prices for food and drink. If you have to have Mexican food then be ready to pay up.  3 tacos for $14/$16 1 tequila based drink $11-$14 No chips while you wait.  One good thing about this place, they have free water.

G1KUZJCj_A5EMNdQqMTrbA.text: For airport food, this was pretty decent. Ordered fish tacos and they brought me shrimp. Waitress felt bad and brought me two extra fish tacos, so I could taste them. AND AND they are hardly selfish with the avocado! I got over a 4th of an avocado on each taco. Do the math!   The waitress was helpful and extremely friendly.    And don't get me started on the margarita! Don Julio Cadillac Margarita, and MAN! It was RIGHT! She was not selfish with the tequila and I sure appreciated that!   I will DEFINITELY try again.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Don Juilo Cadillac Margarita! Got me feeling real right! The bartender was on her job today!
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp/Fish tacos

pQdEANLxi5cmkmd5Jojc1g.text: Was headed out of town for the weekend and thanks for a flight delay I had some time to kill and thought it would be cool to check out what Terminal 4 has to offer now so I checked things and out and made my way on over to Barrio Cafe. Ok one of the things I like about Phoenix Sky Harbor, they are supporting locally owned restaurants and bringing them into the terminals for others to enjoy, I think it's a great thing. skyharbor.com/pdf/Termin... I like the look of Barrio Cafe, the art work is cool. I think there is a lot of improvement to be made with the hostess and there crew, when I 1st got there I told the host I was a party of one, she gave some other person a menu and told them to sit me at the bar table area facing the people walking to their gates, walked me to the spot, put menu down and walked away, not once did they check to see if this chair belonged to someone else, maybe the drink should tipped them off, told the person whose seat I just stole I was sorry, walked back up to the podium and gave them back my menu, then they put me at a table for 4 with 3 other guest who didn't even know each other, and this was a bench seat, so I had to ask the man if he would mind moving the bench so I could sit down. This was not cool, I was so very close to saying screw this shit I'm out. Since I was at table with a bunch of strangers I didn't know and room was limited my idea of reading my book while eating a meal was no longer available. Barely had room for my purse on the seat because everyone but me had a carry-on bag. Also at the table next to me a man was sat there, and he waited for about 10 minutes before anyone came to him so he walked up the bar to order his own beer, but when he left his table the host put 2 people at it, he came back and saw no room for him anymore. Our server was Victor, he was a friendly guy just very over worked, I even heard him tell the host not to place anymore people in his area until he can clear some tables. Again this is something I shouldn't be hearing. Ok so I had some time to check out Barrio Cafes web site while waiting and learned 2 things, supposedly this is truly excellent, very authentic Mexican food and BC notes on its website that its food is not deliberately chile-hot, wants the flavor of the seasoniongs & spices to revel themselves. So don't expect heat, no chips no salsa either. After looking the menu over I went with the burrito pollo pablano , it had grilled chicken breast with roasted poblano peppers, caramelized onions & garlic with goat cheese and a cream reduction and had the choice of salad or spicy French fires (because spicy French fries are way more authentic than beans or rice?) I picked the side salad, it was salad greens with diced tomato and goat cheese on top of it with a balsamic dressing, it was good, enjoyed the flavors. The burrito though, I had high hopes, the chicken looked like the stuff you can get at the store, the deli fresh grilled chicken breast, it was perfectly sliced with grill marks, had no flavor at all, the peppers, onions and garlic was bland, no flavor, the goat cheese didn't have that bite it normally has, the cream reduction was like a thin alfredo sauce but bland. This entire burrito lacked flavor & spice and not the heat type of spice. I wasn't impressed with Barrio Cafe , even if it was the airport addition and not sure if I would wonder on over the downtown Phoenix location . And I really wanted to like it, So thrilled that Sky Harbor is putting in locally owned places, just think they missed when they added this one, but good news is Los Taquitos is almost done being built.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pollo poblano burrito

tFY7HNy161dG0Kg7M7M1gQ.text: The food options at this airport are not great.  But if you avoid this place, do.  The food is terrible.  They should be embarrassed serving this rubbish.  The people who work here on the other hand are great!  I feel bad they have to serve this "food".

vEQsE30bVg_hgqdx2DmE4A.text: Nachos no more...unless they are from the Barrio Cafe! Great spin on the makeover of the nacho plate. Very tasty! Will come back just for that!

OMj4E8i5ujSbB2oEPzDXKA.text: Average but expensive airport food. Had the pork burrito, it was salty and uninspiring.

XPiPy-GHe0pxig9m35rBFA.text: The best airport food I've had in years, if ever.   I knew I was in for something special when the waiter brought the bread and sauce, a sublime combination of tapenade, caponata and salsa.   Then came the menu. Decisions, decisions. Should I play it safe and order a burrito or try something different and new? I chose the latter and went with the cochinita pibil, a slow-cooked (12 hours) pork dish served with mashed potatoes, a sort of pico de gallo, marinated cucumbers, tortillas and a little au jus on the side. Fan-freakin'-tastic.   Not sure why the other Yelpers on here gave this place such short shrift. If Barrio's other locations really are that much better than here, then this is the best Mexican "chain" on earth.   Worth getting to the airport early for!

YFDt5gF3JAHOxcjjfQB4FQ.text: Don't do it! The drinks are strong, that's my only compliment. I was on a 3 hour delay and decided to opt for a table to nosh while I waited.... I ordered the table side guacamole for $12, so I guess since I was sitting alone I didn't rate the table side service. My server brought a bowl with the ingredients piled in it and proceeded to smash it all together with a spoon. There was so little avocado in the bowl that even after mixing and smashing it all together it still didn't look Iike guac.  So I ordered the shrimp tacos for $14, they were street taco size and I was surprised to see 1 fried shrimp in each taco, that's it! I understand they are small, but come on, I expected at least 2 shrimp per taco! To add insult to injury, each street taco had a huge slice of fat avocado on it.... Guess I know why my guac was so stingy... They save it for the tacos! Not my favorite, even though it's the airport, there are other choices....

6X3SfblasnUd2dsG67FRoA.text: Always good food here.....great to get in and out of waiting on a flight. Have never had a bad meal and the service has been really qick

OGUYdhnNWtUh_Bx77mnzRg.text: Just left! Server took 10 minutes to greet the table. She couldn't even smile. We ordered 2 coronas and waters all around. No waters got delivered. She dropped off the food not even asking if we needed anything else. We ate, the food was good. Christin didn't check back in. At the end I had my card out to pay waiting. Overall she made the experience shitty.

YAOx5BeF6zaD6j8acRjuTw.text: Came here on a layover and noticed that the restaurant next door got 4 stars. Well, we have not  had mexican food for a while and decided to try it.  Food came out fast but cold. Service non existent after the food came out. Food was not bad altho.

o45u8RnPfLvb14UNM5xeRQ.text: Great place. I just got back from Mexico and ate the tacos there and I ordered the steak tacos here and it was the exact same. True, authentic stuff. Guacamole looked great and salsa was fresh. Only problem was the 9$ chips and salsa and 14$ for 3 tacos. But that's Sky Harbor airport for ya

ti1NraKHHREfVsts0WSuTQ.text: Good service, good food but expensive - can't expect cheap food in an airport! Will continue grabbing my pre-flight food at the Phoenix's Barrio!

NbYCA5Y9M6_5IXZkcNxG5A.text: Food was ok, waiter forgot the beer I ordered.   Also, he picked up 5-6 cups from different tables at once and asked who wanted refills. Not too weird, but cup came back to me with a chewed straw in it. Not mine. Who knows if the cup was.

H_CTFQVoeEUt59dSZWz7zw.text: Awesome upscale Mexican food for airport! Got the az burrito. Yummy green chili pork! In D terminal right by boarding

S62PkSu1MOHtlLk9jc7h-w.text: Missed a flight at sky harbor and grabbed a Bloody Mary here while I waited. It was one of the tastiest Bloody Mary's I've had in a long time... our server was even cool enough to ask if I had any preferences with how I liked them made. May have to make grabbing a drink here a travel ritual.

BsKkinDl6JxPs6FRaUVVEA.text: Don't come for large portions. Food was good quality but a bit pricey. Service was rushed and inattentive.

QN_x3rnCqlgJ1HK5gVkndw.text: This might be crazy but anytime I take southwest and I have to have a layover I always make it in phx. Why because of this place here. BEST UNTRADITIONAL NACHOS EVER! Scale of 1-10 these nachos are a 20 ! I eat a whole order to myself every time! A little pricy but I honestly don't care worth every penny and the layover I just wish we had them out here in Seattle ! Can't wait till my next layover lol

Zyj-mc-DLesovYGT7MmOQg.text: Save your time and money. Food was terrible and cold. Servise was the worst! Stay away!

tzPPgCGZQoxSxI9tLFQv3g.text: Quick service and happy employees very friendly and the food is delicious and tasty!!!! Had their fish tacos must try with their salsa!!!!! Definitely I will eat there every time ill be in the airport before my flight!!!

awDedTurjl6qkjmYv6IDVw.text: A bit overpriced but that is to be expected at the airport. Very good nachos! Amazing grapefruit margarita. They do not serve water at the table unless you ask. They try to sell you bottled water when you leave. Order the chips and guacamole. They make it at the table! Great service. I would eat here again

-6fDAkN68exYUrmM8Qjgbg.text: I was stuck in the airport after a delay with Southwest Airlines.  Had some time to kill and was a little hungry.  The place looked bright and clean.  I was seated immediately by a nice greeter.  Placed an order for chicken tacos and checked Yelp reviews as I waited for my food.  Got a little worried after reading some of the negative reviews.....several about the chicken tacos!  Before I could even finish reading reviews, my food was out.  3 smallish tacos. Soft fresh tortillas with piping hot chicken.  The cream sauce was delicious.  The salad was nice and cold.  Mixed greens with balsamic vinaigrette.  My server Vincent was friendly, polite and efficient. Absolutely worth every penny of the $14!   I'm glad I read the reviews AFTER I ordered or I might have missed out on this place.

WR2Avn9Fsmjy69ntLbDcvQ.text: Usually I don't do airport food.  WOW, great food, atmosphere and awesome staff!  Brittany and Monica are awesome! Highly recommend you swing by the D-Gates.

zXWJboaOiwXWCRyyQePsng.text: Got stuck a little longer than expected and landed here for dinner. Near Southwest gates D 1 - 8. A bit busy (its 5:30 pm) but I didn't have to wait for a seat. Nice. Traveling solo and the long counter facing out with a place to charge my phone was just what I needed for my hour and a half. They told me it cost $2 to sit here and believed them but yea.... I missed the joke being so tired. Decent looking menu and I opted for the Posole Verde. Pretty quick service. Pork, hominy, & tomatillo topped with cabbage, radish, cilantro, onions, and lime. There's some serious chunks of pork in this soup! A little spicy and extremely salty but I mean, it's pork soup. Duh. My only gripe really was when the waitress placed had spilled soup from the bowl into the dish and I had to rescue a soup covered spoon before I could eat. I'm sure I could've gotten a new one had I asked but I just wiped it down. Other than that, $10 well spent at an airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Posole Verde

kLmNR10J4zGOxfAdWuYAeg.text: Subpar food and service. Surprising for an airport. At least they usually have quick service. Go somewhere else for a meal here.

8u92uBYqi5o5piNRGTRhlQ.text: Terrible, terrible service. We waited 15 minutes for the overwhelmed server to show up and she was a little grumpy.  Requested a bottle of wine and were told that the bottle we wanted was out of stock, so the server offered a recommendation. Turns out the recommendation was also out of stock as was our 3rd choice. Ordered the table side guacamole and (1) it was not table side (2) the chips were stale. The server let us know that all of there chips were stale so we made do. The guacamole itself was great. The main course  took too long to come out but was wonderful when it did arrive. I had the pork my wife had a shrimp appetizer.  Overall it took longer than an hour and 15 minutes; way too long for an airport.

sOG72lLy5MHVxAGqTGf-lg.text: Ok for airport food. There was only a partial menu so no basics. But it was ok. The problem is at this airport there are some great food choices so that makes this 3 stars.

sGRjvYYwbSZ-xX830CcKPw.text: I would only recommend this place for the drinks! I find it odd that a Mexican food place doesn't sell chips and salsa or beans! The main side for food is fries!!! It's really weird! I think they should rethink their menu!' For this reason I give them 2 stars!  I had a chicken spinach salad and it was decent!

NYJZ6GnEm7UKGR7Tv9O3dQ.text: Just had weirdest experience.  Wanted to get beer b4 flight.  Somebody had roll-on at bar between two seats.  Was told couldn't stand at bar in space occupied by somebody's roll-on.  Can not stand at bar. Must have seat.  Currently enjoying IPA at LGO. Standing!

qvkzladT6Tg9giOGbxNrKA.text: Two strikes you're out Barrio Cafe. I love supporting local businesses and have been so pleased to see the arrival of so many to the airport but when I'm at the airport I must put efficiency first. This is where barrio Cafe sadly fails. In the future I will stop in for a drink but I will only sit at the bar and nothing more. This is because the service is sadly some of the worst I've experienced. On two separate occasions I've eaten here and both times the lack of service have almost cost me to miss my flight. After serving the food the wait staff seems to disappear and it's impossible to find them. I would ask and ask and then when I note my need to hurry for fear of missing my flight I have been snidely commented to by the staff. The food and drinks are good but I think the customer service and efficiency needs major improvement if they want to be successful in an airport environment.

PkBeTPwotn7WkdM0aOsBJA.text: Try the guacamole - it's an experience.  Service is authentico too.  Cold beer -  all its missing is a beach!

hiM_x84xORMJOtWjMqfFqw.text: This place has plenty of potential, the premiss is good - latino food in PHX Airport, decor is good, menu is varied and has tempting items. The waitstaff has improved and attentive and interested. The manager is very nice. The reason I met the manager is the food. Ordered the Chilies en Nogada - a poblano pepper filled w/chicken,dried fruits, pears, apples in almond creme sauce. Execution is the problem, dark brown food in a nice soft pepper with light tan sauce and big red cranberries and dried cilantro leaves. Chicken was overcooked! Why didn't they use fresh cilantro? The favors could have been great but I think they are trying too high a scale of cuisine for the location. A smaller menu of all fresh food would not embarrass the chef/owner. P. S. Because of a 2hr delay, I tried the Flan, it was very tasty, but the strawberries were not ripe...

nvtk8ZAJB07nI97w7_GGWA.text: Not only overpriced for too small of a portion (did expect that being in an airport), I did not anticipate the server being completely incompetent and rude! Needless to say, won't be back!

bRnjpbndSQfPx2hKYnq3bQ.text: Before today, I would have given this place a solid 4, maybe even 5 star review. I've been here many times for lunch and  dinner. I've even intentionally chosen to have my layover in PHX because I love the food at this place! That all came crashing down today...Breakfast was so gross! The hostess was super friendly. Our server was warm, friendly, and speedy. The food food was terrible. My husband and I both ordered the pork verde burrito with (scrambled) eggs. The pork has a strange gamy flavor and I actually wondered if the eggs were real!?! Something was very off and totally disappointing. My kids had the pancake kids meals. They were fine. For a $60 breakfast, I felt robbed. I know they can do better. I'll be sticking to the lunch and dinner menu from now on. The carne Asada or shrimp tacos with a side salad are delicious!

ZXiAXUeXlLdoJsP7WR4-xQ.text: The food was good but they needed more meat in it. the bloody marys are excellent, have a double. Our server Cardi, short for Bacardi, was great! She did an excellent job.  Only thing I would recommend is to have the hostess wipe the tables w a dry napkin prior to sitting folks. Really annoying to sit down on a WET table top!

5DnoePtSI_ATNiwQ1q-yZA.text: My husband and I stopped here during our layover in Phoenix... I was super excited since I've eaten at the regular Barrio Cafe location in Phoenix, but unfortunately this was a major disappointment!  The service was slow, our waitress was pretty unfriendly, only 2/3 of my husbands tacos had meat, my nachos were ice cold (on top of not really being good in the first place).  Top all of that off with probably the worst tasting margaritas we've ever had.  All the other tables around us all said theirs were lousy, too!  All in all a bad experience. Walk to Terminal C instead!

DHvlY4zkf4OkVcosn0pnZw.text: Bland and boring.  Whats with the fries?! No body in the world wants mexican food with fries.  A bad representation of Phoenix in an impressionable location.  Besides the sub average flavor the tradion of bad attitudes and slowness from the employees carries on from the 16th st location to the airport.  Never again Barrio. Dont believe the hype.

p-AYanfuWemIYgYMy7i5VA.text: A bit of sticker shock when we sat down, but it was pretty good by Mex restaurant standards, with some interesting items you wouldn't see on most menus. Really good by airport standards, we were 4 for 4 on entrees we'd order again. Can't give it 5*, the price/value/food ratio is a little off, but I would (and will) repeat.

qwOFcUcafEx3u6qTEXAzDw.text: The coffee is good for the price.  The breakfast potatoes look & taste like they were made yesterday.  The bacon is really good!  The waiter sat two people right next to me.  You know, uncomfortably close & in my space.  There was plenty of seating elsewhere.  I initially had a server that said "My coffee isn't working today" making me think they couldn't serve coffee.  Then she explained the coffee she drank hadn't kicked in yet.  OK?  I overheard her tell the same story to another table thus confusing them about the coffee.  That story isn't working, stop telling it.  It's 7:00 AM and we are here for coffee.  Maybe she was new?  My table was sticky.  Next time I'll order a side of bacon and fruit.

rv--S5jpcT03ITdD302yCw.text: Place is packed (Gate D @ PHX) -granted, it's day before Thanksgiving. Having the Burrito Arizona - nicely done. Moist pork and tomatillo sauce w a sprinkle of Oaxaca cheese. Dee-vinnne!!!    Love the Barrio fries w/ house ketchup (spicy)!

J3sETw40J85cWlSt7NUR4w.text: For a regular restaurant this this is very good. For an airport location it is great. Great service good prices. Kuali camaron awesome pork tacos good. Fries ok.

rVJQZSCHtQSNwU6v8RK92w.text: I am a pilot with an hour to kill before show time of my next flight. I opt to sit down and relax while I get some good Mexican food. That was nice. I order the $6 Jamaica. The waiter was very confusing when he called it the Jamaica flower water. I've never heard it called that way and it sounds more like a lightly flavor infused water like rose water or something ludicrous. Nope, the waiter just didn't know how Jamaica is made so it seamed normal to him to call it water and not more like sweetened iced tea of flore de Jamaica. Now that's out of the way I get the Arizona burrito.  After a few minutes I down the Jamaica and the food comes out. It looks great  and I ask for a refill on the Jamaica.  There are no refills. The glass was a 12oz glass with 8oz of ice. That is $1.50 an ounce for Jamaica. Are these managers completely nuts? It was good but outside of Manhattan I've never ordered something so expensive.  The burrito was very flavorful but again small for $13 then piled high with frozen steak fries.  So $20.58 for a burrito and Jamaica later I'm out of here never to go back. There are many other great dining options here in sky harbor. No need to stop here unless you are not hungry and you don't care what things cost. Note to the managers. An appropriate price for these would be $1.75 for the Jamaica (or have free refills) and $9 for the burrito. Out the door with tip $12.50. I was so overcharged by your prices that I did not include a tip. I hope you pay your waiters well

hmHPDS5lfZpsGEWTaKe26g.text: I will preface this as it is good for airport food... But.... I imagine the airport location is not doing the legacy very good. The food is good... Except dried cranberries in the guac??? :/ (I ate around those). Chips were stale.. I think someone else mentioned that also and my posole was cold. I saw someone else commented on cold food so looks like they have a little problem. Also the waitress was completely overwhelmed and it wasn't that busy, but To her defense I think she was the only waitress in the whole place and she was hustling and very sweet. Overall... Wasn't bad and flavors were good and authentic, but when you say things like world famous on your menu it kinda sets the bar pretty high. If they hadn't I may not have been so disappointed.

fT3N63C9pdP33Q0nhVxIqw.text: Liked it here with great service and good food.
