Then I saw the bartender grab six dirty glasses with his bare hands, put them aside in a sink, never washed his hands and grabbed new glasses and filled them with beer and other alcohol!!  Dirty dirty dirty!!  Glad I didn't order any alcohol from there!

xePX0-YpdcSoJq0XzI4RlQ.text: What a treat during my layover in Pheonix! As I walked by, I smelled deliciousness, so I couldn't pass up an opportunity to try Barrio Cafe. I got the steak tacos upon suggestion and I was not disappointed! Flavorful marinated steak with large chunks of avocado on corn tortillas. AMAZING. The side salad that comes with it was great as well.   Hope I get 'layovered' in Pheonix again in the future so that I can try their Arizona Burrito, green chili pork, and shrimp tacos!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak tacos with a side salad! They def don&#39;t skimp you on the avocado

jExWsQtK5r50cdpSYd3LMw.text: A must for airport goers! Here's the story: After a friendly encounter with the TSA, then followed by an uncomfortable find of a store called "Indigenous," my stomach's attention was caught by a cafe called Barrio. My legs then followed suit as my stomach gave chase to the Mexican influenced aromas. I was greeted by friendly staff and fast service, but more importantly was the "famous guacamole."

49Iqglm06YS8MfrWbptfmg.text: Best Restaurant in the entire airport!  I had the chicken tacos with verde cream sauce.....fantastic.  Friendly people and perfect SW cuisine!  Pricey but it's the best kept secret at the Sky Harbor airport in Phoenix!!!!!!!!!!!  Many of my friends always come to the Barrio Cafe!

-zSBK5fJfVt-QgOrISFoIQ.text: Servicing fries with burritos. Wtf No salsa with it.  Chose of salad or fries, really and this is supposed to be Mexican food  Street tacos were ok, salad dressing would make salad swim Server ( Tami) was good though very pleasant

iQytRdrdxe0glV9SU9kOsA.text: First, I hate leaving below par reviews for any place I go but I will be fair in this review.   A nice Airport restaurant with a decent menu. I can't fully review this restaurant as we were only served drinks.  The margaritas were good, not the best I've ever had but they held their own. Prices were ok, for being a Terminal restaurant, pricey for other standards. We were seated quickly and the hostess was nice. Our server came to the table some time later and we ordered two margaritas. My wife ordered the pink one and I ordered the spicier one, can't remember the names of them now as its been a few weeks.  The restaurant was busier so it took alittle time to receive our drinks and the server was ok. After we got our drinks our server went on her break, which isn't a problem at all, but the server that took over for her was absent. I mean, we never saw him/her. We would have had another round but after waiting 30 minutes with no server even after hitting the call button on the table we finally hit the Payment button. Still, no server, we finally had to wave another server down just to get our bill.  Overall I could do without going back to this spot, though the margaritas were good they aren't worth the wait.

T8Hvmfm39wv-X4vMq3tQsw.text: I enjoyed what they call their "Arizona Burrito". The (smallish) burrito is filled with an amazing mix of tender pork and cheese covered lightly with flavorful sauce. I opted for the garden salad side and it was a very good accompaniment.  My wife had the skirt steak street tacos and she loved them. She grades her street tacos on a tough curve. Order coffee and it comes to the table in a large french press. We chose Barrio Cafe only because we were very hungry on a recent layover and they  had open seats. Turned out alright.  Unlike many of the reviews below we experienced prompt and polite service. *I knocked off a star because a burrito should not cost $13.50 no matter how good it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barrio Cafe

yYEqes9RLmBcuyRnoh_UYA.text: Incredible nachos. Fresh made cups, variety of cheeses and super fresh ingredients. Seriously so good and shocking for an airport. Go get em.

z8fjrHXZ48RdnJaKcB2R5A.text: This is surprisingly inspired and delicious food in an airport. The restaurant is True to its roots and the passion is evident in even the "simplest" dishes. The quesadilla borracha and empanizado del mar are great starts; we do the tacos with fish or shrimp every time we travel through. The only downside is the prices, which are to be expected in an airport meal--they're no reflection on the restaurant.  Staff are friendly and food is relatively quick; if you have angst about time, order to-go at the side bar.

6ZC55B2Ib61T350sqyt4Bw.text: I had an excellent breakfast type burrito here, I was surprised how good it was.  The coffee was really weak and nutty, looked like tea but that could be the way folks like it in Phoenix.  Good service too.

WULmF0QhQxhL926MzG4ARg.text: For an airport restaurant this place is decent. I got tacos and nachos. I can't even describe the nachos. They looked like a plate with chips and every ingredient you can think of thrown on top of them. Very bland, and the sauce was gross, runny, and tasteless too.  The tacos, however, were really good- fried shrimp. Hit the spot.  Also had a couple margaritas which tasted mostly like margarita mix. Basically the tacos were this places saving grace. If you're craving tacos before you leave or your flight is delayed I would get yours here.

mZHtzZdgdGV9idbMX0RmtA.text: Rude, unprofessional, slow. We had a terrible experience here but love the restaurant downtown. The menu is lovely but customer service leaves a lot to be desired.

nNLoaBsAJ3Xvs7_r9wX3eA.text: I had a rather long layover at the airport and was searching for something light and filling to eat.  All of the salads at the neighboring restaurant were pre-made and covered in cheese, which I personally do not like.  Of all of the available choices I thought that Barrio Cafe was a decent option.    I ordered the fish tacos and a side salad.  The food was pretty good, however they could have gone a lot lighter on the breading of the fish or offered a grilled option.  The flavor of the food was really good and so was the service.  I would consider going back if I was in that terminal again.

Hwl3O6MrgPmIqG2jk6QeeA.text: Surprisingly good eatery for an airport.  The place was packed and servers running about madly attending to hungry flyers.  My server eyed me from across the bar, reading my impatience and immediately came over.  I had the carnitas torta (Mexican sandwich on a hard roll). with fries.  The pork was tender, super juicy, and bursting with flavor.  The bun was good but could have been a bit crunchier.  Fries were fresh and tasty, accompanied by spicy ketchup.  The Cadillac margarita was excellent.  Take this out of the airport and it would be a winner.  All in all, a good experience.

8ecyxxEE5778QVt7yIHmBg.text: Horrible service.  Overpriced food and drinks.  Overall lack of zest to everything and everyone working here

EkCM5MQIkmYqeF0dvuFB6Q.text: It's Monday Oct 17th @7:30am.  I've been sitting being quite waiting for my yogurt parfait (it doesn't need to be cooked). It still takes 35 min for it because she said she forgot to put it in. The bartender (Teri) keeps busy. Then she starts hollering at the servers while I'm sitting at her bar. This is rude. She says how it's her first day back from vacation and she's struggling. That's fine, but be nice to your coworkers. The granola parfait wasn't that. It was a fruit plate with yogurt and a dusting of granola. Disappointing.   On another not there's an older gentlemen who seems to be her bar back. He does her job of making sure everyone's takin care of. He's nice. Made sure I had silverware because she only gave me a spoon. He makes small talk. He makes her money. I hope she knows this!

Y-B_JPBnmbt9YZ2g9S_j1Q.text: This place had the worst Mexican food I've ever had. Overpriced, greasy, and tasteless. Avoid the horchata.

CBqWlMQ_DTcxuFDq4yXveA.text: $15 for a top shelf margarita on the rocks and the mix was so terrible I couldn't finish it.

b4rqkO3OX5K2eXPs2h6dLQ.text: The best part of this place was the beer. Guess it's hard to mess up pulling a tap handle.  The beer was slightly overpriced but still ok for an airport.  We ordered the "table side" guacamole.  Not made table side which I didn't care but don't advertise that on the menu.  The chips were so hard they were almost not edible.   Probably the worst part of this place was the service.  From the time the hostess sat us we felt like the server didn't want us to be there.  $35 for two beers subpar guac and horrible service not even worth it at an airport.  There is a cafe next door that is the better option.

Zu4fezu7dsgEpYcF1-CvVA.text: Spend your money elsewhere. I had a chicken burrito and thankfully nothing else. The  servers were slow and rude and the water seriously tasted like it came out of an old outdoor water hose.

Z5ml7gv1KhFslEkhVx81ww.text: Terminal 4 gate D. Table service and service is SLOW. If you are in a hurry, go somewhere else. We would have gone to La Grande Orange but they don't have enough seating. Barrio has Limited vegetarian options and no vegan options. They do not even have beans. My husband ordered fish tacos and said they were bland. I ordered the torta Barrio and although the bread was good it was just ok overall, and they left the seeds in the Chile which I don't like.

mmct8-tr8izBlr4p6sWEuQ.text: I'm sitting here in the restaurant thinking I just don't get it. The hype that is. The food is bland. I had the award winning pork. Really? I felt like that scene in Elf where he ran in because they had the worlds greatest cup of coffee. I guess everyone's taste is different but wow. The food is also super expensive. I realize it's the airport and maybe the regular restaurant is better and cheaper. Maybe not. Glad this is a work trip and I get reimbursed for this meal.  By the way no chips no salsa and a side salad or fries with my meal. As we speak a couple just walked out without ordering. Limited menu and $25 enchiladas combined with zero flavor. Do yourself a favor and take a hard pass on this place.

dvDnjjScpjv0VuepP6UBpA.text: For an airport restaurant, the food here was actually pretty impressive. We shared the guacamole and pork tacos. Yum! Both were tasty and the tortilla chips were legit ones. The service was ok. Seemed a little understaffed. But our server was friendly and came around several times. Not exactly a quick place to eat. But if you've got an hour or more, eating here is a good choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guacamole
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork tacos

nk79wZOYKR4-Db6iwEfXEA.text: Enjoyed lunch at Barrio Cafe between delayed Southwest flights. For an airport restaurant the food was fair and service was slow. It we had nothing more than time.  Ordered the kid's grilled cheese with fries, it had no extra butter which our kid enjoyed. Got the pozole and the Arizona Burrito. Both had good flavor and portions were the right size. Pozole needed to be hotter and a bit more meat. Burrito was good:)

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pozole
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arizona Burrito with side salad
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grill cheese with fries

qKjkMvUBdfdbuqrsHrJH3Q.text: This restaurant may be the one of the top reasons I like having a layover in Phoenix. This morning I enjoyed chilaquiles verdes and loved the pork in the sauce. I have always had great customer service and excellent food here. When my husband has layovers here, I also ask him to bring me food from this restaurant. The prices are decent and the bar area always seems to be doing well too.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilaquiles Verdes with egg over medium

0BLFD_GdsN1qYd75bpWotw.text: Guacamole is a must. Ensalada Tata is super refreshing once you are inside and out of the burning heat of Phoenix. I forgot to take a picture when it came it was so inviting! Crisp veggies, generous with the avocado and the shrimp just the fright temperature.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ensalada Tata

LKxwaRpUwYOKJ8BqX7OOhA.text: I don't understand why this place has so many 2-3 star reviews. Barrio is definitely the best food option in the airport. Although service can sometimes be slow, I have never had an unfriendly server. I will walk across the airport past every other restaurant to eat here.  I don't find it to be particularly overpriced, especially when considering the premium you pay at almost all airport restaurants.  Don't skip Barrio because of the reviews. Give it a shot. I guarantee it's more satisfying than the alternative.

iYa3y54vRk_yLoWTcBF1vg.text: We stopped here for lunch and a beer while we were waiting to leave on vacation, and have to say I wasn't very impressed. The service was good and we found a seat at the bar right away, but for the price I was disappointed.   We ordered the Quesadilla Barracha (shrimp quesadilla), and it honestly didn't even look like a quesadilla. It was four little tortillas arranged in a circle, with one shrimp on each and some toppings in the middle. I actually saw the waitress walking over with it, but I honestly thought to myself "I wonder what that is?", because it didn't look at all like a quesadilla lol. The shrimp also had the shells on the tails, which was kind of weird and not that appetizing to see. Once we got the shells off and made them into little tacos, it was actually pretty tasty, but not very filling. For $16.50 I expected more.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NDzZM7X4JXSqmF0j4kdrPg.text: Let me see if I can unpack the good and the bad here.  Airport restaurants don't seem to follow the usual rules, and quality and service can vary widely depending on the time of day and staffing.   Atmosphere.  This restaurant is a strange shape, and it's not their fault that they have weird angles here, especially in the back.  It's attractively open air in the front, but they tend to wedge people in all the angles here, which can make you feel stuffed in a corner or behind columns.  The restaurant is relatively clean, and there are lots of use of wrought iron and paintings on the wall.   Service.  Service was prompt when being seated, and then poor almost immediately after that.  I was not in a rush, but getting my order taken took some time, and getting the check after eating was slow to occur also.   The food.  This was the high water mark.  Had a salad, which was good and filling.  What I really wanted was one of their famous fish tacos.  Unfortunately, they don't do tacos a la carte, so they denied that request.  My tequila and soda was made right and was good.    Overall, there aren't a lot of options in this area of the terminal, and this option is just okay.

2yKxfiKjrBzMg2aNbdYALA.text: I love the barrio cafe down town. Unfortunately the airport location is terrible don't waste your time. The McDonalds at the airport is better which says a lot. Eggs and bacon extra crispy is not a difficult request. However what I got was greasy eggs with undercook bacon.   The staff seems to be more concerned with going on in their personal lives and what people are wearing.  Too bad they are damaging the good name with bad food and bad service

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VnewDPLJ2CdEEN29CrPecg.text: Very disappointing. I've been to the real place and it was fantastic. This spin off in the airport was a bad idea. The food had no flavor (even the onions and tomatoes in my omelette) and the chilaquiles looked they were soaked in chicken broth. Luckily we were able to return it for something else. Definitely not coming back to this place for food, nothing special here.

3WHTia_Mfv7TgghQFJug7w.text: Sangria was great and fresh!  The chicken tacos had lots of flavor and the cream sauce was light.  Good pick for an airport!

4vrwRHcO38BcTJE2UVaAmg.text: Shrimp quesadillas 4 individual s.  Pork burrito green Chile burrito.  Both were ok.  This restaurant is inside the airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tDfBH1tPL-QnfpoNF1VM-Q.text: Delicious food and even better service! Our waitress was Yolanda and she made the experience come to life!! Ordered the fish tacos and they were delish! 5 stars!  And the desserts were also amazing! The churos and flan were bomba!

QH30BvQUME3dnvQpQtZshw.text: Worst Mexican food ever, had their Arizona burrito the meat was almost cold. Sauce was at best so so, their barrio frys were a total joke, no taste and some red stuff lightly sprinkled on them. Needed a green chile fix and this was not it. The service was super rushed, even though they had plenty of open tables.  After three days on  Amtrak, this was a super let down.

Z3XC0-txwSx7n26ZvgV_Ig.text: Great food horrible service. Janelle at the bar was especially unpleasant.  Had the chicken poblano burrito. Hubby had the carne asada.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. SanTan American pale ale. Cheers! Hoping the bartenders service improves...

C3eyfQf65jUmti3r176h_g.text: Barrio has so much hype and I was really excited to try them out! I had an evening flight and thought it would be perfect to grab a margarita and pozole before boarding. Both were good! However, the service was kind of non-existent. It was busy, so I understand the service part, but the entire experience was a bit underwhelming. I was alone and sat at the back of the restaurant, the layout felt odd. Maybe it was because I was in the airport, but the experience wasn't what I thought it was going to be.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Posole and Marg before my flight!

Sz8tZDyXiwJgfhDL_q3Arg.text: Good tequila selection with a tequila bar in the back. We were here on the day where the terminal 4 was closed for 4 hours for bomb threat.  Thousand of people got stuck here. People was frustrated. The line to he here so we could get a tequila shot while smelling everyone else's sweat!   Chaotic!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0e_eOJcZjrkIFPPJ4VUn-Q.text: We stop here every year to see Ken! The potatoes are great as well! Ken is very friendly and likes to engage in intelligent conversation. We hope to get back sooner than next year. However we own our own bar and restaurant and it's difficult to escape. We appreciate great food and service when we can escape!

Z7fYZUNoMhybmTxRQyz7CQ.text: Because you have to give one star. First it took an easy five minutes for someone to seat us, and that was after my husband went to find someone. Next we got "tableside" guacamole that was not made tableside, and was so full of o ion it was inedible. Then the $16 quesadillas arrived. Just ew. Four smushy small tortillas drowned in broth of some sort, topped with four shrimp covered in Mexican cheese with a little pico de gallo in the middle. When politely brought to the servers attention, she did nothing, no apology, no attempt to replace, nothing. This is new after she disappeared for ten minutes and the manager didn't respond to my waving.   Update: the server did end up taking them off the bill, yay for justice!! But yeah, don't come here.

hD-aQLuklgodQYqYh7EaFw.text: I'm not sure how many people read reviews for airport terminal restaurants. But I certainly will start looking for them after my experience at Barrio's this morning. I hope this one will help someone so they don't make the same mistake I did. My 3-egg omelette came out cooler than lukewarm and unedible. But the potatoes and toast were even colder. It came out very fast which would have been awesome if it was hot. I suspect they had premade it expecting a breakfast rush and it sat under a heat lamp for quite a while.  I asked for a replacement, which came out just as quickly (I don't normally complain about fast service unless they aren't actually fresh cooking my food). While the eggs did come out hotter, they must have given me the same potatoes and ice cold toast.  and once I started eating, it became obvious there was not 3 eggs in my omelette. Maybe 1.5. Lesson learned. Look for reviews. Avoid Barrio's. Normally I would eat before coming to the airport, but I'm on day two of what was supposed to be a 6 hour trip, so choices are limited.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0axT30h2su1UxJT0_lqMrA.text: I almost didn't stop in here due to the middling rating. I'm glad I did!  Delicious Michelada and chicken poblano torta, good music, atmosphere, and awesome murals.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Michelada with Negra Modelo!  Yeah, baby!

0a6vI_KmUdUu7zQLNUAoTg.text: Stopped in for a quick breakfast bite and a drink.  The bartender was friendly but a little brash.  No worries, I didn't plan on staying there too long anyway.

SDVzBDp4FeYhevL4wJ-tRQ.text: 14 minutes before the server came to the table. Got water in 21 minutes. Food was good but served cold. Most likely server issue male server brown hair man bun wandered about aimlessly. Another patron at the table next to me ordered a beer, we were laughing about the service, she finally got a beer about 20 minutes after she sat down.

Smao_K4qlw0wdCkYt0B_vQ.text: Let's start this way. I could not decide between pork or beef tacos. I asked the server he said that the chef was known for her pork treatment. Chef ?? pork treatment?? These are words I would have never expected to hear at an airport restaurant. Way cool. And the food itself delicious again very unexpected at an airport. This is not the least expensive place here but well worth it. You are about to be crammed on to a SWA plane at least enjoy this one luxury.

0U7SVrpHBkXg1Ka5TEXKbA.text: I wanted to grab a quick bite before flying back to LA.  Service here could hardly be described as quick here, nor could it be described as accurate.  I never did get my drink order that day; not even a glass of water.

kpwoMSJWLYDL6ryT2GKGMQ.text: Margaritas are great but BEWARE, they will charge you $9 for chips and salsa. It's not on the menu and the server didn't mention the extra cost.

6jUugaV46jt-h27Qz38GpQ.text: Best pork burrito I've ever had. Best airport meal ever! Hope to fly through PHX again just to get one!

GiYAEwb_NWHnZgxtR4igSQ.text: The only reason to go to this place is because you are held captive at the airport.  It is extremely over priced even for airport food.  The nachos are $17 and barely enough for one person to enjoy.  Taco Bell has better nachos than here.  The Arizona burrito has no flavor and served with salty seasoned fries.  The  margaritas are very overpriced, small and no flavor starting at $10.

u3NB-HIXSUT5Mtye2_vbDw.text: Nice "fancy" restaurant in phx. Great staff, excluding the hostess, great wine pours, but the barrio salad tasted like it was dragged thru the barrio streets before being plated. It sounds promising but the favors taste awful. Get something else.

eHQIODxRczx3Yz6YOOo0Iw.text: Was hungry on the way out of PHX so stopped here.  Margarita - yum.  Food - came out cold.  Came back again was luke warm.  The guy next to me said hi steak was not that warm either.  Would move this review to four stars if they heated their plates!  Service: pretty good actually.  At least for me.  Just get drinks and colder items like guac or salad.

7VQW_MrPMnqxq-GAtXcBFw.text: After a hectic morning which resulted in me missing breakfast I ended up in the Sky Harbor Airport around 1:00PM with a short one hour layover. The Barrio Cafe appeared to be the only restaurant that I could eat at and still see my gate. Needless to say, I was starving and everything sounded good. I had ordered the Arizona Burrito. It was... Well... Bland and distasteful... The meat had large chucks of hard inedible fat in it and lacked flavor. Even for airport food the Barrio Cafe is terrible. Service was mediocre the waitress was indifferent and preoccupied talking to her co-workers. I will never go here again. Even if this was the only place to eat I would rather go hungry until I land at my destination then eat at the Barrio....

zH6onQ6u0ZerFwIdYcTf6Q.text: I've been this to restaurant several times while waiting for my flight. I ordered the poblano sandwich and it was good. My server Marina was so helpful and friendly that I hope she's working next time I'm at the airport..

-2TH8PGTbpnncKcExzV4rg.text: I decided to try the Barrio Cafe at the airport on Thanksgiving morning before my flight and I received the absolute rudest service I have been a witness too.  The man who served me should not be in the customer service business.  That kind of service is bad for business and really is an embarrassment to the brand.

2bI7KotaB47DC8Ja6_A8Gw.text: Standard to slightly better corporate-style Mexican fare. Overpriced margaritas are probably the best thing about the Sky Harbor Intl Airport.

4iuBaorO5wtG69GCR-3OXw.text: If they charge $11 for a tiny glass of friggin' Cadillac they'd better make it right. Boy, this place sucks. That is why I live in LA!

GSxM0d0FRCZNAnK1oU0Ukw.text: I wish I could say something good, but the food was lousy, overpriced and the service wasn't much better

48BKNz4yTe9S8FL0EwZwlQ.text: The food is bland and the drinks are expensive, If this doesn't bother you it's an ok spot to hang out between flights with a few flat screens to entertain you.

wztYgouI2gE_SQpfSw9zYA.text: I hope maybe my visit was a sign that this place is turning around a bit. I went to Barrio in the airport on the way to NYC a couple weeks ago. I had the burrito with chicken and goat cheese and all sorts of yummyness inside. I thought it was very good! Very close to the quality of the food at their original restaurant. The service was a bit slow for an airport place, but that means you have to get there a bit earlier. The BF had the pulled pork torta and really enjoyed his food as well. I would say the cons include: expensive, not enough space between tables for a place in an airport...need a little space for luggage etc, and the service is slower than fast casual places (obviously). The pros, however, include: The food is very tasty, the ingredients in my food tasted fresh, they have tasty margaritas, and you're in the airport and not eating at pizza hut.....Hopefully the kinks will get worked out at this location and it can be just as successful as the location on 16th st.

YIOj7f3Q0QKurEidimek0g.text: Best place to eat in the airport.  Fish tacos are fresh and it's a nice change from airport food :) I'll be back.

Paye08BXgikH4t7is-FTEw.text: Nasty to-go chicken burrito.  It was  boiled chicken in a gravy rolled in a flour tortilla.  yecch.

mf7vmsXPJ_en83VbzSmQLQ.text: So understanding I have only been here one time, you cannot (or can.. your choice) take my review as absolute fact.   The menu was rather on the small side, and while I THINK I saw it on some tables, I definitely didn't see it on the menu, and that is, chips and salsa. I dunno, maybe I have lived in El Paso for too long, but damn, chips and salsa? That's not even something you pay for, that's like automatic when you sit down... get with it Barrio.   This is one of very few places to eat in this particular terminal, so yea.. it was hella busy. But That is ok. We honestly didn't wait that long, and had 2 hrs to kill. So win-win I guess.   The menu was kinda small and kinda, I dunno how to put it, but it just wasn't like El Paso. If you've ever been to El Paso, you understand that its actually North Juarez. So yea, cant really get more "Mexican" than the Mexican food here... since we are in Mexico. Anyways.... I ordered some tacos, they were OK.. the tortillas was fried or cooked or whatever.. kinda weird. They did have a bunch of tequila on hand, and many travelers seemed to be enjoying that.   Here you go, here is where all 3 stars came from: The freakin double churro and ice cream dessert I ordered. O_M_F_G dude.... so I ordered this dessert, it was basically 2 (rather large) churros, with cinnamon and chocolate powder on top, with this inside made of melted caramel, they were HOT... and they sat on a plate next to a generous scoop of vanilla bean ice cream and fresh strawberries. Now dude check it... I have had churros, from japan (yes they sell them there in movie theatres) to Mexico, I have had some churros.... THIS, this random kinda ehhhh spot in a terminal at the Phoenix International (Sky Harbor) Airport... was the best churro dessert I have ever had. Honestly, the dessert alone was 4-5 stars, but the rest of the place 1-2 stars so it evens out at like 3.   I dunno, if you're in Phoenix, and in this terminal, why not try it out? But then again, why would anyone (voluntarily) be in phoenix?

y-0sPQ-hX3NDv7asl5-Lzw.text: I'm in a lot of airports - and the food is hit and miss... this was a hit in my book.  Delicious, friendly, quick, and reasonably priced for the quality of food I received...

xMzs7PcxCON31TUBUV5rzQ.text: Sunday May 21, 2017 7:30 pm 3 of us had 2 hours before our flight and had Barrio Cafe for dinner. We ordered tableside guac & chips, Ensalada Mata (shrimp cabbage salad) and a margarita. Food was EXCEPTIONAL. Pricey but well worth every penny. As others have said, their margaritas are terrible. Hard to figure how they can make a margarita so bitter and yucky. Maybe "fresh" lime juice isn't so fresh. Food was very very good and I will definitely seek out Barrio Cafe & try other menu items next time. TIPS: 1. Have 2 hours and take your time. It's not for someone in a hurry. 2. Ask for extra cilantro in your guacamole. 3. The shrimp is so GOOD and TASTY, ask to pay for extra shrimp. 4. Lastly, ask to taste the margarita mix BEFORE ordering or get beer.

x8B-Wi8NPIj6OufaUO7enQ.text: My husband and i just ate breakfast and it was good. After we paid $30 for breakfast I asked the lady behind the bar if she would fill my water contigo with ice so i could add water before we boarded our flight. She said "Im not allowed". I said "really we just paid $30 for breakfast and you cant give me ice????"    Good food the WORST service made me think that I won't eat again at Barrio cafe.  So disappointing!!!

HyVg5NTjMZ-NP4IQ-LTs3Q.text: Below average food.  Slow-to-average service.  Forget ordering anything out of the ordinary.

2BSxzfh3hsSgDlLaeHEttg.text: Ordered a cocktail & asked to change tv channel from basketball game not one person was watching. Manager said they'd "look into it." 20 minutes later still no change. Server asks if I want another. If you change channel, sure. No change! Now more ppl asking to change channel to oscars. Servers were nice but "manager behind the curtain denied request." So weird.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not one customer watching either tv...manager would&#39;t change channel to live oscars awards show. So I left.

q-qJujFf9p2KokrR3js6TQ.text: Wow! What a pleasant surprise. Great service with call buttons to order or get check quickly. Food was very good, and with unique dishes to choose from, there is terrific variety. Margarita was yummy!! And not overpriced for airport. A great place to relax before your flight.

MOA_u_IJZMXXfPVYDbaqyw.text: Airport restaurants are pricey. This was no exception.  The Pollo Pablano burrito was delicious as was the Borracho Quesadilla.  The service is terrible. We waited far too long at an airport terminal. The drinks were very overpriced and our server didn't know the difference between the margarita and the Paloma.  We asked 4 time for our check.  The only reason our server got a decent tip was we didn't have time to wait for change.

vIfSYBQ0M--he3TX7BdYmA.text: I got sucked in by the idea of pancakes and mimosas, but I have no interested in paying $14 for a mimosa that I'm sure would have a light pour. I opted for coffee, which was sour and see-through but it got the job done.  The pancakes and bacon were actually very tasty, and I received 6 pieces of bacon with it plus fresh and hot maple syrup. I couldn't finish the plate and found it to be pretty tasty. However, $17 for pancakes and coffee is outrageous. I recommend any other place in the airport. In addition to the typical outrageous airport pricing, the service was mediocre. I don't need a bright, beaming ray of sunshine. I just need polite service without mistakes. Asking for a coffee refill seemed to ruin this waiter's day.

UfpIgM1xQFfB2DmwAMJpHw.text: This is an okay place near the D Gates in Terminal 4. I had a five hour layover at PHX so I thought I'd try it since a friend recommended it.   I had flan and a strawberry frozen margarita. Both were fairly average tasting and a bit expensive ($12 each).  The booth was ripped in multiple spots and I waited 30 minutes after sitting down before someone asked me if I had been helped. Luckily I wasn't in a rush.    A plus, if you sit along the booth there are outlets so you can charge your phone.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flan and margarita

AVrzNkgn3SXzfPDov2u2rw.text: I really appreciate having the option of sampling some local restaurants in an airport, rather than just the standard chain places.  Barrio Cafe is a restaurant in Phoenix, and this is their representation inside the airport.    I chose this spot because the menu items were interesting, slightly more exotic than the standard cheese quesadilla or fish tacos.  My guac was fine.  I was not a fan of the really thick chips, but I did think the dried cranberries were a nice twist.  My pork tacos were excellent.  The side salad was small and pretty much just lettuce, but fresh.  The bar style seating facing out towards the gates was great for people watching, and there are outlets at about every other seat.  The service was fast and friendly.  I like that they have those call buttons so you don't have to try to flag down your server to get your bill, but the device design could use some work.

mZY-XtPxJCMfST76Iekllg.text: Wow, hard finding a quiet, reasonably priced restaurant in an airport so thought we got to a good one.  However, the customer sitting next to us just found a napkin with writing on it in her SALAD!!! And the staff didn't even offer a FREE meal!! Yikes! My fish taco was just okay but I'll avoid this place in the future.

nQz2Fo9wfyCIe5NKymvjrg.text: The food was horrible but not as bad service. I can only guess why they kept overlooking me. The guacamole came out in big chucks. The chips were old and hard. Worst place to go for food.

swQuIv4ixcLRjwfW7AFiSQ.text: Don't go if you are a penny pincher but if you like flavorful food with some creativity this is a great place. Not a burrito style Mexican food. The fish tacos were incredible and the slow roasted pork in banana leaf was the best Removing all star as server was highly rude and un professional

n_XfTqgaMiY5xuzzgY_rqQ.text: I spend a lot of time in Phoenix Sky Harbor and in airport restaurants in general. The most important aspect to airport restaurants is that you have to provide prompt service, as your customers have a hard and fast deadline (e.g., plane boarding). For the fourth time in a row, I've had to essentially beg someone to serve me here, and then, after finally getting served, I have to beg them to bring me my bill. The push-button service call buttons must not be connected, as they don't seem to bring the servers to my table any quicker.   HMS Host, you do it right at all the other great restaurants in Terminal 4, including LGO, Zinc, and Humble Pie. I've never had an issue with any of those places. Why can't you figure out how to make Barrio Cafe work correctly?   Yes, the food is good -- once it finally arrives. Too bad I have to wolf it down to catch my flight.

V9mvII0ICyLvpGSnvCP4sw.text: Food was delicious . Food was hot. Breakfast was fantastic! Yum totally eat here again

Dbhes4gYp1TaOn8JY2oewQ.text: Most disappointing breakfast burrito I've had in my life. Bland and obviously just thrown together. Cost over $10. Lady was nice.

K9RGQMZsuyEpWMO7uNSqXg.text: I've been to many airport restaurants through the years as a business and personal traveler. This is on the better end of those eateries. The menu is fairly diverse and everything looks delicious, not warmed up in a microwave in back.  I was seated in a lounge area I hadn't seen when I was waiting for a table. I was the only one in the room for quite a while. There were two sofas, a high top table wrapped around a post and my high top. Two TVs were off and I overheard a waiter say one was broken. I was worried I would be neglected but my waiter made sure I wasn't.  I wanted a snack so ordered the nachos with chicken and a Cadillac margarita, rocks salt. OK, it was a bit heavy for a mid-afternoon snack but I had skipped lunch.  The nachos were good but the homemade chips were quite chewy, not crunchy. I found it a bit challenging to eat. The flavors were all over with bleu cheese, goat cheese, chorizo and a creamy cheese fondue. I liked the look of the dish more than how it tasted.  The margarita was super strong.   The menu has quite a bit and it's unique Mexican food so it's on the upper end of airport food. Even though I wasn't thrilled with my meal, I liked the ideas coming together and want to try more the next time I'm in Terminal 4, D section.  The discrepancy in reviews is amusing. Airplane travel is stressful and time is limited. Of course a sit-down restaurant like this with a higher end menu is going to take time or the understaffed wait staff will neglect people. Have to take the low reviews with a grain of salt.  I saw the tall beers and was envious of those who ordered them. Next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Back room area but not neglected.

3w9STvIfAgjXcfw18n8YyQ.text: This location is in Terminal 4 next to the D-1. The Bloody Mary's are spicy and delicious. I've had their pozole and today the free chile chilaquillas with over medium eggs. Amazing. Spice is just right - if you are flying out of here - allow extra time and you won't be let down. By the way - waitress Victoria was super sweet and concerned about your time - so super speedy and prompt!!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GJbc03acJt49qnsuBgi_ow.text: The most disgusting and unsanitary worker I have ever seen! Blew her nose  multiple times behind the bar, literally dug her finger in her ears, coughed/hacked and used her hand as a snot rag. Took out the trash, reached inside the trash and never washed her hands. Here's the kicker... she reaches INSIDE the water pitcher pour spout with her nose-wiping, ear-drilling , trash picking hands... who does that?   Health department would have a field day. Yuck, left after telling the managers... who, interestingly enough , were there to watch the whole thing without stopping her.

XaG8ibnvL2UCJr18udsiNQ.text: The service was excellent.    I was eating breakfast.  Pork burrito with green Chile sauce and eggs.  Excellent flavors.   Will visit again on my next time at sky harbor terminal 4.

WefZaAzD8OUCv8KuGe5FIQ.text: By far one of the worst restaurants I've ever been. Took 25 minutes to sit down in the unwanted corner of the bar. Once I sat down I waited 10 minutes to order a drink. 20 minutes after that I was asked I f I wanted any food. When I ordered a simple cheese quesadilla I was told "we do not do any substitutions to our shrimp quesadilla".... I'm literally asking you to just make it with out Shrimp! Anyways, I'm the end I overpaid for a single dos XX. Save your self the money and time, eat somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $8.50 beer...

sn12LKGyNsGlxrLUH_OZCw.text: I've had the Pozole Verde from here before which was so flavorful, although thier own twist on it, so decided to have it again. Unfortunately they dont serve for breakfast and have a very limited breakfast menu. I know! Who doesn't serve Pozole for breakfast?!  Anywho, I ended up ordering coffee and chilaquiles verde. Coffee was very bitter so I added all my creamer and still couldn't get rid of the bitterness. I just skipped it and drank water. Waiter did remove from my ticket and didnt charge me. Chiliquelies were interesting. Was more like 2 eggs on top of stew nachos on top of potatoes. Potatoes got soggy under the sauce of the stew. Pork green chili stew was flavorful but not spicey on top of tostada strips.  Wait staff was ok. Not super friendly. Didnt refill my water or ask if I needed anything else. It was not busy.  Overall was ok but bit pricey. I think next time I'll opt for the quick counter serve places than this sit down restaurant. Unless they have the pozole.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moved egg so you can see stew on top of tostadas. Potatoes under there somewhere.
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilliquiles Verde
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aAmOUJk-ge1qrW6kKpLoMQ.text: So I can no longer comment on the drinks but can say that from memory, they were tastey, plentiful and average priced for an AP.   I visited today whilst awaiting a flight.  As a direct result of having not taking time for BFast this morning.... I was hungry bordering on hangry... if you feel me...  I needed a bit of something light to eat and selected the Quesadilla Baracha.... Wow!!!  Served non traditional for a quesidilla open faced on 4 small (street taco) sized corn tortillas.  Shrimp cooked perfectly, cream, queso fresca, goat cheese and a queso sauce of sorts...  aside from having to deal with the shrimp tails, outstanding!!!  #GYSOT

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NuH9qQzEjNZk-CTJKYUJPQ.text: Maria was nice although she did good wasn't impressed.  Ordering the pork tacos, three tiny little tacos for $15 don't really think it was worth that.  We have eaten here before not sure why Lynn back but had to grab something before we get on the plane.  Wasn't my favorite so don't think I would go out of my way again.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PfL4vHG_nNTJ6mIwkpqI0A.text: I travel every week for business so that means I get to know airport restaurants. In all of the Western USA, this was for years my favorite restaurant.  I purposely scheduled layovers at PHX so I could get breakfast or dinner at Barrio's. I loved the pressed coffee served at the tables, and the portions and quality of food was great.  It was truly a SW style restaurant gem.   Then, a few years ago the pressed coffee stopped.  And recently the portions have grown smaller with mixed quality. Now, you get a near shot glass full of coffee and I had to beg for a refill at 7am.   It's sad, as I can no longer say this is my favorite. I'll still eat here but the flame is gone.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not the pressed coffee they once served.

RkOW1slDKKPzRotVni9WZw.text: Waiting for a delayed flight is no fun. Having a dog while waiting is even worse because he doesn't understand the concept. Fortunately Barrio Cafe was near our gate, so we stopped for a dinner break. I'm glad that they're dog friendly enough to let us sit at a table. Well, I sat at the table, and the dog laid on the floor... it's always nice when wait staff LOVE dogs instead of just tolerate them.   I ordered the Arizona burrito (apropos) and a peach margarita, then got a side of plain chicken for the dog. They were so sweet to do that for us. The burrito was filling and just the kind of food I needed after a long day of events and waiting at the airport. Oz the Husky wasn't too keen on the chicken until we got to the gate. Wiped out from the dog park, I imagine.    I paced back and forth in the terminal deciding what to eat and reluctantly chose Barrio. I'm paranoid about bad Mexican food, but it was a surprisingly wonderful experience with excellent customer service and tasty food. The margarita wasn't super strong, but I probably shouldn't have gotten something so sweet in the first place. Anyways, I hope never to be stuck at Sky Harbor again but would visit Barrio Care if I were.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Peach Margarita

gH6LtRM-Wj6IVgJCWDM3HQ.text: I wish I would have picked somewhere else to eat.   This place is disgustingly overpriced. Yes, I know it's the airport and you pay an arm and a leg for everything, I still felt like it was overboard.   Our server was actually kind of crummy. The place wasn't that busy and it took quite awhile for her to even greet us. Food came out and she just disappeared. Literally. Her own coworkers didn't even know where she went. We were about 20 minutes from boarding once we finished our meal and we sat there waiting for her to bring our check, hoping she's appear. Finally I had to get up and go ask someone else for it because still our server was nowhere to be found.   The omelette was decent. Country potatoes were way over cooked though. Like crispy, crunchy over cooked.   2/5 stars is because of the crappy service and pricing.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Omelette with potatoes

jZx7iJYOqcp7My7HvzmjbQ.text: My husband and I ordered food and bevs prior to our flight departure. My last drink had a piece of broken glass in it, which I sucked into my mouth through the straw. Fortunately, I didn't swallow it and put it on a napkin. Shocked, we notified and showed the server who shared the piece of glass with other staff and offered to have another one made for us. After 15 minutes, we informed the server that we needed to close out and the drink wouldn't be necessary as we were getting ready to board. The staff then still brought me another drink and rolled their eyes when I reminded them we needed to close out.   The bill was brought, and we demanded to speak to the manager. We informed him that as the drink could have caused serious bodily harm, we would not be paying our bill. The manager attempted several times to blame US for not going to him first, which we explained good customer service (e.g. the staff) should be reporting it to him, and were appalled he attempted to blame us. We again informed him we would not be paying, and he let us go.  Several minutes later, while we were boarding our flight, the manager grabs my husband out of line (as I had already boarded in an earlier group) and demanded my husband pay the bill. My husband refused and threw cash at him as he didn't want to miss our flight.  Your service and customer satisfaction is unacceptable and appalling. I would like to be reimbursed for your inability to train competent staff, for your disgusting behavior towards my husband, and for attempting to kill me.

qL6u0p_LKkmUzgMNdDl3KA.text: I came in because I had walked past their menu and was intrigued by their shrimp enchiladas.  I was seated promptly and I ordered up a margarita since I had been flying since 9am.. and literally it was just sugar water.. I ordered my enchildas and WOW.. it was just tortillas drowning in melted cheap cheese topped with about 4 shrimp.. yep..  Also,  they kind of ignore you..

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp enchiladas

dO7Zj8ooLwfZfWdVXsbF5w.text: These are the strangest Nachos ever. These are not the scooping kind of nachos I am used to. This is more like a small serving plate where you build each chip. Very messy and the portions of meat, mushroom, spinach, and pico were very small. It was tasty but I didn't care for the presentation. Too difficult to eat nacho style. Might have been better if presented in typical layers on top of the chips with more of each ingredient. I think I identified two pieces of spinach and maybe one mushroom sliced up. Disappointing. Not worth the $16.75 in my opinion. I'm still hungry. Service was pretty fast though.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strangest nachos ever

ytHGl2b5rv-vbL-vJsI6OQ.text: Came here a few years ago and tried the Pozole and made sure to hit this spot once again before heading back home! For airport food & drinks, this place is amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Totopos, shrimp and jalepeno appetizer. So good
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pozole and Micheladas
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barrio Cafe

NoWmin8RgWFV-BlteE1EBA.text: Prices are decent/airport comparable when it's the appetizers and tacos/tortas. I'll admit the dinner plates are a bit pricier. I got the soup for about $10 and that was decent, a lot of cabbage for sure (see pic). Definitely get the churros - delicious ice cream with toppings and the churros are warm and yummy (see pic).

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soup

dY98ss_znQ4CPZWWJYhnBg.text: I've found it. That needle in a haystack that all frequent travelers seek. The elusive good airport restaurant. It's the first time, in a long time I can say I enjoyed my meal at the airport. Even feel the price was worth it. I know, I know, it's just too good to be True. I can only vouch for what I had, but they did a good job.  The Pollo Poblano burrito was actually quite tasty, particularly the tomatillo cream sauce over the top. Side salad was fresh and crispy. My San Tan Devil's Ale was an excellent local brewery I had never tried before.  Service is average. I had to laugh when my server asked me if vinaigrette was okay on my salad. I responded "What are my other options?" To which she replied, " That's all we have." Looks like I will have the vinaigrette.  My food came out very fast. So fast I can't help but feel like it was just precooked and quickly assembled for me, but again I did enjoy it. I find myself with a layover in this terminal frequently, and fully expect to visit this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pollo Poblano burrito with side salad and an icy San Tan Devil&#39;s Ale. Pretty great actually.

JmRSMvrjZRH7lZAwPU4DRQ.text: Way over priced and poor quality food I understand this is an airport location, but the food quality is not worth it I had the tacos de aarachrea Bland until the slow burn of a meaning less spice hit The heat did not add anything to the flavor and just burned after eating it (while waiting for the server to bring me a drink I had order when I started eating the meal) I also had the flan It was rubbery (not a custard consistency) and not very flavorful There was something crunchy (like a candied or sugar coated nut) on top, but it did not mesh with the flan As for the service, it was slow and I did not feel the wait staff cared about being tipped  This maybe the only sit down in concourse D, but is not worth it Walk to another concourse or wait until your next destination

5DbtF-etNP9sdD3q7pEZcQ.text: This place is amazing. The guacamole was absolutely amazing. There's 7 of us and we had 4 it was so good. The food and Flan was really good too. Would come back for sure. Love the Guacamole

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome flan and chorus
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The amazing guacamole with our dental team . Thank you You Yolanda for the great service
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Staff and Dr khodai

yudz_TaH7p5gKOUKdZ0dsA.text: First off, in my estimation, there are very limited options for food at the Phoenix Airport particularly if your flight is in Gate D (where Barrio is) or Gate C. I can't speak to the other Gates. As someone who has frequently traveled through Phoenix, these are the Gates I usually end up in.   So, if you've had a long day of traveling and need a solid meal at a restaurant, Barrio Cafe proves to be one of your only options particularly when you are a vegetarian as well.  My most recent visit to Barrio was my third time there and I officially struck out. The first two visits were nothing special and I accepted it for what it was: overpriced food at an airport that I just need to consume because I have to eat something.   This time around I order the nachos but asked them to be vegetarian. First, the menu item itself is just a strange combination of a variety of items. I do not know which barrio tosses blue cheese with regularity in their nachos but that Mexican community is not getting represented well here. Blue cheese just doesn't match up with the other all over the place components to the nachos.   The presentation was just terrible. Tortilla chips tossed at the bottom, a suspect cheese sauce is on top, then just throwing everything else on it in sectioned off yet disordered ways. Grilled vegetables, blue cheese, jalapenos, avocado. The avocado so clearly was just scooped out and chucked onto the plate. There was just clearly no effort with it. It had the presentation of a Taco Bell Nachos Supreme but at least Taco Bell has the excuse of being fast food.  The taste was uninspired but I'd come to expect that from my previous visits to this location.   But what made this experience particularly terrible and dropped what would have been a 2-star review to 1-star is that these nachos definitely affected my stomach. I had to poop on my flight. I got back home, went to sleep, and within 30 minutes was awoken to my body immediately having to head to the toilet. Same thing happened over again. They should probably change the name of the restaurant to Bano Cafe. I don't know what it could have been in the nachos (my suspicion is the cheese sauce) but, when already not great tasting food ends up leading to a sleepless night and troubling stomach, that's a problem.   The service was fine but fairly indicative of the plate of nachos. The bartender kept ripping into the host who wasn't doing much of anything. She acknowledged being bored because it was dead. The other bartender wasn't doing much, either. In a sense, I wasn't clear who was on shift or off shift. But these kinds of things with service don't really matter to me if the food was good. It's just the cherry on top (that will probably make me go poop) of the experience at Barrio.   Obviously, I will not return. I think anyone is much better served to just getting prepackaged snacks from one of the stores or maybe even going to Panera Bread since that's at least a reliable chain where, one would hope, a bagel sandwich would not lead you to sprint to the toilet.

uRHtXBOPiLQrqXQ2Br3e9w.text: Unfortunately my husband and I were quite disappointed with this place, we were seated towards the back of the restaurant in an area that was being cleaned which meant that the brooms and such kept hitting our chairs and table, as well as being bumped into by the staff.   The menu seemed to be over priced, even for being in an airport; with not many options to chose from or at least anything that sounded good.   My husband ordered an Arnold Palmer, and it came out super watered down. We didn't order any food, as we weren't finding anything on the menu that seemed to stand out. Our waitress wasn't very friendly, and kept touching my shoulder which I didn't appreciate.   It was a very uncomfortable and short experience for us.

85m0RihwOglTW14HgR6-OQ.text: I had a short layover in Phoenix and I decided to stop in here for a quick bite.  My server was so sweet and once I let her know I only had a short layover she was quick to help me.  I had a flight of Don Julio tequilas and shrimp tacos that were the best shrimp tacos I have ever had! I usually avoid layovers in Phoenix and after having this experience I don't think I will mind a stop here from time to time! Highly recommend if you are at the airport in Phoenix!!

gjDsuvDy23-Oe2GK7ZBuaQ.text: Incredibly expensive for the 3 minutes it took to slap some tacos on a plate. Very bland taste as well. Right when my food came my check was placed on the table and it was made clear they wanted you to sit down eat and leave. Biggest issue was how rude the staff was, I saw there were some chargers under there bar area that faces the terminal and asked if I could charge my phone there after eating. They responded with, "If you're going to purchase something you can." To which I said yeah I just ate why would I need to purchase more? "We are trying to run a business" well you're not doing it very well and you won't have business here for very long treating customers like a paycheck.

QHPIFOfNQX0yUXY6AB8meA.text: Bartender stressed the authenticity of how traditional the food is here but yet they will NOT serve a customer chips and salsa. Claims there wasn't a button for it (what ever that means) and it wasn't worth losing his job for it. If you order the $10.95 tableside guacamole you can have chips. They do HAVE chips and they DO have salsa but it's not available to customers. They offer $25 meals but no chips and salsa. What a sham.

4jGtM4F-jUPA29Egd2rA1Q.text: Probably the best tasting food at PHX. However, $9.00 for chips and salsa after I've already bought beer and appetizers is a bad, bad thing. There are enough negative reviews about this specific subject (read below) that the management should take notice and at least make chips and salsa complementary as long as the customer has purchased something.

_WtuhvweKq0b7ydw_etykQ.text: The Pollo Poblano burrito was fantastic!  Best chicken burrito I have had in a long time!  Service was great, our waitress was hustling all over the restaurant but she never forgot us or the tables around us.  The Guacamole was so good, who knew pomegranate was so great with avocado!

yREfU_y9xYpEDsGNhkvTjw.text: It was fairly good at first but my plate came with a lot of grease on it and after consuming half of my plate all that was left to taste was a overwhelming grease flavor. Also, the French press coffee (although it looks quite good) is not worth the $4 a cup.  There was a great amount of variety here though which was great to find and it was so close to my gate!

_wma1TOrcB9s5eJalevmSw.text: Must try the guacamole...and their pulled pork dishes are phenomenal!! I have yet to eat anything bad from here. Very authentic and very good. They make the guacamole fresh right in front of you.

XfE6R7yvIqWreMYMrKxqSw.text: The food was good, I had pork tacos. Even my waitress Schilee was great! Why only 3 stars? The hostesses were THAT bad. Snobby to the max. One wouldn't put her iPhone down even while seating people! And when two ladies asked for a different table than where she tried to seat them? She handed them their menus and made them seat themselves and walked off annoyed with them. It was so bad I'm docking two stars.

s0yHFBIyNcah8gft68fNgw.text: You've got to expect prices at any sit down restaurant in any airport to be higher than if you were in a similar restaurant off-airport.  So I didn't flinch at the $14 price for a chicken burrito, because I knew I'd be paying over $5 for a processed burger at a fast food place (bleh!).  Instead, my burrito was chunk full of chicken, avocado and spices and was served with spicy fries.  Tasted quite good!  I sat in the lounge area on a sofa with a small table and was able to kick off my shoes and work from my iPad as I enjoyed my meal.  My server, Shauna was excellent and so friendly.  Would call me by name every time she passed by to make sure I was taken care of.  A great place to relax and enjoy a meal or drink away from the fast food crowds before taking flight!

ru97AWP-lMTVcnPxeWgnhw.text: There's two things wrong with this place.  1. The bar stools are huge and have no backs.  Why is this a problem?  I have nowhere to hang my carry on/backpack and the size of the stools leaves less people at the bar...dumb.  2. Very few outlets to charge electronics while having a drink...very dumb.   One would think the designer would have thought of something that simple.  Didn't bother having a drink(s) because of it.  Charging my phone was more important than paying $8 for a $3 beer.

OqLveWEmQwn-4G6YjjlsuA.text: Came in for a quick bite to eat before my flight. Ordered the "Arizona Burrito" and some fries. Fries came out cold and there was some type of hard plastic in my 1st bite. Promptly informed waitress and instead of apologizing or explaining she grabbed the plastic, disappeared and showed up again with a "new" burrito. I told her I wasn't interested and she stated that these things happen and basically what's the big deal???!!! Are you kidding me???!!!! Never coming again!!

3pnM3rJtlQww7uORqCAWoQ.text: This was a pleasant surprise for airport food, yes its pricey but at least its worth it.  They have killer french press coffee, they bring you a big carafe for 2 that makes at least 5-6 cups.  I ordered the chilaquiles which were tasty and my husband had the Mexican omelet.  The service was really good too, since we were in a time crunch they served us pretty quick.  If in the area again I would definitely come back and try the cochinita pibil witch is supposed to be the house specialty.

0YJkdcN9SDz9dWKDKPHivA.text: Stopped here for breakfast on my back to South TX. I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised. The chorizo con huevos was outstanding! Excellent Mexican food, particularly in an airport! Definitely recommend this place to weary travelers tired of overpriced, bland airport food. Thumbs up!

MlGiSaOv8iVjoQbAeWAwAQ.text: Barrio cafe in Phoenix airport... What scatter brain corporate executive in charge of this place green lighted and ok'd the use of jalapeno peppers in ALL repeat ALL the hash browns??? So your kids will be screaming/crying for mercy with one bite. And there's not even a warning... Just some idiotic "our famous barrio browns" in the menu description. Wake up and fire some CEO's please and fix your menu. Also the food was horrible. $30 at the airport for two breakfasts that weren't even as good as Mc Donalds or Burger king breakfast. You people should be ashamed. I didn't know that it was even possible to screw eggs, bacon and hash browns up this bad. My advice would be to avoid this place at all costs. A microwave breakfast burrito that has been frozen since Abraham Lincoln was born would be better. Run for your life.

6obRXzryYqliUuB4-wMQtg.text: I ate at the original barrio cafe on 16th which was very good and interesting (maybe a little overpriced) but definetly recommended.  The airport barrio cafe was like the owner lost control of the car and drove off the road that has taken them to success.  I ordered a burrito (don't remember which) but it was soggy, with what tasted like canned chicken and a ton of sour cream.  Nasty!!

AYQ11RYzVgoAYw90JuUx0Q.text: Good food. Approach a little rough when walking in with a Starbucks. Come on folks this is an airport. We had a big group. They finally warmed up. At the end ok. But need to to work on that first greeting

6XrU8eUdY50OboENy_QW5A.text: As I sit here at the barrio cafe I must say I'm really disappointed. The staff rushed me into a decision and didn't really answer some of the questions I had about the menu. The food is way over priced. I got the roasted pork plate because when I asked any questions about anything else the server just told me it was the best (its also the priciest of the options I was looking at).  I originally wanted wine, but they were out of about half the options and I wasn't about to pay $15 for a glass of Mexican merlot.... My $12 blended margarita was semi runny but also hard to consume due to chunks of ice in it... I mean come on if you're going to over charge me at least give me something decent.  My meal arrived about 120 seconds after I ordered it... I think I just paid $40 for fast food (that zucchini could not have possibly been cooked fresh...)  Since I have been sitting here I have noticed rude staff (not necessarily to me but to others around me!) one of the gimmicks of this place I guess is that they make guac table side.... I straight up saw the host and a server get into an argument while the server was making the guac for a table next to me.  No one smiles. No one accommodates. And my corn tortillas stuck together and ripped apart :( :( :( very sad I wasted my money here.

ds5mHV2Yfd75au-gDLEqcg.text: The airport Barrio Cafe has the best nachos I have ever had in my life... Trust me I have had a lot of nachos.  These are foodie nachos not yellow cheese game day nachos.  Last time I was at Barrio Queen they did not have them at that location.  Nachos plus a fabulous margarita here are the start to a great trip either for business or pleasure!

rgKewXRwMTuprYjbVOH2sw.text: Went there for breakfast.  Didn't want to shuffle around in a line and wander through crowds to find somewhere to sit.  Other reviews say service was bad, ours was fine.  Food was good.  It's an airport restaurant which means expensive but overall had a fine experience.

q-3hEwA-wqLsfhhlqRQL0g.text: This place was pretty cool and it was my first time there...surprisingly at the airport location rather than down the street at the actual location. The bartenders were nice. We had some great drinks and the food looked amazing. I would love to check out the actual location but the Phoenix airport is pretty awesome now that it has all the local restaurants in there.

lthIIwqHJEFrdUQVEOrmIA.text: Lunch on a layover. Menu looked better than most airport fare. A little pricey but typical airport prices. I had the shrimp tacos. Good size shrimp with good spicy flavors. The salsa Verde was good as well. Pretty impressed for an airport. Service was good but a little slow in the beginning. I can imagine the actual downtown restaurant is quite good.

vByw4NV8xH0_NBn1gWoX3Q.text: NOT your standard airport restaurant fare!  Try the chicken poblano enchilada.  Service was friendly and attentive.

dShqiMVWlaFyyWbOa-z5yA.text: Good service and good posole verde.  Will order again when I am in terminal D at the Phoenix airport.

5vtsonmGED1ZzocoJ7-oHg.text: This place seems super cute when you walk in. Then boom the bad attitude behind the bar hits you. No smile, and you are greeted with a "your going to have to take your purse off the bar....it is a health code violation".What a joke. The purse on the bar,not a health code violation. The 1/4 inch of dust on your beers taps, now that is a health violation. Dropping in every beer you pour. Which I probably would not have been looking at if you had greeted me with a hello and a simple smile. Employ people who love what they do!

PeFU9rJi_uJoQ5bpaoEhTw.text: Wow, I have a lay over flight and decided to have lunch. What a pleasant surprise. I'm enjoying the torta barrio, fantastic spice. A green chile that actually has flavor and spice, most delicious. My taste buds are jumping for joy. Ice cold Pacifico and spicy Mexican food, people watching....yeah for me!!!!

eQROf7LEcgHLDPFKkmJ9DA.text: As I wandered around the airport trying to find a seat to watch the US v Belgium game, I finally stumbled across the Barrio Cafe. I was so happy to be seated at a bar and watching the game that they could have served dogfood and I would have been OK. Rest assured they did not serve dogfood. This wasn't as salty. I am kidding of course but the food was not memorable. Ordered the Torta Cochinita Pibil. It was a big sandwich of pork marinated in achiote and sour orange. That sounds great but it was rather bland. It was topped with pickled onion and pico de gallo. Those were nice but the strong flavor of the torta bread overpowered. The fries were decent and I enjoyed the spicy chipotle ketchup. Ultimately, the pork was underwhelming and a torta cannot recover if the star fails.

CMIt7JlbCIffQienFNN9eg.text: Absolutely the worst place to be, much less eat at. Prices were beyond reasonable, food was less than appealing, waitstaff was not attentive to the basic needs (dirty table, no flatware, or completion of meal). Would not ever go to this establishment or recommend anyone to go to this place EVER!!  Quite the shakedown!!

wjJz_EYM9HmpdBZRuG1FuQ.text: This is a pleasant surprise for airport food.  This is real food, a bit pricey but it's in an airport.  It's a lively place with colorful artwork on the walls and bright overstuffed banquettes along the walls.  There's a busy bar area too.  We didn't have much time so we ordered quick and asked for rush on the food and they accommodated us without complaint.  I had the cochinta pibil torta which was very tasty, orange scented slow cooked pork, pickled red onion, Mexican cheese, beans, pico de gallo, guacamole on crusty bread.  Yummy.  My son had the steak Ricardo - a perfectly cooked steak served with a bunch of Mexican accoutrements over fries.  Also very tasty.  This is a nice choice if you've got some time at Sky Harbor.

oXMosHHLSLfNJ6lIkSRkTg.text: Really slow service, even the hostess avoided welcoming us into the restaurant! If you crave just something simple, forget it  sometimes some basic nachos would be great, or a chicken quesadilla maybe, but not here. How about counting 5+ servers, only 6 tables and they all walk by and say nothing!  Service is nothing short of extremely horrible.  Oh then chops and salsa, nope!!  No tipping is the only positive thing, that's only because its to be earned!

RucKuUC7ekoDriNYoFroMw.text: I have eaten here several times for Breakfast and Lunch. Normally the service can be challenging and a bit understaffed. Today it was that and the food came out cold. First time sending it back. I will say the server was nice and the replacement food was on point. Glad we had plenty of time.

LX1Dyur9CFC_NDtDnpdXaw.text: Can't even get a simple tequila shot correct and brought in a timely fashion. Overpriced & service isn't all that.

OOLvLf4bl_VD8dBOkvM6JQ.text: Eating at barrio is part of my southwest airlines airport ritual. I love their downtown location the most. I also like barrio queen in Scottsdale.

hfZBhIWuWCviILduJstL5w.text: I guess its not bad for an airport resturant.  The service was so bad.. it took us 10 mins each time to flag down the waitress.  We got shrimp tacos that were pretty good except it only had 1 shrimp in each of them... I'd head over to gate A&B to eat at Four Peaks instead

mVthWyi5P7D-gwA0g4Q95Q.text: Had a long layover flying into Phoenix. Server was great with kids and the food had some flavor. Only critique is the menu is a-little complicated to read through. Also, they do not serve chips and salsa

ZmCtuAFsbPrbP8FXTODErA.text: Good food! Had the fish tacos and they were pretty awesome. Salad on the side was fresh. Drinks, awesome except for the fact that for a Mexican place I'd say they should have more than one random Mexican beer on tap. Waitress... Umm... In general the staff was below standard and quite interesting but service was at standard at least. I'll be back next time I'm here!

wATHL9lzmQks_X5PaJ8KLQ.text: Nothing edible for nonmeat eaters. The nachos (hold the charizo and the chicken) was just stale chips with honey mustard (for real) dressing on top. Gross. If they let a Taco Bell open up across the isle this place would be out of businesses

zfsWF2JxNoHvDHbRv-eGpg.text: I wouldn't come to this restaurant unless you simply have no choice. The wait to get in was expected on a busy travel day. However what was unexpected was the lack of friendly service. I could have dealt with that. But once our drinks finally arrived there was a bug in the ice. After asking for a new cup we where informed that it's Knatt season????? Who cares just bring me a different cup. If anyone is interested they do offer just plain chips and Sala but heads up ITS $9.00 and there are no refills on the chips or the salsa the bowl is tiny not enough for one person to snack on. Only bright spot here was the Guacamole was freshly made. Which it better be for $13.00.

EWpDpa3izNdm3hi1RABf0w.text: Very nice looking in-airport restaurant and the service at the bar is above average. However my breakfast experience was terrible. I order the chilaquiles and when they come out, they look different from what I'm accustomed. I give them a try anyway as they do look appetizing. Turns out the tortilla was cold, almost as if it had been just pulled out of the packet. I ask the waitress if that's how the dish was meant, since I'd never seen chilaquiles assembled in this format and she said no and took it back. When she returns the tortillas were warm but my over medium egg was also now fully cooked. I ate 1/2 and then notice my potatoes have 2-3 small chunks of pork meat. Btw, I don't eat pork and the dish did no describe to include any meat. I confirm with the waitress again and her simple response was, it must have just slipped in. All-in-all, I'd avoid this place for food but would give it another go for drinks.

g7keEg0vM1IdLq1wAuHMGg.text: Was surprised how good this place was, and at the airport in Terminal D no less.    A bit pricey mind you but it is the airport after all.     Food was really good.   I had the Arizona Burrito and probably the freshest burrito I've had in a long time.   Great mix of ingredients.   Now let's talk service.   You know by my other reviews, service can make or break a place.   Well, the service here was phenomenal.  Our waitress Alexandra was superb.   Great to find a good waitress and we tipped accordingly.   Also, I must comment on the management to, as they were actively  present and engaged with the staff and customers.   Really nice to see leadership in action.    Try this place.   Well worth it.

bva5mxMtOTaEJD9yoLw6Ag.text: I assume this place is owned by the same people who own the 16th street location but if it is, OMG what are you doing polluting your brand?  Stopped there the other night before a flight and was excited because I like the orginal.  No ambience and I had this waitress who looked and acted miserable.  She also made me feel rushed.  So, she pushes the special tequila margarita and i get one.  Just okay.  Then I ask if you can mix and match tacos.. don't want four of the same taco.  No.  Then I order a  chile plate and it was so cold and gross it was inedible.  I sent it back and asked for guamamole and chips which was actually quite good.  Although when the waitress was preparing it tableside she seemed bored and irritated.   To her credit she didn't charge me for the chile.  Real disappointment... go next door to the Grande Orange cafe.

-ByMQ_tBzE5pJbdxSlp8JQ.text: You expect horrible, overpriced food and awful service at any airport restaurant. Here, the food and service is great and the airport premium modest. They were able to do 3 tacos no dairy and Chris is a great server. Selfish, rude, entitled Yelpers ... Seriously. With a long wait between flights you could do far far worse.

KlaBrKAXqBqFL0kx2f0fOQ.text: a bit upscaley,   but the chef certainly made me a fan..  although i wont expect this to happen again... i was looking for " regulalr joe" mexican food... not taco bell exactly,  but at least ground beef on something...   the chef created , for my benefit   "regular joe"  mexican food  for me... so i was happy.   i need more of a regio's  on indian school rd or caroline's mexican food on 16th.  but sa la vie!   the cafe had great seating  and excellent customer service.

y5TOS53WeWHgSGqRgFLqOA.text: For being at the airport I have to say their food is fantastic. I am a taco freek and their beer battered shrimp tacos are the bomb! I get them everytime I go to the tthis airport.

sQkpS2uqeoAQkDgFBUpefw.text: Very good food for the airport if you like spicy get the salsa, house ketchup, or the chorizo. The pick de gallo is really good too.

PZkVg9ZywEIDhz3C5bsaIg.text: Barrio was a serious letdown. Given the limited options in D gates I have given this place no fewer than five tries. Significantly overpriced for poor quality food is a pretty good summary. I even got sick one time within 20 minutes of eating. I wish D gates had better options, but I am guessing Barrio will be replaced in 2014.

8fq-bVWrL3ogiHAHjITnNg.text: I haven't even gotten my food(to go) yet, but they gave my order to someone else, then made it with the wrong side, and now I'm hoping I make my flight.  Folks standing to order while a gal stands playing with her phone in fruit of them.  Idiots.

kE_pYz3Gy_H7fUVBToPvoA.text: Nothing like the original, which I love.  I ordered the poblano chicken burrito.  I got a soggy burrito loaded with dry chicken, go figure. Anyway it's sounded great spicy chicken with grilled pablano, onions,  etc... I asked the waitress she went to the kitchen, only to come back and say it doesn't come with peppers or onions.  My response,  menu says it does. Well we're out of peppers, I can give you 10% off is that ok. No,  I didn't order a pile of chicken I'm a soggy burrito.  5 minutes late she comes back with a side of grilled onion,  peppers,  whatever else was supposed to be in the burrito.  It helps but I'm annoyed and the meat is cold at this point.  Whatever,  I have a flight to catch,  I just paid my tab (no discount), I'm done and never coming back.

tZ_CC7b5gsU0nqMHMT1Agg.text: Grabbed dinner there as I was passing through the Phoenix Airport.  The cafe is good, services very good and surpassed my expectations.  Food was good, definitely would go back again if I have the time as I make my connections.  Price was good, and as I have traveled many airports, it was reasonable, good portions.  I'll make there again.

ItDCQ4tqQgJmejVHlwv0TQ.text: We came in expecting mediocre airport food. We were so surprised. The fish tacos are amazing. So are the french fries. It is also really nice because it is a sit down restaurant, so when you are worn out from traveling it is really nice to have someone else wait on you! :) The service is slow, but friendly. We will definitely be coming back here next time we stop through this airport.

dzd1JhptbqpUjV7h17QqrQ.text: We have been traveling all day, and all we wanted was a decent meal that wasn't fast food. We were going to wait until we got home, but when our flight was delayed, we couldn't wait.  We really didn't want airport food at all. We were pleasantly surprised! Quick service, lots of great flavor and filling. I had the pollo pablano and pasole. My husband had the pork tacos. It was definitely better than our expectations.

I7n10pNdFprugCoCEh3-cQ.text: They don't realize they are in an airport an people are in a hurry. Our waitress was constantly distracted with having to whip up fresh guacamole instead of serving her customers. 20 minutes for $15 tacos that I have to shove down my face in order to make my flight was not enjoyable.

uVkLSKjpIfP4EbMoZ4_58g.text: After two visits - terrible.  Cochinita Pibil tacos dry and tasteless.  And with French fries!  Guacamole should be advertised as chopped (at least as well as you can with a spoon by a server who told us it was a pain to do guacamole tableside when it was busy!) avocado not guacamole.  Service seemed just plain uninterested.  Prices not justified at all for what you are going to experience.

93mpRAq5UHNIrxgS4BPJsA.text: Of course my flight was delayed so I decided to sit down and have a meal at Barrio. First of all the service I received from both the manager and my server was some of the best I have had.
