After being seated, the manger stopped by to see if I had any questions about the menu, which I did, and he proceeded to go back to the kitchen and show me the type of chip they use for their nachos. While my daughter and I were waiting for our food, he brought her out a thinly sliced apple without me asking for anything. The nachos were different than I have ever had, and were awesome! Their pork is delicious and the sauce, yes sauce, for the nachos was super good. I wish they had a Barrio in Seattle because I will be craving these nachos!!

h5zNpaL6TK3dNI718lzvYw.text: Best airport food ever.  Eclectic Mexican in a nice environment--given it's an airport.  Highly recommmended!

rAQWCGmyQpMEg4Cxb5OMag.text: Mediocre food. Takes FOREVER. avoid if you don't have time to linger.

0vDlptpCezjYqhMX1404Tg.text: $14 burrito with south of France ingredients. Uh, HELLO, were in a recession!

fn0rJFLUkpOKewFFgFP6XQ.text: had a $20 slow cooked pork dish (cochinito pibil) that was described as a house speciality.  Nothing special.  Salty, a little dry...lots of spices. Obvious sauce drips on plate rim were partially wiped off...made the plate look unapetizingly dirty at first.  The $7 Modelo tasted great!

4_fcu7psL2An-3CeBpIWTA.text: I tried the Arizona burrito and was very disappointed. It only contained large chunks of fatty pork (golf ball size) and gobs of melted cheese. I didn't see any green chile or salsa. So bland and greasy. No thank you!

hxt_0piMZkHSTZKK_8rd9g.text: You can tell the bartenders have no training. Really awful and you're throwing your money away because the drinks aren't cheap either. Just watching them you can see they don't know how to pour, their counts are way off, they don't know the recipes, and can't shake a cockltail correctly. I watched them pour more Grand Marnier than tequila into the tin and then squirt about 3 times more cheap sweet and sour juice into the tin. Her shake was pethetic. She gave it one up and then one more. She looked scared like she was holding a soda that may have been shaken around. Being a Mexican restaurant and the margarita being the most popular cocktail in the world you'd think they would have it down, especially for $13 each! Food is very average! For the money they charge and the quality of service you're better off going to a different terminal and eating anywhere else I promise you. If the food was average and the service was at all passable I would give this a 3 star but they really go out of their way for piss poor all around. I won't be back.

zqEuqtHA75s5yLvZAqLVxw.text: Five star service from Rabecca thanks !  Breakfast burrito with two eggs and salsa. Top this off with a great Pinot noir wow that's a meal.  This airport really knows how to pamper it's guests.  Service in this restaurant is fast and friendly. Management is nice as well. This is a quality spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rebecca at the bar

oTG7A1nPcPsgZ1Pp7aXd_w.text: This is the best restaurant at the Phoenix airport. I've been here many times for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and had a pleasant experience every time. The staff is very friendly and the food exceeds your expectations of airport food.   The burritos are a great option for breakfast or dinner (I've had them all). I think my favorite thing here is the Mexican Cafe. It's a rich full bodied coffee with complex flavors served to you fresh in a French press. I've emptied it every time I've had it! I get it even if I'm flying home at 11p. I risk being up all night just to enjoy the great cafe!  If you're at the Phoenix airport on a long layover or just want a bite to eat, go to Barrio Cafe! Make sure you get the coffee!  They also have a large selection of Mexican tequila. I'm always in Phoenix for work, so I've never had any of their tequila samplers myself...

rWKZ1s2Hd5EvRu7N1KCudA.text: Smooth usher into the restaurant. Had a burrito minus the goat cheese it came with. Was still an oily mess. Bland. Tortilla rubbery. I could say that was the worst burrito I've had if only someone convinced me it was a burrito. Other than the claim on the menu I have no other proof. Service by loud, tough Asian lady and snot-nosed kid was horrendous. The latter slammed the food down and left without giving one of us silverware. Had to walk down one of the waiters. We asked loud Asian lady for salsa. And waited. Had to walk her down as well.  Bad service at an airport restaurant is okay. But IF you want Mexican food PLEASE DO NOT COME HERE.

AAgiaPli9LrGaR34Z6aDqA.text: OK. At least get the food prep right!  While waiting for a Southwest flight (like everybody else here), I ordered the "Arizona Burrito" which was on the small size and not adequately heated. This came with either fries or a small salad. I opted for the salad, which was made with mixed greens and chopped tomatoes. The salad was just OK - a little heavy on the dressing. But the biggest problem was that the Arizona Burrito didn't come with any cheese or crema. These were clearly on the burrito's description on the menu! No Oaxaca cheese or crema Mexicana at all. The waitress was nice and brought out some cheese and crema on the side, but it just wasn't the same! Any other restaurant would have had the manager come to the table.   Another big problem has to do with the general atmosphere at this Barrio Cafe. It felt like the workers and waitstaff were not too serious about their jobs. They were pretty casual about everything - too much goofing off. This is clearly a problem with management.   I won't be dining at the Barrio Cafe in the future. My food was just OK, made incorrectly, and way overpriced for what you got.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arizona Burrito with salad. $13
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. That&#39;s it

Uz-fUPOsOzZBOsQOOYjUYQ.text: 3 hours to kill waiting on my flight. Thank God for Barrio.....food is excellent and the staff are wonderful. One of the best restaurants in Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Would have shown the whole plate but I consumed the other 3 in record time!

WGAUr35XYFyt3vVsUXD-tg.text: I've been here 4 times only because of It's convenience to my terminal. Of these times, I can honestly say that 3 out of 4 waitresses were extremely grumpy and not nice. I have been let down by the food each time. I think the first time I ordered a salad and noted how little protein was given, the second time I had nachos and they put blue cheese on them which tasted horrible, the third time a different salad which I was equally as disappointed about, and this last time I ordered shrimp tacos. They put 1 shrimp in each taco. Yes, you read that correct  : 1 shrimp for a total of 3 shrimp for a total of $17.00 plate. I've had enough of this place and heaven forbid I have to fly out of this terminal again. I'm sure I will, but I'll walk over to a different terminal to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is their shrimp taco. It comes with 1 shrimp. The plate probably costs $2.00 to make, yet they charge $17

Si3xdeKd4JWTYmjJqmDA7A.text: This review is for breakfast only.  Had a breakfast burrito with chicken. It simply tasted terrible. I can't say it was the recipe or food itself or maybe it just wasn't my thing but it was terrible none the less. Coffee was extremely bitter and topped off the expensive lesson. It's the airport so maybe I should just accept that it will be sub par.

zDsQB3GNwqt9KAh1gQhaFA.text: Went in ordered a glass of wine. The bartender accidentally poured a pint of beer in my lap and on my computer. She apologized , the manager came over, my computer, jacket, and lap were soaking wet. Did not offer to comp my wine?? Really? My jacket smells like beer. Can you say, "customer service"???

93VkqsUkWfFYKPJyPzUYgQ.text: Sure, it's a little pricey - it's at the airport. But what a great hangout, Tammy delivered excellent service, food was delicious, beer was cold!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PwPmLyETDsfNVs1S3dhvbQ.text: Just had the Burrito Pollo Poblano and a house margarita. And these amazing French fries. This is maybe the best airport food I've ever had!

oHwDeHAGL5Pjkm5iwlG_ow.text: Menu seemed to try hard for Mexican food so I went over to Taquitos at Gate C for street tacos. No regrets.

C1Puh6IrKL718Qg4ecWXgw.text: There was an Instagram photo of their Phoenix sign located at their parking lot. Since we only had three hours in Phoenix that we decided to eat lunch at Barrio Cafe.   There was a homeless guy in a wheelchair waiting outside and when I went inside one of the server came out and gave him a gallon of water. That was really nice to see as it was really hot outside.   We were greeted and seated immediately. The staff were really friendly.   The place is very artsy and there were art works from Pablo Luna. You can buy some of his artworks as there were prices.   We were really hungry and the food we ate definitely hit the spot! We live in San Francisco and usually prefer eating authentic Mexican foods in the Mission district. It was really good and reminded me of the tacos I ate when I was in Tijuana.   Overall, I recommend this place and would love to visit again once I come back to Phoenix.

mPe3Q7ffMGTDyhlZ9A3Krg.text: Had a couple hours to waste before the flight, so stopped here. Bacardi was our server, pretty chill with kind of a hippie vibe. The stars are mainly for her and her good service, because the food was just ok. THAT HORCHATA THO...yummers :)!!!!

JrnpkUNxtZaX9CI_IEy0Dg.text: Waited to be seated for 7 mins. I then sat myself down since the staff was busy watching the soccer game on tv. Waitress then got mad at me. I left. Rude people

gY0shuTzVBZ-m9Rdx3sKlw.text: Great cocktails!  Dont worry food comes fast! I know, pricey, but Barrio Cafe is a Phoenix staple rated one of the best reateraunts in the state.  This airport extended location will get you the basics with the limitted menu.  The guacamole made fresh is one of their signatures. If you cant decide between tacos and something else choose tacos.   The service at this location is great. One of the people in our party asked for ranch dressing which they dont have. The manager went to the resteraunt next door and got it with no questions asked even though we told him it was no big deal (props to la grande orange).  If you're in Phoenix go to the original location, if you have a layover in Terminal D go here.

pWh6MDfbMoBmB33FsmwsUQ.text: I stop here when ever I fly thru PHX if I have the time. I get the Americano with , sometimes coffee sometimes taquila yummy

9R_BWBYk85Utan6orkxZ2g.text: Having breakfast before we head home. Ordered the Americano which was really good. The bacon has a little kick to it.  Sausage looks tasty too. Had reg coffee and lots of it.

XKAMgcg7BXfLzaINWkVLWg.text: Average at best. The marinade on the steak was good but otherwise the tacos were just like you'd get anywhere.   A lot of flights are delayed so service wasn't stellar, I sat for an hour after my meal had been taken away. I was never asked if I wanted anything else, and had to flag my server down for the check eventually.   I wouldn't recommend it, but it wasn't terrible. Definitely overpriced

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak tacos w/ side salad

KEmStcrGpPH1YcGYTnYO_w.text: If you're waiting for a flight at the Phoenix airport (and/or nervous to fly), the Barrio is a great spot for a margarita and liquid courage shot.  I've found myself at this bar twice now, and each time the margarita has been stellar (premium tequila, freshly squeezed lime juice, agave nectar, and Cointreau floater). Can't speak for the food, but the dishes that went past me looked tasty.  Special shout-out to the bartender who 86'd the drunk dude sitting next to me (he was already 6 beers deep!). That's not an easy situation to be in, and she handled it like a pro. I pity the folks who had to sit next to him on the plane.  Prices ain't exactly cheap (I believe my drink was around $12), but I guess that's pretty standard for an airport bar/restaurants. That being said, the Barrio is still a fun place to pass the time before boarding a flight.

NOpe6y_scvZa5HUaysYTiw.text: #BarrioCafe #BarrioCafePorAvion #SeriouslyBadAssMexicanCuisine  I had the most delicious lunch on my way to San Francisco and the service was outstanding. Yolanda help me with the extensive menu and suggested my entree (allowing me to substitute the fries for a bed of spinach). I've been to the 16th street location twice while on vacation.   Carne Asada a la Ricardo: grilled skirt steak topped with caramel used onions, green onions, mushrooms, jalapenos, garlic and chorizo all over a pile of Barrio spicy fries with an avocado and pick del Gallo. $23   Organic: Tierras Organic Silver Tequila, organic agave nectar, pomegranate and grapefruit juice, and fresh lime with salted rim $14.25  Chata: award winning Agua de Horchata, Crema 1921 and Kahlua

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GKIy2JPYC0NQeAXKldPkzA.text: Food was very delicious. Table side guacamole was awesome. We both got a taco dinner which was very yummy w a side salad. Filling and fairly  healthy, tasted extremely fresh. We got out in 30 min for a flight. Highly recommend and will definitely be back!!

p4c0mqVlbkSMP34GnCcseA.text: I was starving after a day of traveling and after traversing every gate in the airport, I settled on this place with my usual amount of heavy skepticism.  I mean really, airport food?  Ugh.  Well this time I made a good decision because I was actually impressed.  The service was friendly, although not the fastest because one of the people behind the scenes misplaced my food for a couple of minutes.  But the counter person realized this pretty quickly and went to find my shrimp tacos as soon as she saw that I was still hanging around.  Four shrimp tacos and a bottled water for $16 seems about right for airport food, and this food was good!  I even liked the seasoned fries, and I rarely like seasoned fries.  I'm going to keep this one on my list since I actually seem to hit the Phoenix airport a couple times a year.

Z9XOg6uMt4XqBHrcmqmI0Q.text: I liked my food, Waiter made great recommendations. Excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YvuauMkCwfbmpYuiiFYqDQ.text: I was desperate for food during my layover a the Phoenix airport and fell upon Barrio Cafe.  Not many vegan or vegetarian options.  I ended up ordering some kind of veggie sandwich, which was okay.  It came with this delicious yellow sauce that made the sandwich edible. I was told that it was tomatillo sauce- yea, I'm pretty sure that was inaccurate.    What was disappointing about this place was how unwilling they were to accommodate your dietary needs.  No substituions or changes... you order what's on the menu. That's it.  And no salsa or chips to start-- I was told they didn't even have traditional salsa in stock... Rather rude staff too.  And, of course, prices are quite inflated to properly exploit your hunger during your airport visit.  I encourage you to bring some snacks before going to this airport.

qWbSE4dSjUl_3J8dOvpBhQ.text: The food is good as always. Checked in and seated quickly. Wait staff looks unhappy and by the end of the meal seem to be rushing people to leave so the next group can be seated. Love the food but a little dissatisfied with the service

32L2MvwvZgasfj_47La3Sg.text: Disappointing. Waitress took 15 minutes before I flagged them down. They took my order but no follow up and waiting another 10 minutes to get my check. I had the chicken nachos which were average. Did not like my drink the Sergio. Was way heavy on the tequila and not refreshing and light which is what I was hoping with the fruit juice and mint.

6HEcq9rCKCXlWV0WVwaHUQ.text: I wish I could tell you what Barrio Cafe is like, but my experience wasn't very helpful.  While traveling, I was at Sky Harbor for a layover between flights and wanted to get some lunch. Barrio Cafe was right next to my gate, so I decided to go for it even though the prices were a little high.  I was seated quickly next to an older couple, and shortly after I was settling into my seat they had an appetizer delivered. I asked them what it was, because it looked quite good, and found out it was the tecate breaded fish and shrimp. I was tempted to grab it for a meal, and thanked them for letting me know.  I perused the menu. No server came by.  I plugged in my phone at the A/C outlet next to the table. No server came by.  The couple next to me finished their meal. No server came by.  The couple requested their check and their waiter dropped it off, then turned and walked away. No server asked if I had been helped.  The couple next to me paid their check and asked "Has anyone even gotten you a drink yet?"  I checked my watch. It had been 15 minutes since I was seated, and I had 20 minutes before my flight was supposed to start boarding.   I stood up to leave. The waiter who had come by to collect the check from the couple next to me asked how my meal was. I told him I didn't know, since no-one had ever taken my order.  He asked if I wanted to sit back down. I explained to him that I was concerned about missing my connecting flight, and that I really just wanted to get some lunch  quickly.  Instead of letting me go, he gave me a rather nasty look and said "Well, if THAT'S the way you feel, SIR, maybe you /should/ go somewhere else."  I'm very, very glad I didn't give them my money, and if I'm going through Sky Harbor again, I don't intend to ever return.

KeUOfKAB02wLJh3RMdJkig.text: I just paid $24 ($27 with tip) for a bowl of soup, a diet coke, and an order of chips and salsa! The service was good. The soup was a decent portion and tasted good. The chips that came with the salsa were so hard I couldn't chew them without fear of breaking a tooth. When I ordered the chips and salsa, the waitress told me they cost $9, and if they were actually edible I would say OK. However, this was a huge waste money. I even tried soaking the chips in the soup to soften them up, but that didn't really work. I left nearly the entire bowl of chips. I walked out of there feeling totally ripped off. Soup, a soft drink, and hard as hell chips for $24! I won't eat here again. I know its an airport, but that is ridiculous.

yROBCqVxe-wxQISUu-VF-Q.text: Food is usually excellent.  Small portions.  My gripe......10.00 for chips and salsa!!,,!,!,!,,,!!,!omg.  If you want to be a fucking Mexican restaurant in Phoenix, charge 14.00 for three small street tacos, and charge customers for a bowl of chips and salsa.  I will walk to the other establishments in in C or A.  You seem to have lost sight of your roots.  If I spend 35.00 for drinks and food, 2.00 worth of chips and salsa seem to be a no brainier.  I can understand if they order a water and chips and salsa but not for paying customers!!!! Never again barrio!

L0K5OIT2riA2SflF0-JDIQ.text: Came in again.  I know a gluten for punishment.  However today I had a much different experience.  My servers name was Reeni, and she was great.  I had the chips and guacamole which were good.  I then had the posole and it was out of this world.  Reeni thank you for taking the time explaining the restaurant as well as the food.  I will return.

5rxuQhjM5h0EoaqFRpva4w.text: I realize this locale is at the airport, so I'll be gracious. But friends, this ain't The Barrio Cafe you'll find downtown. The food is really terrific for airport food, the service is mediocre, but it's still the airport. The really bright spot was the tableside guacamole that seems similar to the original locale. Chips were okay too, but how can you screw up tortilla chips? The rest of our meal was average at best. I'm looking forward to trying you again and giving you the benefit of my doubts!

DyZnze0xVzf4IO1aH8v6oA.text: I had a good salad chicken salad with tomatoes over a bed of spinach. The service was very slow in the beginning - I couldn't find waitstaff anywhere to order. Eventually she showed up and was quite attentive.

t4xLbthU6jXaUIv80bjG2g.text: Came in with my mom with over an hour before our flight. Unfortunately it seems like they sat a lot of people in our waitresses section within a short amount of time because the service was terrible!   Two different groups of people near us got their food before us even though they were seated and ordered after us. Our waitress eventually told us there was a mix up with our order in the kitchen but by that time we had to get our food to-go or miss our flight! We had to ask multiple servers for to-go boxes and our check because each would dismiss our efforts to get their attention. We also saw another woman eating a taco while exiting the restaurant because she was going to miss her flight and her friend had to pay her check.  Thankfully, they only charged us for our drinks because of the inconvenience but we will not be returning the next time we are at the airport.

dOTrVwReO5u8cOFpvW0daA.text: Loved the nachos, a definite must to get if you want to share. Not the ordinary nachos, much much better!  We had the grilled chicken nachos... awesome!  Victor is was a great waiter, very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu (he suggested the nachos), you'll be lucky to get him when stop in there before your flight.

-XlkgDLE4OEfa_qPQlZsiA.text: Everytime I stop at the PHX airport I make it a point to stop at the Barrio Cafe. They have exceptional margaritas especially there "Lowrider" margarita. There food is also really good especially for airport food.

ecdKP8sohx2ZoP6pIkamLg.text: Wierd guac.um pomegranate seeds on slices of avocado, chopped garlic and onion you had to mix yourself?  I saw and talked to folks around me and they agreed kinda strange combos...but most seemed to give their dishes a thumbs up. 3 stars only for the reviews around me.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strange gauc

UyPAhatrkvb-0CKmoZq-0A.text: Had a friend recommend this place to me while I was in town on business.  He mentioned that Sky Harbor is attracting great chef-driven operations to place their restaurants in the airport.  But he thought I wouldn't be able to get to Barrio Cafe because it was only available behind the D Gates (Terminal 3) security check and I was going to Terminal 3, but was behind the US Airways security check (B Gates.)  I figured that sounded wrong, and had 3 hours to kill before my flight so I started exploring.  To my surprise, I found that I could make the long hike, and after about 30-45 minutes of horizontal escalators, a cappuccino from Cartel Coffee Lab, and a near-taco purchase at *another* place, a dude drove by on one of those people carriers and offered me a lift.  2 minutes later and I'm standing ten feet from Barrio.  First, had to wait about ten minutes to get a seat.  I could've sat immediately in the bar, but needed to do some work on the laptop.  Finally got a seat, and perused the menu.  It was short and sweet...and a bit expensive.  Average price around $15 for a plate of tacos, etc.  Specials over $20 each.  I order the Cochinita Pibil tacos with fries.    The tacos were amazing.  Two or three homemade corn tortillas around each helping of juicy pork.  They left the pork nude and let the arbol/sour marinade and slow-cook do the flavor work.  Then they top it with their pickled onions and a habanero sauce and pico de gallo,...or was the habanero inside the pico de gallo?  Either way it was hot, perfectly cooked juicy pork, and exploded with flavor.  They also give you this side of "yellow" salsa.  I try some of it on my 3rd bite.  Their chef knows what's up.  The yellow was a cooling agent, that basically cleanses the palate and cools your tongue for the next bite.  Balance and complexity like this is hard to find.   Three tacos later and I am fully satisfied and very impressed.  I couldn't finish the fries, but they were crispy, hot, and lightly salted with what I'd imagine was arbol powder or maybe just cayenne and salt? (I forget)  While the dish was expensive, the portions were generous and the quality was well worth it.  If this was the airport location, I can't wait to try their original storefront operation when I'm back in town.

mkepicPSY9IBvVkfHDbKjg.text: OMG... Just ordered the shrimp tacos and there were three tacos with one piece of shrimp PER TACO!!!  DO NOT GO HERE.  There are many great places to eat in the Sky Harbor Airport.  DO NOT EAT HERE.  Prices are even expensive for airport food.  STAY AWAY!!!

vu3fzwCQl1xXFNb8zEZFFA.text: Does anyone know how to get in contact with this restaurant? I was charged 2 different times, one for $53.07 which was my bill total and another for $63.90 which was not bill. The drinks were great and it was close to my gate but not paying someone else's tab also lol

sZ83ARkJbf0aBEwZe-rqrQ.text: If your choice is to not eat and starve. Or eat here. Please choose to starve. Dirty and gross. Rude staff. And horrid inedible food. I don't usually do negative reviews but this place was that bad. Even for airport food. Worst I've ever had. There are far better choices at this airport. Please make a better decision than I did.

aq2pY4amWninbOMfsFc5RA.text: Just had a quick breakfast here. Was hoping for some regular coffee, but it's a French press which was fine but I prefer just a regular cup of coffee. Nothing too fancy. Lol. Mimosas are pricey but nothing out of the ordinary at an airport. I took away two stars because they stop serving breakfast at 10a and we were craving breakfast. However, they still served pancakes and it was delicious just like the server said it would. (: overall cute place to sit down and eat/drink.

5TCzZIML3zYzBDCRVe9DJg.text: Two words, SERVICE SUCKS! Plain & simple. I am personally embarrassed  for  people that I'm watching that are having to wait so long to even get service. I'm just stuck here because my flight is delayed.

6ZuiBVgUWomuGN7IenGcjw.text: Some of the best food ever served in an airport.  The enchiladas, which are tightly rolled in crusty tortillas and are consequently more like flautas, are outstandingly creative and delicious.  The rest of the fairly small menu is also up to snuff.  The only catch is, the service, especially the taking of orders and, even more, the bringing of the check, are on the leisurely scale of a sitdown city restaurant, not of an airport.  If you have less than about 100 minutes till your flight, then FORGET IT.  Don't eat here: you'll expire of a heart attack while fretting over whether the bill will come before your plane starts boarding.  But the food is good enough to make it worth arranging a long layover, or coming here from another pod in the same terminal, at least.

KxjIL6K8nD14F4xo6xHB3w.text: Ridiculously disappointed. Came to my favorite dining spot at the airport only to find that they don't serve breakfast burritos.  I am really!!!! You are a Mexican food restaurant!!!!!

tLoNa1oMWZcS5xg4fw6nZg.text: Nice surprise, rarely do you ever find good Mexican food in a airport. (Actually I have never) until now  . This is a do over. Wish this was a restraint back In albuquerque !! Would recommend ! The Arizona burrito was great !

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

C4GS2r0tpUPoWM6nP38oog.text: Bartenders here are quick and have friendly personalities.... One of the fellas who I talked to last week remembered me and my drink! I didn't eat last time but love the Conchita pibil... They have everything come in from the commissary so I'll update in a few.... They make sangria on site

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horchata and double vodka goose was 11

1dSDeXsIDeIRPKofwUgEcA.text: This seems like a mailed in effort from one of my favorite local chefs.  My breakfast sandwich was absolutely average and exceptionally messy given the fact that you are likely going to be eating it off your lap.  The bread was heavy and bland; I wound up discarding it.  One general complaint about the overall new restaurant plan.  I am absolutely a fan of the local restaurants in the airport but as I was in the Southwest terminal I couldn't find any reasonably priced dishes.  I find that interesting given the fact that the Southwest terminals are usually ground zero for families and young kids.  I feel bad for the mom of 4 who has no option but to spend $15 for some french toast at Barrio or LGO.  What happened to  the cheaper options?

LY8ZHu81REgTspWlM46pOQ.text: I had dinner here once before earlier this year and found the food good...not great...good, in reading the menu I thought that I was In for a real treat....mom and pop restaurant does good with great food.  This time around not so good....I was hungry and Taco,s sounded great, one of the offerings that looked great were chicken tacos covered in a cilantro lime sauce and cheese....YUMMY!!! Not so much, the waitress was sweet and friendly, but the Tacos were tough and chewy...pre made, seemed frozen and reheated.....reheated to the point that the cheese was glued to the plate, chicken dense and thick, and the tortilla shells would crack your teeth if you had ok dental hygiene. The crema and sauce were yummy....not enough to save the dish...  After eating the edible portions that would not crack my teeth, I asked for the check and showed the waitress how tough the tacos were by smacking them with my fork, I asked her to do the same and she did and agreed, I asked her to tell the chefs not to overcook them for other customers.  She returned with my check and stated "I told them" with a worried look, and nothing else....I tipped her well as she deserved, and I left...I guess what I have to rationalize is...."well....it is only airport food"

IqE2McPSBWEPBJq2NvCYlA.text: We ordered tableside guacamole, quesadilla borracha, and a Cadillac margarita. The table side guacamole is not worth it at all, not only the size and the taste, and the chips are thick and bland.  Also the Cadillac margarita was eh; I've had way better Cadillac margaritas. The quesadilla borracha was the best thing, yet it was still mediocre. Find a better place to spend your layover.

r4UEBbsgFk5pQUv6SSFRbw.text: I'm giving Barrio Cafe 5 stars for our AMAZING and knowledgeable server- Alexzander! She helped us find delicious drinks, gluten free options, made us great table-side guacamole and modified our orders to make them perfect! She was the best and I am so thankful for her great service and kind personality!

pcf0sHagwVa5sV_6KT4jKQ.text: Pros: Drinks are good. Cons: Breakfast was cold (twice), and expensive.  We were early for a flight and stopped in for breakfast and a marg.  Breakfast came out cold.  We asked for them to pop the meals in the microwave for a minute, and would have been happy with that.  Instead, they remade the meals, which again came out cold.  By this point, we didn't have much time before our flight, so we ate some of the food, then left.  The manager was nice and apologetic, but nothing was comp'd and our meal with 2 drinks each cost about $75, not including tip.  This would never happen at the 16th street location - Frankly, ownership should be paying more attention to their chains, particularly at an airport where opinions can be formed quickly by locals and visitors alike.

sRmqP5gi9K49ujcmeEIArg.text: Very expensive  Customer comes 1st , NOT HERE  Upset if you don't order a 12 appetizer  Nothing on menu is below 12 $ You are trapped at D gates for a drink or something to eat ! That's the main reason why they are in business still.

kS8SvxVVYGWndC08Gv3f0A.text: The server seemed to think I was just a poor kid who wouldn't tip. So he was rude, took forever to bring my check and didn't even ask why I pushed my plate to the other side of the table with most of my food still on it. The Arizona burrito was a soggy pile of blandness.  Oh how tempted I was to prove him right on that tip.

TDaBQNBiIGerzqRi91bUAA.text: I don't quite understand the mediocre rating but I have only eaten here once.  I had poblano chicken soft tacos. They were incredibly flavorful. The spices were very unique and not your standard "american" Mexican flavors. In fact, save for a restaurant in San Diego, this has probably been the best tasting Mexican food that I have had in a very long time (I am from the Midwest).  The cost was what you would expect for an airport. The service was fast and knowledgeable, but it was at a slow time. Enjoy!

MtEozcWlFYdlC5A3ZEVMWg.text: Overpriced, even for an airport ($24 for a glass of Sonoma Cutrer Chardonnay?), inconsistent service (ice-cold fries and dirty wine glasses served up with a smile), and an "iconic" menu that probably will leave you scratching your head (Chilis en Nagoda? Cochinita Pibil? Comida Chingona? Ensalada Tata?).  Seriously, is this the kind of food you want if you only have a 30-minute stopover before getting on a 3-hour flight?  Perhaps if you're feeling lucky and adventurous, but me?  Not.

T6x_LwicoDEm-ivxS2C-lA.text: Come into Phoenix often for our layovers and travel frequently thoughout the country, so I'm absolutely familiar with over priced mediocre airport food. This place was a delight on my palate, the michelada mix was authentic and full of flavor, they had to have used ground red dehydrated chile in the mix and on the rim; totally worth having two! My wife ordered the green pozole woth a tomatillo base, I thought it was going to be tangy and water (True to airport style food) and I was absolutely wrong, the caldo (soup) was delicious, hearty and absolutely full of flavor; the prok was tender and garnishes were the cherry on top. I had the green chile pork burrito which was also really good, they top off the burrito woth extra green sauce which made it even better. Wasn't too spicy which is normally a downfall for me but becauae the burrito and chile verde weren't lacking on flavor there was jo need for extra salsa. For an airport restaurant this was and will be one of my top picks! I understand people complaining about price, but get over it, you're in an airport and everything you buy past those tsa lines are going to be way over priced, so sit back and enjoy your overpriced beer and fairly priced airport meal. Our server was also attentive, friendly and brought us everything we needed before we even asked. :) happy airport hopping people

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green chile burrito and Pozole in the background w/ a pacifico michelada and modelo draught

rwLt_ALnsOWScg2ZKxZgjQ.text: Went here for breakfast this morning, to try something different. Definitely should have just kept walking. I know airport food is overpriced, but not like this and for the portions given. Ordered Chilaquiles with pork Verde sauce...with no pork. It had plenty of chips, eggs, a little cheese, little salsa, cubed potatoes, with little sauce. Spoke with the Manager and he stated that he gets this complaint a lot and that I should have said something when it came out. Only thing is, is that this dish comes out stacked , so how are we suppose to know if there is no meat before eating some to get to that point. Also, it was obvious there was still a lot left on the plate when we returned it. I noticed other complaints about meat portions as well. Wish I had of read reviews prior to coming here. Just know even if you complain you will still have to pay full price and leave hungry.

Y8LF-_Dkrl8A3mNH3Ab_cw.text: Not bad food, but nowhere close to worth the price. This is a sit down restaurant so plan on staying about 45 minutes for a meal. Located in the D gates of terminal 4 at Sky Harbor.  Again, the food was good and the service was alright but I will not be coming here again.

4Da5jYD92t2BuDskaaNepw.text: Nachos only... I was very hungry when my delayed flight finally landed but really, some of the better nachos I've had.  The chips were fresh corn tortilla chips and the fresh avocado really finished off this interesting dish nicely.  Why was it interesting? The "nachos" weren't greasy at all, they were topped with sauteed spinach, mushrooms, onions and jalapenos, all sprinkled with a little bit of bleu cheese and a little bit of chorizo! The grilled chicken was almost non-existent but I didn't care because the veggies were so good.  Yes, I was skeptical but pleasantly surprised how good they were!  There was also sour cream and classic salsa on the side but you really didn't need the sour cream.  Even if you're a purist, try them if you're feeling adventurous, they are worth it. Great, quick service too - nice if you're connecting flight doesn't give you much time to eat something.

52reSpgu8ohDz4xON6Di_Q.text: This place was terrible. Extremely overpriced, even for airport food. Ordered chips and salsa for $9. Was basically a basket with like 30 chips in it. Margarita was served in a tiny glass, basically a small cocktail glass full of ice with a splash of mixer. Service was rude, almost laughed when we commented on the menu, basically said "yea we can charge whatever we want" I mentioned the small glass full of ice they called a margarita, basically told that's how it is. The host at the front was almost annoyed we even showed up, wouldn't even acknowledge us arriving. So we proceeded to walk to a table then suddenly she's interested and barks at where we think we are going......save yourself the time and just walk elsewhere. You'll be glad you did.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margarita shots. $10 a glass. What s ripoff

JumXthmAnGcb1Y5IDwuPKA.text: I have eaten here too many times to count and I will say the food is consistently  just ok, every-time it comes out it is warm.  Because it is an airport location it is expensive and the management knows people have no other option so this is how they manage it.  Anywhere else and this place would be out of business. Sky Harbor should replace them are make them step up there game.

g6Kgaj3aBcGgnj7lNlUQtw.text: We were so good, and got to the airport really early, so we had some time to kill.  This is just the place to do it.  (Hot tip:  be seated in the tequila tasting room, it is very quiet and intimate. You would never have thought you were in an airport.   We shared the Arizona burrito: pork chile verde in a burrito, topped with tomatillo salsa, and cheese, with two over easy eggs.  It was delicious and we ate every last bite.  The Bloody Mary was very good and the service was excellent.  So, if you are ever held over at PHX, this is a pretty cool place to hang out.

J_58viNFpkMGPyH_Hwduhw.text: Stopped in here for just a drink while waiting for our flight.  Like others, we were seated quickly and waited a long time for the waitress.  The service was just lousy.  Ordered one drink; a simple double shot of tequila with squeeze of lime.  The charge?  $17 for lime flavored sugar water.  Steering clear of this place on my many future travels through PHX.

UGZFt3EnC4ks7GfsNGPjtw.text: As far as airport food is concerned, this is about as good as it gets! Great service and excellent fish tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Legit fish tacos!

D9yiQFWkEltQd8nlIETBmA.text: Worst torta, stale bad chips!!  Worst food I have had in years!  Guacamole was good and service, hence one star.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

t6tCTztLK8RVaZkjWM1m2A.text: Chiliquilies breakfast came with strips of tortilla but tasted like chips. No flavor. And barley warm.  Hardly any meat at all. Potatoes tasted like they came out of a cheap TV dinner.  Overpriced.  Coffee was ok. Came hot.

iT9ZTcOobkLcdfTWv85l3g.text: Good food. A bit different selection of Hispanic food but it's all very well prepared and tasty. Prices are what you would expect at an airport, always overinflated. But, that's nothing new.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iX1bZoiHM8D0xqh_6zlu-Q.text: I was pressed for time and wanted to eat somewhere with table service in between flights. With only 3 stars in Yelp, I was a little hesitant, but I didn't have time to look all over for other restaurants. I was pleasantly surprised!!  I was greeted immediately by the pleasant hostess who seated me right away. My server was super kind and helped me with any questions I had, giving suggestions along the way.  I ended up getting the fish tacos and I'm so happy I did!!! The plate had 3 tacos stuffed full with fried mahi mahi and avocado on corn tortillas. It came with a lovely side salad with delicious balsamic vinaigrette.  Great service! My water glass was always full. My empty plates were promptly cleared. My check was brought immediately when I asked.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish tacos and a side salad! So much food! Excellent choice!

_mEMCE2fVW-aq7yDVvcvHg.text: This place is delicious. I only had 30 minutes to eat before I had to get in line for my Southwest flight. I decided to see if I could get a quick lunch. I ordered their house burrito. Yum! The burrito is slow cooked, tasty with just a touch of spice. Their salsa was also delicious.  Decor is pleasant, colorful and there are good seats at the bar.  I was served quickly and finished just in time to pay the check with my American Express, walk over to the gate and get on my flight.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A Sammy before flying is a good decision. You bet.
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My new discovery in &#34;D&#34; gates. Review to follow.

aH2Q4fGicaeFhke2d8WRJg.text: Outstanding service! Taryn took great care of me which is number one on my requirements for airport restaurants. The food was delicious (Mexican Omelet) and the drinks were perfect. In a lot of the negative reviews the comments state how expensive the food is. Really guys? It is the airport! The operating expenses at an airport are a lot higher than at a regular  restaurant. I take no issue with the prices. Great food, service with a smile and the ability to get in and out quickly? Perfect! Thanks Barrio Cafe!

UniX94D89NWjQhDkCjjwSA.text: I would say food is bad to mediocre. Cold and soggy food. Lipstick on my water glass and then new water never brought. Nice people working there, but I wouldn't eat here again.

8MKGFJMydA1TRwxvM54-pQ.text: Worst service. I asked for a water it never came, my breakfast came but no set up napkin or anything. After trying to flag someone down for 5 minutes and multiple excuses me to anyone that worked here and passed by (only to be completely ignored) I had to get up walk across the restaurant and get my own utensils from the server side station. The food is subpar especially for inflated airport prices. You're better off going to ANY other restaurant in this airport.

o4-8INYtEQZnyQlvrGbaZg.text: This was definitely not worth it. I expect these prices in airport terminals. The "quality" of the food is what I didn't expect. Mine and my husbands breakfast was not good at all. I don't read reviews until after because I like to find out for myself. My husbands chilaquiles were watery/soupy with egg on top and no flavor. My plate (chorizo/eggs)... the chorizo was super salty and the eggs had no salt so I mixed it up. I tried everything available to me but there was no fixing our plates. They were not good at ALL. This was by far the worst breakfast I have ever had. We tried to force ourselves to eat it and it was unbearable. I figure we got a bad batch of food or people who give it such a high rating just don't know any better. They're starving or don't know Mexican food at all. The waiter, Matthew, was very attentive etc. He's the only reason I'd give a decent rating but if I could give no stars for the food and the flavor and anything that revolves around that, it'd be ZERO stars.

8EKl3SLs2X-go-zq8Xrq6w.text: The service here was prompt and friendly.   Our drink order was taken and delivered quickly.   These are things I look for in airport establishments!    Our waitress was helpful in describing menu items we had questions about.   We ended up ordering both the fish tacos and the steak tacos. Neither was bad, but I wouldn't eat here again as I was not "wowed."  The French fries were blah. The tacos were meh. The best part about our meal was our adult bevvys (cold and refreshing).   Honestly, I've never had more mediocre food. I expected more from Barrio Cafe, but I won't be back again.    I look for oomph or at least a mouthful of flavor when I'm eating Mexican food. This just didn't do it for me.   I honestly think I'd be happier eating a prepackaged sandwich than what I had here.   With other amazing options in this terminal, there's no reason for me to return.

tcdIt6BGKx0MGtlvEsnG2A.text: Came here to charge my phone and have a glass of wine before my flight. Maria, my server, was very kind. I ordered a 6 oz of Malbec, which was nice.  No fault of Maria's, but my wine glass was filthy. It looked like it had been run through the sani-wash and left to air dry. Lots of water spots and little hygienic misses.  I wouldn't come back for anything other than a drink. Sorry.

pKCQ1eNjZu6SrX_f1u91IQ.text: The airport doesn't leave many eating options and this was what looked like the best of the bunch.  They have a typical type of choose your container then meat then toppings. I had the pork in a bowl with rice and beans, the helping was pretty ample for the moderately high prices.  There weren't many seats but we squoze in a small table that opened up!   I hate airport eating but this was pretty satisfying

X_UqgEPxe9YJ7lF_jCBNzw.text: Ok first things first...airport restaurant...it's all relative isn't it?  For an airport Mexican restaurant this is pretty good albeit expensive. I think the ratings are low because everyone feels so overcharged they leave feeling ripped off despite some decent to good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their especial pork tacos and fries.

oLb6ch7ocVt3vd-_aC2ACA.text: Service was awful! Will never revisit this restaurant while at Skye Harbor. Find another place....any place!   Waitress did not mention the iced tea was flavored, we took two sips and sent it back. We replaced the tea with Diet Coke & water. We ended up being charged for the tea we sent back plus the Diet Coke. (We should only have had to pay for the Diet Coke). Refills and seeing our waitress again were out of the question. At one point we took the empty Diet Coke up for a refill & were told by the bartender he was too busy to refill the Diet Coke, we would have to wait on our waitress. If our waitress was accessible, we would not have been at the bar asking for a refill. Who does that?! Definitely not a team atmosphere with the bartender.   We never did get the refill on the Diet Coke, we finally got refills on the water from another waitress after we went back to the bar to grab the water pitcher ourselves to fill it up.   My meal was messed up from the start, I ordered shrimp enchiladas, they brought me chicken enchiladas. All at the table heard me order shrimp not chicken. Waitress said she would get it fixed. Waitress never returned to our table after this. We waited forever, finally it was getting too close to my boarding time, I had to flag down the manger that seemed VERY indifferent to the service provided. The manager brought my bill out with the tea charged on the bill, tea that had been sent back, and offered no apologies for the service, messed up meal etc. I got on my flight without dinner and extra charges on my bill because I didn't have another 30min to wait on them to get it right   The service was 100% unacceptable. I don't know if this restaurant feels they don't have to provide a quality experience since it's in an airport, but they will never see my credit card again. My advice....keep looking.

7XKrDd-prJoVqVSSP0-FXg.text: Well.....I've been excited to fly out of the D gates because of Barrio. Unfortunately, the last 5 times I've been here, I can't get a Bloody Maria because they're out if tomato juice or the 'mix' Very disappointing, but the chilaquilles are always awesome..  Today I got my cocktail, but the service is very slow. I understand it's 3 days before NYE, but the terminal is almost empty and so is the restaurant.  Took 10mins to get a waitress so I could order, then I waited 10 to get the only thing I ordered...my cocktail.  Ehhh....

uTv2jCFps5epE0fDRaoTcg.text: Probably better go sit down and wait for your flight. Although I cannot comment on the food, the "Cadilac Margarita" has to be one of the worst I've ever had! I'm not even sure how it's possible to screw up good tequila this bad. More sour/bitter than anything I've ever put in my mouth. I'll be puckered for weeks........ See the pictures: Security to the rescue, this is ridiculous. These guys have offered to pay for what they had but the manager is arguing over a few bucks and called security. Stay away, this place is a catastrophe!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ridiculous, terrible customer service!
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. And to top it all off, the manager is fighting with the customers and causing a scene
Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MFt7PGYB4Dv-Rxn4gH3wRA.text: I love Phoenix airport cuisine.   Green pork breakfast burrito was awesome. My only real complaint was I asked for a poached egg and was told I had to have fried or scrambled only. $30 for breakfast for 1, I would expect more than 2 egg options.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arizona breakfast burrito. Pork chili burrito with Fridays. Looking good!

x-dTPQ1idt_ydF95NfEd0A.text: Airport food can be sometimes iffy at best, but we decided to eat at Barrio Cafe because it was one of two restaurants near our gate.   The decor is not bad considering we're in an airport, and the volume level is louder than most areas due to everybody being compacted in a small area and drinking beers.   Our server was Lori. I wasn't too impressed with her. She was all business and it was clear that she was only there to take our order and fill our drinks. The restaurant was busy as it was lunch time, but it doesn't take much to smile and pause an extra second or two.   I ordered the chicken quesadillas. I was expecting a quesadilla in the traditional sense of two tortillas with cheese melted in between. What I got was more of a street taco with melted cheese and chicken on top. 4 small tortillas with 4 small pieces of chicken. NOT worth the $16.50 we were charged. The food definitely was flavorful but unfortunately the service just made the whole experience very bland.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken quesadillas $16.50

aNWT9H5Z4UHjlQ2Uf4wLOQ.text: I read 3 stars and went really? My sister and I ate here yesterday and had perhaps one of the best Mexican lunches - ever! We had the pork tacos. She had fries with hers and I had salad. I had a couple of her fries and wow! They were superb. Some spice, perfectly cooked. No greasy fries here. The tacos....delicious. So many flavors inside I can't begin to name them all. Just knowing I can't pop in for lunch makes me truly sad. Needless to say the both of us are now fans of the Barrio Cafe!

kyrIugvcgHIm4YTTJY1DQw.text: I was referred here after being told the restaurants in the Phoenix airport were great. Our experience at this restaurant was not great. The server, Jane,  was fantastic - completely on top of it, and had our order and ticket out quickly as she knew we were in a hurry. But the food was just not good. I chose the special, the Burrito Arizona, which arrived an uninspired lump which tasted like salty pot roast. Nothing special about that. The side salad (I thought it was odd to have a choice of side salad or fries with a burrito, but i went with it) was just old. The leaves were wilted and starting to scum over, and no amount of dressing could hide that. And while the guacamole itself was good, the chips served with it were stale.   We ended up downing our beers and picking at the food. I might have complained had I had more time, but alas, we had a plane to catch.   Good thing Southwest gave me extra snacks once on board.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Old, wilted salad

YEQsqPjcPnDW_r-TYQ7zvQ.text: Sampling the menu here at the airport. Got the chicken burrito plate. It was really good they give you a lot of chicken in the meal. Chicken was grilled and well seasoned. Also ordered the guacamole side.

E4Uo2auoScLAroSOS45Hkg.text: The food was okay, not bad and not great! The prices are astronomically high even for a restaurant at an airport, $15 for 3 mini tacos and $6 for an 8 oz. horchata (rice water) drink. The cup was filled with approximately 80% ice. While this would simply cause me to never visit the restaurant again for providing little value in the equation, I write this review to warn others of a more egregious problem. When I asked the waiter for a refill, he asked if I wanted to purchase another drink and I said no, I simply want more as the cup was mostly ice and for $6, I expected more. He argued that he did not set the amounts nor was he responsible for establishing the price.   Perhaps, my expectations of adequate service in this day and age are not realistic but to have a business operate in this way with their customers seems right down nasty! While the general discourse in our society sinks deeper in the gutter, one would expect for a business that relies on customers frequenting their establishment, the common sense approach would call for a decent treatment even if there's a disagreement on the value one receives. While I know competition is limited at an airport and I know there are many out there like myself, I will never shadow their doorway and surmise many that have a similar experience will rather opt to starve.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0EysyEhbugB3ZuSJXywshA.text: Food is good for the price which isn't bad considering it's in the airport. Drinks are a strong suit and taste amazing with some good flavors and lots of TV's to watch the games going on. Service is average

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Jg0y1DLNzqjpMC-m-nYqUw.text: Poor slow service.  Overpriced and I wouldn't mind if it had vegetarian choices. Minimum appetizer $13.  Only game in Gates D, next time I'll walk to other gates.

F2GE7yjuddbkjoatsLImwA.text: The food is pretty good but way overpriced, even for an airport. The staff seems very smug and doesn't like providing any service let alone good service. This business could only survive at an airport. And you can only eat here if your flight is in at least 90 minutes.

BNPINuG1zgO_0Tka2ApDgg.text: Almost left because the description of the food was so different from what I expect at a Mexican food restaurant. I am so glad that I stayed! I had the nachos, which were definitely different from any nachos I have ever had before. They were so amazing I couldn't believe what I was eating.   If you give it a try, keep an open mind!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

X2LcAYqm_s-FvvgsJuq40A.text: Wow, worst service ever even for an airport, waited 15 minutes an no one showed.   Went back after realizing no where else close to get food and beverage. Seriously then listened to wait person complain about I was guy who left and complained of lousy service. So they waited on me immediately?   No said we'll be right with you after I'd already been sitting 10 minutes  If you're going to bitch about your customers, maybe choose not within their hearing range?!? Wow  yep worst service ever to go with over priced food and watery Bloody Mary . Try and get at least one thing right

photos.caption: Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

USgjqZuivWjkn7RgGgzHfA.text: Slow is an understatement...really not what you want in an airport place.  Boy do they make a nice strong drink though!

nMmo3bTuPSViGNJIL6fYng.text: Will never be back! Rude servers! Horrible service all around!! Kenna was not friendly at all, not once came to check on us then had to wait to get our bill... was not busy at all!

sr2EmO6qCn3dkvCeLhGp7Q.text: 1. My waitress provided great service and it weighted to the 3 stars.  2. Airport food is expensive, this is uber expensive for what you get I'm my opinion. $13 for not so great chips and ok guac.  3. The $22 dollar chicken enchiladas were pretty much bland.

9NJGDmwP87awDMR15eP3sA.text: I will start out by saying this was one of the best meals I have had this year.     I stopped by around 11:30am after running some errands in the area.  I opted for the bar as the ambience was very cool and they had a great selection of tequilas (passes on the tequila this time around, but it was enjoyable to scan everything they have).     I was greeted promptly and also served some complementary bread and tapenade.  I'll admit I have never had this combo before at a Mexican spot, but it was very good.     After looking the at the fantastic menu, I went with the seafood enchiladas.  They came out within 15 minutes.  3 good sized enchiladas with nice portions of crab, shrimp, and small scallops!   The flavors and textures were phenomenal.  There was a mild cheese along with goat cheese inside of the enchiladas - didn't make the dish heavy at all and the goat cheese added a nice tang.  It was also served with a side of veggies which paired great with the cheesy main dish.    Everything was pretty much perfect with regards to this experience.  If you decide to go with this dish, make sure you like goat cheese.  They put a good amount of it in the enchiladas.     Can't wait to head back to try another dish soon!

WEJ0Je5yreBS99wTyae9ag.text: Meh, pretty much institutional food. My food was cold and just very average. I tried the chorizo and eggs. My wife's chilaquiles also had cold chips.  Breakfast potatoes sit in a tray pre cooked, back in the kitchen. Mine probably for hours.  Service is decent and friendly, and the place offers an ambience that's better than most because it sits in the newer nicer terminal D.

ABmewlaNDgZ1MIhGP186eQ.text: I was really excited to try this place. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to the hype. Our waitress was ok, not very attentive and I had to ask to have my water refilled after she passed us several times. It took 40 minutes for our food to come out. The chilaquiles were just eggs on top of hard chips with little sauce and my french toast was underdone. The bacon was so burnt it was inedible. What were they doing with the 40 minutes. I asked the waitress to bring me the check and I'm still waiting for her to pick up the check so we don't miss our flight. It makes me never want to sit and eat in the airport again. We had a full hour to kill and we spent majority of it waiting on lackluster food.

PdA17YFdjL5IUp8Ox1s9Hg.text: It's always a nice surprise when you get through TSA without the humiliation of a body cavity check and find yourself with an unplanned extra half-hour before going through the routine of lining up for your Southwest Airlines flight. At least that's what spurred me on to give this cafe a try. I usually skip airport eateries since my track record with them is dismal worldwide. Take a look at my list if you don't believe me (list: bit.ly/2c4CL6X). This one appears quite popular as I must have tripped over at least three roller suitcases on the way to my tiny table. Getting the server's attention was the biggest challenge since everyone looked like they were getting ready to take off. I didn't have time to have lunch at the office since I tried to squeeze in too many meetings before getting to Sky Harbor. Airport prices are a bitch but what the hell since I was expensing it anyway. I decided to order the $9.75 bowl of Posole Verde, which combined bits of pork, hominy, roasted tomatillos and poblano peppers into a nice broth and topped it with shredded cabbage, sliced radish, and diced onion (photo: bit.ly/2c4DwwD). It was one of the better soups I've had, certainly at an airport terminal. I followed that with the $14 Tacos de Pescado, a trio of Tecate beer-battered fish topped with shredded cabbage and avocado slices, drizzled with a Baja aioli, and accompanied by a tiny side of baby greens (photo: bit.ly/2cxjFWm). They were pretty decent for bar bites but honestly not much more than that if you're expecting something close to your favorite taqueria. Anyway, I'm just glad Phoenix Sky Harbor has one decent dining option in Terminal 4. FOOD - 3 stars...posole was good and flavorful, the fish tacos less than stellar AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...it is the airport so guard your toes against aggressive travelers who pull their roller suitcases with indifference SERVICE - 2 stars...he disappeared when I needed to get going TOTAL - 3 stars...airport eating is a dicey proposition but this one is a cut above

MZ0Gj_-bgRQPrO0UOx93NA.text: It's so very very rare, but this airport bar/restaurant actually has decent food and good service.  The menu is limited of course but I have never ordered anything I didn't like.   It is pricey compared to most of the other food options in the terminal. However! N-6qQtfNo788qudLrUBgDA.text: Wow!  So impressive for airport food. I got shrimp quesadilla's (not what they are called on menu). Fantastic, gourmet, Mexican. Mmmmmm go there!

5PhNlOwLm8t7iVibImnwIw.text: Did the right thing and checked Yelp before choosing.  No seating at first choice, so took a chance on the lesser option here.  What a mistake. Sub par service and sub par food.  Chips and salsa - chips were thick fried so hard i ripped my mouth up on them. Salsa was good, but salsa is very hard to screw up. $9. Ordered the spicy seasoned chicken sandwich. Bread wasn't fresh and required some shearing strength to complete the only bite i took.  Went looking for salvageable contents - chicken breast was thin sliced in half, no flavor. Bunch of onions that i carefully read the ingredients to avoid. Steak fries were cold. Spicy ketchup was the best thing on the plate.  I'm writing this review from next door at La Grande Orange where I'm enjoying the well reviewed Kale salad... Should have listened to my fellow Yelpers and saved $33 wasted next door.

lrp8ojpUw_Tmj8AExYGyFw.text: Nice little spot within the Southwest Terminal of the airport, the food is pretty good all things considered, they do have some hybrid food mixing Mexican and American influences.  I had a dish that had french fries in it, was pretty decent.  If I was in the terminal, I'd definitely eat here again.

4PN1htNVZMCRc7M06_lhvw.text: I'm not sure how this place only has 3 stars, maybe travelers into Phoenix are used to the type of Mexican food served at Chilis.  I had the carne asada a la ricardo and the IPA on tap. The food was excellent, not too spicy but enough spice to linger throughout and cause a few sniffles. It was a generous helping of meat with sauteed onions, tomatoes, garlic and fresh cut jalapenos (not pickled) served with steak fries and the house salsa and spicy ketchup.  I'm a native Phoenician, and I've been missing proper southwest flavor since I moved to northern Cali and this delivered while I waited for my flight back home. It's a little pricey, but it's airport food and I am leaving satisfied, so I'm not going to subtract for that.  Apparently this restaurant has been around in south Phoenix for a while, I'm going to make it a point to stop in next time I'm here.

2qOnECN38AWrRcS_4kJo9w.text: Meh, food was fine, but overpriced (even for airport food). There looks like a disconnect between the male and female servers: the male staff looks very professional in shirts and ties, but the females (even with "dress shirts" and ties) don't look professional at all, more like what a high school girl would consider "professional." (For more clarification, the men are dressed how you expect restaurant managers to dress, while the women were a tad on the sloppy or too-casual side). My server (well, most of the female servers) was inattentive, bringing me a refill for my drink when I was clearly finished with my meal, and all of the women seemed to congregate near the kitchen or next to the bar to chat and joke. There were far too many waiters and waitresses, and they could definitely make do with fewer.

_SroTT5Mr4IIwYKXbz8LLw.text: Yes, I am the traveler who seeks - even during airport layovers - to maximize the culinary adventure. Because I don't know who doesn't need a fresh meal and a stiff drink while slogging across almost the entire nation in nine hours....  Things one needs, then: a fresh meal. I know airport-fresh should be flitting around here in air quotes, but it helps in that case to avoid any of the million ready-to-eat burrito joints in favor of somewhere you actually sit down and order from a menu. A good sign of such a place is guacamole mashed and made tableside: no sleight-of-packaging there. Another good sign of such a place is an external presence elsewhere in the relevant city; reputation matters a bit, insofar as it sets up comparison, expectation, and perhaps a bit of consistency.   And then there's the stiff drink. My flying preference is a margarita: a little salt to help you retain water and avoid dehydration, a little sour to wake up your tired mouth, and a little citrus to freshen your mind. And the only acceptable sign in an airport for one of these is that you're ordering it within the confines of a Mexican restaurant (by which I don't mean Chili's Too).  Barrio Cafe it was: a pretty good choice if you have a bit of time to kill, and similar standards for how to best slay it. While much of the menu is too pricey for an airport terminal (it'll be a cold day in Arizona when I'll pay $22 for an airport meal of anything), there are tacos, tortas, salads, and soups like posole for much cheaper. Plus the tableside guacamole, which looked lovely and which you can slightly customize to your preferences. I went for one of the tortas with avocado, cotija and queso fresco, all spread over a huge split-and-splayed poblano pepper. This isn't a buttery melty torta, but it was nevertheless so big I had to take the face off and eat it with knife and fork. Americanized? Yep, but good, with plenty of nice rolling heat from the poblano in every bite.  And the margarita was perfect. Seriously, that alone is worth a visit even if you're not hungry; it was all I wanted in a little salty, lime-y glass, and was better than many a margarita I've had at Mexican restaurants nowhere near an airport terminal. I only had the basic version, but if you're feeling a little spendier they had several variations that looked quite tempting.  Very friendly service too; I was impressed by how knowledgeable my server (Brianna, I think) was when suggesting wine to other customers. I noticed because, let's face it, wine pairings in an airport aren't usually a top priority, but she was informed, attentive, and patient. And to top it all off, the music in here was Gipsy Kings: a nice change-of-pace and something that added just a touch of perceived sophistication to my meal.  Phoenix SkyHarbor, you're off my misery list. Now let's just get some signage in the airport so people can find Barrio Cafe without having noted the location the night before....

OX4WRKqQKz-tQ2a2LJWRXg.text: Burrito pollo poblano with house salad good.

T2jnp5SVA1fwRErWVxkbTw.text: Food was good but service was terrible. Had a server named Victor. I ordered a margarita with no salt and it came out with salt. I let him know I had ordered no salt and asked for a new one. He took my drink, walked away, and then I watched him take a napkin and wipe the rim of my glass and bring it back. I really hate salt so I told him I saw him just wipe the glass, but instead of apologizing and getting me a new, fresh drink he got attitude and said I needed to taste the drink to see if I tasted the salt! Are you kidding me - how unprofessional. He then got attitude with my friend who was with me and asked if she had something to say also.  I will never go back - decent tasting taco but that kind of service is inexcusable!!

eGrZRjjpGA9h5pJ-SB3TCg.text: My daughter was ready to enjoy a fantastic lunch at this well-placed eatry. However, the way that she was treated was unconscienceable. My daughter is a beautiful brown-black girl who is open-minded and accepting of others. But these people who are descendents of immigrants from Europe, waiting on and serving my daughter wanted to strike a negative chord in the heart of a gentle soul. After their negative treatment, she left the restaurant telling them she did not want "this." And by this meaning, not just the food, but that kind of treatment. I applaud her courage.

uMPQXQ2tEbEOTdR-SUIAaA.text: Not bad for airport. The AZ style burrito was not nearly as impressive as the description. Not terrible just disappointing. Did not try the margaritas.

Ax435TvGioayqA-nRWOV2Q.text: This was a great experience at an airport. The wife and I both had the pork tacos and they were great. The spicy ketchup as it's called was the bomb and made the tacos taste that much more better. Our server was on top of it and had our tea and soda glasses always full. If you are hungry and at this location in sky harbor airport, this is a must stop.

gdr-xfjZG9XVLkiEvLJWgg.text: Do yourself a favor and DO NOT eat here! Terribly overpriced, my order was wrong, food was lukewarm, and had to ask for a glass of water 3 times - and finally received it in a dirty glass. Go somewhere else!

Ud-7nY0mxqr3LZf3eAm6pQ.text: High end dining in the airport? Well personally I thought the menu was a little over the top but I did think the margarita (pink Chevy with sugar), homemade guac made table side, chips and salsa were really good. A bit pricey but service and food were good.

Photo of Barrio Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious

q8mUJpPWmpx2okMLAt-aGQ.text: I've had a lot of airport food, most of it sucks and lower your expectations. This place is excellent. Arizona burrito with fries was delicious, soft pork with just enough sauce to make your mouth water. Be warned the catsup is spicy, a nice kick of hot sweet and salty fries to balance the all meat burrito.   Will come back again

867RhrdVwkAUUeU--l6oyw.text: I was hungry as I didn't eat breakfast before boarding my plane and Phoenix is where my connecting flight is. I ordered from the take out line. I tried ordering from the menu on the wall, but was told they still serving only breakfast and the cashier lady pointed me to the breakfast menu. So many options to choose from or the lack thereof... I ordered the Arizona Burrito which came with eggs. The burrito had cheese meat and potatoes on it. The meat saved the burrito from being too land. If I'm going to pay $13 for a burrito, it should've been a bit more tastier than this. I can get a much bigger burrito at a taqueria anywhere in San Francisco for about half that price.

zG9rQNEbSDOpvb6ITrpSvw.text: The green pozole was really good. Happy to see an authentic Mexican soup recipe anywhere, let alone an airport restaurant. Yum. Pozole gets 5 stars. However......This one star was for the service and the guacamole.  My fiance and I happen to have noticed that we were sitting next to a semi-famous rock musician at lunch (yes, here at the airport). No big deal to us, really, but our server became VERY star-struck when he noticed and was so giddy and distracted. He lingered at the rock star table, and was trying to engage him in conversation constantly. It was really annoying and our service suffered big time.   The guacamole on the menu stated it was made table side by your server, which is always awesome, so we ordered it. Needless to say we were VERY surprised when our shameless server boy quickly dropped off a small bowl of Pre-made guacamole instead of fresh guacamole made table side. Ohhhhhh K.......It's also covered in pomegranate seeds. Not exactly easy to eat as the seeds are not meant for consumption (just the red juicy part around them). It was straight up sour! Soaked in lime juice, and absolutely salty. Disappointing and gross.   I think a restaurant that advertises expensive table side guacamole should actually MAKE table side guacamole. That way there's no chance of F'ing it up with too much lime or funky pomegranate seeds. I also think focused, attentive waitstaff is a must. Barrio cafe just doesn't cut it. Get a better overpriced meal further inside the airport terminal.

oJLSqNnTjh1VQX-S4AycHw.text: Fair food and over priced. For them just getting named one of the top Mexican restaurants in the country disappoints.

tSM_oRMCyDQC8J0Uxy2mDg.text: Early for my flight, thought I would grab a beer and get something to eat ...  Now I am going to have to run to catch my flight!  So SLOW.  And they do not have blue moon on draft!  Won't stop here EVER again.  Wait staff is Terrible - no tip from me.

AzFmmEFDP44AZVMDLDm91A.text: Warning, don't go to this place if you're looking for good authentic Mexican food. This place is terrible. I was happy when I got seated right away but only to find out why. Food taste like it's from a can bought from a low end grocery store. They don't serve complimentary chips. It will cost you at least $9 and they are pretty bad. I ordered posole and it tasted like something out of a can. Maybe my expectation is higher than average but I don't think so.  The only good thing are the people serving. They are professional and nice. The cook and management should be fired. Terrible terrible terrible!  Go somewhere else.
